description:
The strawberry matcha latte drink with boba will always be my favorite drink. The boba balls are amazing here too. Soo soft and never hard :p I brought my non asian friend here to show her the boba standard, and she loved it :) 

I love that sweetness is customizable and that you substitute whole milk with oat milk (with no noticeable difference).

I'll keep coming back.
author: Corinna T.

description:
The ambiance is nice and the inside is probably one of the fanciest out of all of the boba places I've been to. It almost looks like a fancy cafe with modern decor and plenty of seating. The boba tea I thought was a bit small and expensive - a small was $4 and the volume of actual tea wasn't very much once you accounted for the ice. We got the small original milk tea with boba ($4.50) and 75% sweetness. It was pretty good but not very different from other boba places I've been to.

I think what sets this place apart is it seems more like a coffee shop than other boba places. Some of their specials include caramel and other flavors that are more traditionally seen in coffee.
author: Amy C.

description:
This location is way nicer than some of their other locations. There's an actual seating area (and good amount of it). Same kind of milk tea drinks, but with the Boba Guys spin including horchata and some fruity concoctions. I always stick to the matcha latte with boba. Like Asha, they whisk the matcha fresh for each drink, so it may be a longer wait, but it's totally worth it. The boba is sweeter than other place's, so mix it up well after the IG shot and adjust the tea's sugar content accordingly, but the consistency is always perfectly chewy.

Very nice location and the store front is quite nice. Good amount of staff to handle making drinks, so the wait wasn't too long, even with a few people in front of us. Would definitely come back!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Honestly for the longest time I couldn't understand the hype of this place. Most people recommended I get the matcha green tea  with strawberry mixed but I never really liked it and it upset my stomach. 

This time around I decided to do it a little different! I ordered the small matcha latte with their regular sweetness level and boba w/ no ice. Cost was $5 which is pretty steep for boba honestly (-1 star). 

The drink was sooo good!! It wasn't overwhelmingly sweet and you could taste the blend of matcha with milk tea just well. You could also see them whisk up the matcha right in front of you too! The boba was chewy and just elevated the drink. I think I finally found my favorite drink here. I definitely won't be always at this place but once in a while is fine.
author: Sherluna V.

description:
So, I did not like Boba Guys when I tried it back in 2014 as a pop-up. Since everyone's been on the Boba Guys fad for a while now, I thought I'd give it another try. 

I didn't like the regular milk tea with boba here (I already have my go-to spot for that). I decided to try the matcha with oat milk. OMG love. Now I am a Boba Guys fan.
author: Sophia L.

description:
I keep giving this place chances for me to love it but I can never find any tea here that I really enjoy drinking. Every drink I've gotten from here was good, but not enough for me to go to Boba Guys to fix my boba cravings. I think it's because I like my boba really sweet, and even with 100% sweetness my drinks here tend to have a very subtle sweet taste. 
I really wanted to try their onigiri but considering we  came in kind of late (6pm), there was no more left. 
One thing I like about this specific location is the place itself, full of light during the day and always friendly and fast service. The ambience of this location is really what keeps me coming back.
author: Carmela F.

description: The boba here is amazing!! It's really chewy and almost has a mochi-like taste/texture. I got the green milk tea. The tea itself was just okay and was kind of watery. I wouldn't wait in long lines for this but it's definitely a good boba option in SF!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: The best boba in the city, excited for the new bobas. Always clean but a bit slow is the only issue
author: Caleb W.

description:
When up visiting Oak Town, one must get boba. Isn't that the rule? Our host took us to Boba Guys, and we got to walk around a bit in a different part of the Bay. 

I got the Jasmine milk tea with boba and 75% sweetness. It was, in a word, perfect. The only downside is the line, so go during off hours if that kind of thing bothers you.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Was in SF for the weekend and a friend decided to take us to Boba Guys to get our boba fix for the day. I have heard so many great things about Boba Guys and I was a bit disappointed after trying a few of their drinks. 

Tried the iced coffee milk tea, iced matcha latte and strawberry Cali-pico, and they all tasted too fake-sweet. We opted for 75% sweetness level so if I ever come back, I will go with 25% sweetness level. Even after you thoroughly mix the drink together, the taste of the syrup was overpowering and artificial. At least the boba was soft, chewy and tasted freshly made. 

I do like that they give you the option to customize your drinks by choosing your level of sweetness and milk. The milk options include organic milk, almond milk and organic soy milk.

This location had several friendly workers to accommodate the large number of customers. The table tops were clean but I did not stay here long enough to look around much.
author: Carissa J.

description:
Despite the hype that goes about Boba Guys, their drinks are pretty good, but that's just me.

This location is along Octavia within Hayes Valley, so yes it tends to get busier during the evenings for some reason.

Pros: 
- Nice interior with indoor and some outdoor seating. It's also a two story building so there's available seating above.
- Menu for drinks is fairly similar with the other Boba Guys, but with the addition of different foods I'm assuming.
- Accepts card and cash
- One of those places that have very unique flavors really.
- Definitely love that they have milk alternatives. Oat milk is divine.
- They have merchandise that you can buy if you really love Boba Guys.

Cons:
- Parking is tricky.
- Their drinks are pretty pricey.
- Service is a hit or miss.

Favorite drinks has got to be the Jasmine Fresca, Strawberry matcha latte w/oatmilk, and the strawberry rice milk.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
Their boba is really chewy. I like it. I also like that they have decaf milk tea, as 99% of the boba places don't do this. I love milk tea but it wreaks a havoc on my body due to the caffeine, so having decaf is really helpful.

The sweetness levels are pretty crazy though. I got 75% sweetness and thought it tasted like 100%. I would probably opt for 50% or even 25% next time. There's a nice delicate balance here that most boba places don't get right to my liking, so I just gotta experiment.

The interior is fun. There isn't a whole lot of seating so it might not be great for obnoxiously large crowds.
author: Danielle C.

description:
We came in around 2pm on a Tuesday and just before there was a rush so we had no line or wait for drinks. The staff were super friendly and service was so prompt - I was honestly so impressed. The quickest turnaround time I've ever had for milk tea regardless of whether there's a line or not. 

I got the classic milk tea with boba. The boba was so good - the best boba I've had actually. It wasn't too hard or chewy, it was kind of the perfect texture. The taste of it was also reminiscent of herbal jelly so I liked that. I loved that the tea had a subtle flavor and super fresh tasting as well. It was creamy and light at the same time. 

I will probably dream of this milk tea!
author: Maggie W.

description:
I totally get the hype around Boba Guys now. The interior design and music playlist are both hip and modern. The drink options are simple, but also fun since they have rotating seasonal drinks. Most drinks turns out okay, but my top 3 drinks @ Boba Guys are:

-Matcha Latte
-Hong Kong Style Milk Tea 
-Hojicha Roasted Green Tea

I used to order boba toppings in all my drinks, but stopped that habit awhile back. Nowadays, I only opt for boba at certain places and Boba Guys is definitely included. I absolutely love the boba here! It's chewy, but not too chewy, think of al dente pasta but boba. Drinks starts at $4 and up. Additional toppings are + $0.50/$1.00 each. Haven't had the chance to try out the pastries, but they looked delicious from the display window so I'll need to give those a try next time.
author: Nancy C.

description:
One of my favorite boba places in the city! Not only is it two blocks away from my boyfriend's place, but there's also a great study area once you walk inside past the drinks area. My to-go order is always the machata with boba, but the classic matcha latte is always delicious too! You unfortunately can't change the percentage of sugar in the machata, but you can with the matcha latte. 

I also found out one morning when I got there around 10:30am that they don't serve boba until after 11am, so for those of you who need boba in your life, heed that for the future! There are about 3 small tables and a larger rectangular table with seating for about 6 people if there are any people in the area who are looking for a nice study place!
author: Ada C.

description:
Boba places are everywhere. It seems like there are an infinite number of ways to make boba tea or the overall experience better.

The decor is modern and stylish. The ceiling is high with lots of windows letting plenty of light in. All the drink equipment items are neatly placed behind the counter and serving area. The music is very upbeat and vibrant - great for young people.

We ordered a couple of drinks and a snack. The strawberry matcha was beautifully prepared: three layers of different colors giving the drink a nice visual appeal. It was fresh, sweet, and fruity, plus a nice green tea taste. The Thai tea was also good - rich and creamy - with chewy bubbles. 

I was surprised to see Hong Kong style toast on the menu. This snack brought back some of my childhood memories. It is a thick piece of toasted bread with sweet, thick condensed milk on top. If you like sweet, rich creamy toasty bread, give it a try. 

There are many other items on the menu that I would love to try such as the Hong Kong milk tea and other boba drinks. If I'm in the area again, I'll come back and try.
author: Yu-kwong C.

description:
Can I claim that this is the best bubble tea in 'murica? 

I've tried the original, horchata, and thai milk tea. The horchata and thai milk tea can't be adjusted for sweetness (which makes sense... since condensed milk is used for thai milk tea). 

I do refer my milk tea at 0% sugar, and this is the best 0% sugar milk tea I've ever had. Usually what I get is watered down milk with gooey bobas, but here at boba guys, I can taste the milk, tea, AND the boba is chewy and delicious. 

I'm never going anywhere else. 

Is this place overhyped? Maybe, but it is also so so delicious. 

Also, this space deserves extra stars for the space. I love the bamboo (wood?) and concrete combination in architecture as well as the patio seating towards the back of the store.
author: Teresa C.

description:
I had heard of Boba Guys from multiple people from the Bay as the best boba place in the area, so of course I had to find out for myself!

This particular store is one of many in the SF area, but is conveniently located near the freeway off ramp. Street parking there is very limited, so you may have to park farther away.

There is only one entrance so it does get crowded fast, and the line usually goes out the door. I decided to try the highly-rated layered Matcha Strawberry drink. The three layers are pretty defined and stay that way unless you shake your drink. I was very hesitant to try this because of the strange color and the unusual flavor combination, but it was a very nice surprise. The milkiness of the milk, bitterness of the matcha and sweetness of the strawberry all complimented each other perfectly. My girlfriend got some kind of special that day, I don't remember what it was called but it had a blueberry-acai type of flavor and was not as good. 

Definitely a good choice of the many boba places in the Bay.
author: Ben T.

description:
Was Boba Guys worth the hype and walking up the hill for? Yes and yes! I'm always trying our new boba places, but it's rare that I'm ever in the city. It was about 3 blocks away from where I needed to be, so I had to see what's so good about it.

Lychee green tea for me! On a semi-warm day, it was sweet and refreshing. I should have ordered a large. I drank it all within 15 minutes and craved it for the following days afterwards.

They use the best ingredients and you can really tell from the taste. You can see the baristas taking their time crafting every drink and customer service is great.

They were blasting Frank Ocean while I was there, so win win for me! They sell Boba Guys or Boba Bae shirts, but really, Boba Guys is bae. Open one in the East Bay please!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Boba Guys is always a good spot for milk tea. What I appreciate about Boba Guys is the simplicity of its menu and providing good quality milk tea. No fancy flavors, maybe once in a while, but they do the standard milk teas well. 

Aside from good drinks, Boba Guys has a clean and simple interior and a fairly short wait. There're a handful of Boba Guys out there so thankfully this one isn't always packed. Parking is a bit limited as it's all street parking, like any other establishment in SF.
author: Derek T.

description:
Saw Boba Guys for the first time on Instagram and I always wanted to try it because everyone in SF was raving about it. Well I was in SF this weekend and decided to finally check it out. 

LOCATION-I mean who drives cars in SF? Well if you do, its gonna be a bitch to find parking because its all street parking.

SERVICE-the guy that was taking drinks was very helpful because I couldn't decide on what I should get and kindly explained the difference between a Hong Kong Milk Tea versus the Classic Milk Tea.

CLASSIC MILK TEA W/ BOBA-I asked for 75% sugar and it was perfect as far as the sweetness level. Im pretty hard to please when it comes to boba because I live so close to a lot of Taiwanese tea places. In all honesty, its just your average milk tea. There was nothing fancy about it but Im sure they do use good tea leaves because thats literally what it says on their cups

It had a good hipster vibe inside the store and had a display of goodies like sweaters, t-shirts and tumblers. They had a decent amount of tables and chairs but they were all taken by hip customers with their MacBooks at the time when I was there. I just don't know if its worth waiting in line when the line is long.
author: Mindy K.

description:
Came on Sunday late afternoon just before 4 PM.

We parked about a block and a half away and walked down Haight.

The line had about 5 people ahead of us, but it was quickly our turn to order. I was extremely curious what oat milk tasted like and upon asking, the cashier asked if i wanted a sample, so I tried it. It's not for me, but you should find out if it is for you.

Boba guys is a hipster boba place. They have organic milk, almond/soy milk, and oat milk options. Their toppings (aside from boba) are all homemade. For the options they offer, (organic and homemade) I'm incredibly surprised that their price point isn't much higher than you expect at most boba joints, it's just about the same.

They have some cute buttons and pins by the register if you're feeling like swag.

We got the Rose Black Tea with soy milk and aloe jelly with 50% sweetness and less ice and a Classic Milk Tea with organic milk and boba at 50% sweetness and a Kaya toast.
The rose taste wasn't very powerful, which could be a plus for some, but could have been stronger for me. The sweetness was just on point and the aloe was very good. It tasted very fresh and chewy and natural? LOL It didn't have a overly sweet aftertaste or syrup sticking to it because it's homemade which is nice. I normally have to adjust sweetness down to 25 or 30% at most places if I get toppings because they're drowning in and secreting syrup. (Yes, I meant for you to get that mental image.)
The classic ended up tasting similar to a hong kong milk tea which i felt bad for because my boyfriend does NOT like hong kong milk tea; Yet, he drank it up anyway and had no complaints.

It's probably also good to mention that the soy milk and organic milk tasted virutally the same. They must not be flavored because it didn't change the taste of the drinks very much. For those dairy free or lactose intolerant folks (especially those that were in the boat with me before Starbucks carried soy milk without that heavy vanilla/gross/oaty flavor) this is a great place to get the dairy free boba without having to go powdered or give up great tasting boba!

The Kaya toast was delicious! It looks like plain white toast with condensed milk on it, but it has a great taste. It's challah bread with kaya jam... I have no idea what that is but my mouth is open! It's not incredibly sweet, but definitely more of a dessert. The mental feeling i had of it being condensed milk make me concerned it would be god awfully sweet before my first bite but it wasn't.

My boyfriend is a business guy and could not stop talking about how their business model and quality was incredible and makes a huge difference.
I agreed; Despite the fact that it wasn't the BEST boba drink ever, we knew we'd return to try other drinks simply because of the quality. Perhaps we chose the wrong drinks for our liking, but I'm certain I'll find something that matches my taste exactly.

I'll definitely be returning to try some other drinks!
author: Connie T.

description: Boba Guys is a hipster and Americanized version of boba milk tea.  They have drinks like horchata,  strawberry matcha,  and other flavors you can't find in a Chinese boba place.  Prices are a little higher than a Chinese place too. However,  they offer a neighborhood discount if you work or live in the neighborhood. I work near here and came here a number of times with my friend and co-workers. It's great that they offer other drinks like horchata and coffee, so my co-workers who don't like milk tea could order those.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I have heard great things about this place. So when i was in sf for a .wedding, i stopped by and got the dirty horchata, which was horchata with two shots of espresso. Man that drink was pretty tasty and also have me a jolt that i needed. The bobas were cooked perfectly. They were chewy and sweet but not rubbery. The lines could get pretty long but it goes by fast.
author: Dynaton T.

description:
~ B O B A ~ B A E ~ L Y F E ~

While some of my esteemed Yelp friends think Boba Guys' tea isn't worth the long lines (~30 minutes on average), I completely disagree. The only time I wouldn't wait in line for boba tea is when it's completely infeasible with my other plans.

We came by here while waiting for a table at a nearby vegan sushi restaurant, which had a wait time of nearly four times Boba Guys'. Sheeeeeesh..

Anyway, a very upbeat environment to be in, whether you're just stopping in for tea or if you plan to hunker down and get some work done. Lots of windows, lots of light, and lots of appropriate and hip furniture. 

Employees seem to really love working here, and I think their marketing and branding is stupendous. Really hits the nail on the head.

On my visit I got the famous strawberry matcha latte with boba. It's famous because it looks cool, but yeah, it's pretty friggen tasty too. Flavors mix surprisingly well, and the boba was perfectly cooked.

Would I return...of course! 

If you can handle waiting a bit for some dank boba tea, you should check it out.
author: Colby D.

description:
Wow! What a treat to find this place. I've apparently never had authentic boba tea until I came to this place. The employees were so helpful and explained to me what I should get. 

I got the lychee milk tea and it was perfect. Sweetness level should have been 50% buts it's still delicious. 

The strawberry rice milk tea is phenomenal. It tastes like fresh strawberries and rich creamy milk. Strawberries and cream anyone? I'm from out of state and I'd pay anything to have one in Pittsburgh.  
 
If you're a fan of boba tea you have to come here, they will not disappoint you.
author: Kirsten H.

description: Came here because the one boba guys by union square was super busy, I was never again waiting in a long like that... so glad this new location opened up. No wait, got out boba guys fix for this trip!
author: Maricel J.

description:
Before coming to the Bay Area, so many people had told me that Boba Guys was a must-try. After multiple mid-day boba runs, I can honestly say that this is one of the best boba stores in SF!

Location: There are multiple locations spread out through San Francisco. This particular location is one of my favorites because there usually isn't a long line during most hours. However, do try to go during off-peak hours if you don't want to stand in a line for over 20 minutes.

Food: They have multiple options: normal milk tea, lattes, frescas, and specialty drinks. For most drinks you will be able to customize ice and sugar level (excluding specialty drinks). Personally, my favorite is the Strawberry Matcha Latte w/ boba - it has the right amount of sweetness from the strawberry mixed in with the tartness from the matcha and milk combination. 

I would not recommend getting any of the fresca's as they taste very watered down. In addition, the Ube Halaya special has a very interesting texture - you can taste small ube (purple yam) pieces in the drink which is not my favorite.

Service: Very fast. The only bad thing would be the long lines at some locations (*ahem Union Square on a Saturday Night).
author: Emily Z.

description:
This was my first time visiting the Hayes Valley location. It's much larger than the one in Union Square (where I first tried Boba Guys a couple of years ago) and has a spacious seating area. My friend and I happened to visit  when there was no line - which was cool because there's always a line at the Union Square location.

At this visit, I had the Hong Kong Style Milk Tea with egg pudding. It was superb - as expected. The quality of the tea was full-tasting with a hint of bitterness and the level of sweetness was perfect. I also scored a couple of free postcards and stickers!

They have a good selection of other drinks besides milk teas but I simply can't resist getting their HK style one whenever I'm close by. Their boba and grass jelly toppings are fantastic too! They're a bit pricier than other places but the quality is worth it. Plus, they have friendly and efficient staff.
author: Aileen M.

description:
One of my friends raved about Boba Guys, so I made the trip from Oakland to the city to try it out. I was expecting to wait in a super long line, but luckily there was no wait at this location. 

I ordered the Strawberry Matcha Latte, which is one of their specialty drinks. It consists of 3 layers: strawberry puree, milk (I chose almond milk), and matcha. The barista told me to mix it well before I drank it. It was pretty good. The flavors balanced well with each other. I usually don't order boba (tapioca balls) with my drinks, but decided to give them a try. The texture of the balls were inconsistent...some were soft & chewy, while others were too hard for me. 

The drinks are pricier than other boba places ($6.50 for a 24 oz. with boba), but the drinks are made from natural ingredients and no powders are syrups are used. Although my drink wasn't perfect, I'd still come back and try their other drinks. 

Rating: 3.5/5
author: Sandy H.

description: Consistently good drinks. I like some drinks more than others and my favorite one right now is the coconut green tea with oat milk (hot or iced). The tea has such great flavor. I plan to buy the tea itself next time I visit. The lines can be long but they go fast. The snacks offered look good too but I've never tried them. I prefer this location for the size and the service is always great.
author: Mel L.

description: I got the strawberry matcha milk tea. It was very normal. Was not impressed, but was not bad either. It was one of those drinks that are just a drink and nothing more. At the price point, that isn't okay. Would come back rarely.
author: Wesley K.

description:
If you don't like boba, give this place a try. You'll probably change your mind.

I think what's really great about boba guys is how simple the ingredients are, but how complex the flavors turn out to be.

That's pretty... knowledgeable right!?

If there's a drink at all that you need to try, it's the hong kong style milk tea. You'll absolutely lose your mind over how great it is!
author: Alan D.

description:
My friends and I came to grab some boba about an hour or so before closing. There was only one customer ahead of us which was a plus because during the day the line can get extremely long!

We ordered three strawberry matcha lattes which is their most popular specialty drink I believe. You can get the drink either with whole milk or almond milk I believe. Whole milk is the standard one! It came out very quickly and the boba was nice and chewy. I love matcha so enjoyed my drink very much. I think I'd like the drink even more with more of the strawberry in it but that's just my personal preference! 

The ambiance of the boba shop was very chill and they played pretty good music. There was a good amount of people hanging out inside even though it was near closing time. There's plenty of seating inside to hang out with your friends! There's one bathroom in the back but you need to ask the front for the code.
author: Ha T.

description:
Growing up in the SGV, I have been blessed with having access to various boba options. When I visited SF this summer, I decided to pay this place visit since everyone had been hyping it up for me. 

I decided to order the strawberry matcha latte. I must admit that all the ingredients used to make my drink did not taste artificial which I appreciated and the sweetness level was spot on. However, I was longing more MATCHA !

Final Verdict: 
It's A-OK.
author: Annie L.

description: While in SF, we wanted a low key night to just hang out and play board games. This spot was great for it! The drinks are great! Definitely not your traditional boba tea house. I ordered the dirty horchata, which was horchata topped with a shot of espresso. Holy moly! The drink was amazing! That shot of expression made the drink taste buttery and sweet. The interior of the place was cozy and welcoming. We were able to play a 4 player game at one of the tables. We were there easily 2 hours, and it never got crowded. The restrooms are great too!
author: Anthony H.

description:
My go-to place for boba cravings when I'm at work.  They are pretty pricey, but what can I do?  It's the only option around the area.  And everything is natural/organic, although sometimes I don't really care about that for boba.  

I love their Classic milk tea, and the boba is perfect.  I do have to order with only 50% or less sweet, especially for other drinks, otherwise everything is way too sweet for me.
author: Karen L.

description: I don't hate it but not my favorite to be honest. I wouldn't be craving it on random days or wanting to come back. I think it's a preference in flavor. I don't like that the green tea is very grainy and not smooth. They are extremely sweet tho, so ask for less and way way less sweet.
author: Catherine S.

description:
I am a big fan of boba guys and have tried all the boba guys locations in sf. I ordered the matcha green boba here today and there was no taste at all. It was very plain and it tasted like water. Please visit other boba guys locations but give this place a skip.

DIE HARD BOBA FAN.
author: Manjil S.

description:
Got the strawberry matcha latte and a regular jasmine boba tea, both 75% sweetness. The jasmine boba tea turned out to be pretty sweet, even with just 75% sweetness. 

The strawberry matcha latte was very pretty with the 3 layers of color. The taste wasn't bad either, not too sweet with a hint of bitterness from the matcha.

The jasmine boba tea was what I am used to and prefer. The boba was nice and chewy as well. 

Their almond jelly is supposed to be really good too. I tried a little and it was indeed good. Perfect sweetness with lots of almond flavor.

Everything was pretty good, just a tad expensive. But I guess not so much for SF.
author: Caroline L.

description:
With all the hype around Boba Guys, I had to try it for myself. Every time I come to SF there is always a long line but thankfully this time it wasn't so bad. Don't be fooled if the line reaches outside because the register is actually stationed by the door so there's not a lot of space for you to line up. However, once you get in there is ample space for you to sit with your friends and family. 

The decor of this place is very minimalistic and modern; mainly white and black. There is also seating outside if you want to enjoy the nice weather! By recommendation I chose the coconut green tea. It definitely had the taste of coconut in it but I could only taste a hint of green tea. Although I like my milk tea to be sweet, I would prefer if it had a stronger green tea flavor to it. It reminds me of a coconut vietnamese dessert, chè. So if you like that dessert then you'll love this drink. As for my friends, they got jasmine milk tea and strawberry matcha latte. The jasmine milk tea had a strong floral taste to it but it was quite pleasant. It wasn't the kind that makes you want to gag. As for the strawberry matcha latte, it wasn't what we thought it'd be. No taste of matcha, just pure strawberry. But not only that, it tasted like strawberry syrup so we weren't a big fan.

Overall, the drinks have a quality taste to them. And the next time we visit, we want to try their original milk tea drinks.
author: Vicky T.

description:
I wish Boba Guys wasn't just in SF! Make your way south! 

Came here after seeing tons of snaps of Boba Guys' delicately layered green/red/white drinks and needing to see what the hype was all about. The SO and I happened to be in the City for an event, and luckily for us Boba Guys (BG) was literally around the corner of where we needed to be! 

Located on the corner of Octavia, sits BG with a little queue that stretches out the door. It's a cute brightly-lit spot perfect for study groups and catching up with friends. 

We ordered: 

Matchata w their homemade almond jelly
Taro Smoothie w their signature boba
Kaya Toast

We didn't wait long for our drinks, but the toast took a good 8-10 min. My drink was pretty amazing, but my SO's was even better. The taro had the same consistency as the taro filling you'd find in taro puff, a dim sum dessert. Super creamy and perfectly sweet. Kaya toast was soft and the coconut jam on top was yummy. 

Even after I made my own Snap of my drink, a friend immediately messaged me asking if a BG had opened up in SJ (I work in Campbell and it was a work-day, but took a day off to go to the City). Unfortunately not, Tom, unfortunately not... but I wish!
author: Leslie Q.

description:
Of all the Boba Guys in SF, this location has got to be:

1) Cleanest
2) Nicest
3) Friendliest 

I appreciate the seating area indoor and outdoor. The strawberry matcha latte was delicious! Also, the line was way shorter than the one on Stockton street. 

I hope you give Boba Guys a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: I'll preface this by saying I don't drink boba normally. I gave Boba Guys a chance. What I liked was the ability to adjust the sweetness of my tea. Unfortunately, since I didn't want it to be super sweet, the tea was tasteless. As for the boba, I guess it's hard to determine since I haven't had boba in awhile... and even after this experience, I probably won't have boba for another 5 years.
author: Julie L.

description: Dude.... boba guys is legittt..... I had them originally at their pop up shop in Nashville, TN. Fell for them ever since. Went up to San Francisco over St. Patrick's Day in March and stopped at this location and got their St. Patty's Day drink. The boba is always soft and chewy and never taste like they have been refrigerated and re used. Kudos to them, and their name is also catchy!
author: Yoomie Y.

description:
First time trying boba guys. Decided to get strawberry matcha latte with almond jelly: $5 for drink only for a small size...$0.50 extra for almond jelly topping. Okay price but i feel that the price may be higher than any other boba place. Anyway, you can actually taste the strawberry flavor before mixing it. But once you mix with matcha green and white coloring with the strawberry flavor, you can't taste anymore. It does taste more green tea flavor and looks when blend all three color. Sweetness was good amount. I really like almond jelly which was light with a light sweetness to it too. Pretty much your average boba drink but still good  
Theres seating if you want seat and drink to chill
Parking can be difficult but you can get lucky depending the time you go
author: Julie N.

description: Coming from Socal, I really did want to see what all the hype was about! Their flavors are creative and are pretty good to be up here in Norcal. First time I came here, I ordered the strawberry calpico because I was curious... and boy was that a mistake. I'll spare the main words, but in short my tummy was NOT doing well. I then opted for the strawberry rice milk drink which was good and now every time I do stop by, it's a must-get! My friends usually get their matcha drink. Their locations are pretty small and def hard to find seating, but a good pick-me-up if you wanna walk around Octavia st.
author: Julia T.

description: The guy at the cashier was really kind and gave good recommendations on what to try. He told me I should make my drink 50% less sweet and I could add more syrup later if it wasn't sweet enough. Turns out the drink was just right for me and their boba was really fresh and chewy.
author: Prim C.

description:
Maybe it was because I paid $5 for milk and not milk tea. Or maybe it was the rude barista. Either way, Boba Guys was overhyped!

They need to really invest in employee training and quality control. My 2 friends and I each ordered the strawberry matcha latte, and each drink was inconsistently made with disproportionate amounts of milk, matcha, and strawberry. In my side by side picture, you can see just how inconsistent each drink was. 

Being that this was my first time getting Boba Guys, I thought, "this is just how its made." Apparently, not. My order tasted just like plain milk with a hint of strawberry. Whereas the drinks my friends received tasted much stronger in matcha or strawberry. 

I stirred my drink and so the ratios wasn't as apparent. However, I went back to the woman and asked for her to remake my drink because it was too milky. Her reply in a rude tone, "it's supposed to be milky its 90% milk." 

I said, "yeah, but this drink tastes like only milk."

Her and I had an awkward starting contest for about 20 seconds. I, expecting her to take back my drink; she, probably expecting me to be satisfied with her response, and each of us just awkwardly staring at each other. 

I said, "you know what, NEVERMIND" and walked away. Until a guy asked what was the matter and that he would remake it. I assume he was the manager, but I'm not sure. 

He remade my drink with the right proportion, and the drink was good. I would pay $5 for this, not $5 for a cup of milk. 

Moral of the story kids, won't be coming back anytime soon until their baristas can follow a recipe.
author: Steve C.

description: Super hyped but the drinks itself are eh. The bobas are good though! The drinks are hit or miss.
author: Kathy N.

description: I love this location because it has a large seating area.  It also offers some sweets.  Boba guys serves amazing fruit puree, it tastes just like fresh fruit and there is a reason why everyone posts about the Strawberry matcha drink, it is delightful.  Make sure you stir it up because you definitely want the strawberry puree to last till the very end as it adds complements the bitterness of the matcha.  Love how you can get different kinds of milk, I always go for the almond milk.  Bobas are chewy and stay soft till the end but my go to is the homemade almond jellies.  Great mid afternoon treat or after dinner dessert!
author: Lauren S.

description:
Anything with strawberry here is the BOMB.COM. I don't know if their strawberry syrup is all-natural, or has crack, or has all-natural crack, but it's just THEE GRAY TEST (say it out loud).

Of all the stuff I've tried here, the strawberry matcha latte is probably the most mindblowing because 1) the way it looks pre-mixing, and 2) the way it tastes post-mixing. Also lots of non-caffeinated options like horcata (so good) and strawberry rice milk (tastes like natural nesquik, is that a thing?). The boba itself can sometimes be a little too mushy and not bouncy enough, but I can forgive that. Yes, it can be pricey for a drink here, but you're paying a premium for premium ingredients (see crack description in paragraph above).

This particular location tends to have a line out the door, but only because the ordering counter is right at the door. Once you order, your drink arrives in a second. Small seating area toward the back of the shop. Bonus points for letting me bring in a lil pup while I waited for my drink!
author: Melinda W.

description:
Well, I cannot remember how many times I have been to Boba Guys in NY, both locations. Yet this is my first time visiting its hometown. Line was as long as one could imagine (a bit shorter than in NY, apparently) so just bare with it.

Tried the hot drink this time - still my favorite jasmine milk tea, with aloe jelly added. Make sure you shake the drink well, otherwise the jelly would stuck underneath. 

Still my favorite milk tea spot, yet I would not recommend if the waiting time is super long.
author: Elaine H.

description:
I love me some Boba Guys! I've been going to BG two weeks in a row-- let's see if I go back to another location this July 4th weekend! This one is super convenient off 101 when heading into the city from the South Bay, or in my case, SM bridge since 880 was packed leading to Bay Bridge. Lucky parking spot down Octavia street's parking! We arrived at a good time because the line was just at the door with only four people in front of us. By the time we left, the line spanned the glass wall width outside.

Chocochata (Mexican drinking chocolate layered over house made horchata-- cinnamon rice milk) here has chocolate bits. Pearls and almond jelly great as always! My friend liked her natural taro smoothie, no artificial purple coloring! Mochi muffin disappeared before our drinks were made! I was hungry from the drive, despite being the passenger XD Finally tried both HK toast & Kaya toast! Each toast consisted of thick slices of fresh Challah bread made with milk and honey from Wise Sons bakery. HK style was generously spread with condensed milk buttercream and honey? drizzle. Kaya was much sweeter with creamy house made coconut jam. They serve these warm but I wasn't able to eat some for another 45 min or so, the bread texture was on the dry side. Probably much better warm so it's softer in the middle.

Drinks cost more here than in San Carlos and the Fillmore location in Japantown. My Chocochata cost $4.75/16 oz and $5.75/24 oz there vs. $5/$6 here.

*Toppings 50 cents extra:
boba, grass jelly, almond jelly, aloe jelly, chia seeds, pudding for $1

*Choose organic Straus milk, almond milk, or oat milk!

Various iced/hot tea flavors, top of the organic line milk teas, Thai tea with condensed milk, 4 variations of horchata: original, matcha, chocolate, "dirty" meaning an espresso shot, typical coffee drinks too plus seasonal fruity Agua Fresca tea infusions! They also cater to the strawberry fanatics. 3 layer strawberry matcha latte, anyone?

No protein based snacks (popcorn chicken, etc.) at this location, esp. if they run out of nori wrapped rice ball ingredients. I think they have frozen custard sundaes sometimes. Usual sweet snacks: mochi muffin, white choco matcha scone, packaged pineapple cake rectangles, prepacked pearl sugar waffles, round matcha custard cake, cookies, cotton candy in strawberry matcha and cookie butter flavors, etc. 

Didn't get to take photos but the pride balloons were very cool inside when I went-- way colorful. Loving the high ceiling/loft feel. Lots of sunshine pours in!
author: Kristine F.

description:
I have been to all of the Boba Guys locations in SF and this is the best one. Come here. 

Came in the evening and the line had only 3 people? Location is SPACIOUS AND YOU CAN ACTUALLY SIT DOWN. Like an actual cafe with internet!! And you can sit down and catch up with friends and not have to scream or squish to get straws/napkins!! 

The nice lady recommended earl grey milk tea 50% sweet - was great. Definitely coming here.
author: Vivian C.

description: I had to make sure to visit here before finishing up my SF visit. I got a matcha milk tea and a lychee green tea. It was either not as good as I remember it to be, or my taste preferences may have just changed? I wasn't as into the math milk tea as I used to be. As for the lychee green tea, it was really good for the first few sips, but after a few it just tasted very syrup-y and sweet? The inside looked like cute place to get work done, the work station behind the counter looked a bit messy though. Also I loved that the line for this location was short compared to the other locations that I visited before that one that night.
author: Gregory A.

description:
My favorite boba place in the bay! I always get their Thai Iced Tea with Pearls!! The pearls are nice and chewy, tea is sweet, authentic,.... just perfect! Must try if you are in SF! 

The Octavia st Boba Guys has some street parking spaces, and plenty of indoor and outdoor seats.
author: Jane L.

description:
This is one of the better boba places I've had in the Bay. I like how, like most boba places, you can customize tithe sweetness level to your taste. David got an iced jasmine green tea with boba and 50% sugar. I personally would've been fine with 25% sugar. The use of Strauss whole milk instead of creamer (as is traditionally used in boba) definitely gives it a different taste than normal, but I liked it. It's one of those things that's hard to describe and you kind of just have to try it to see for yourself.

I got a hot matcha tea latte with oat milk and 25% sugar and it was sooo grassy and earthy tasting. I was trying to replicate an amazing matcha green tea I had once in Little Tokyo in LA, but this wasn't even close. I think it needed extra sugar to mask the grassy taste. I'd stick with the boba drinks next time!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Oh, Boba Guys. This delicious, overpriced boba chain has really blown up in the past few years, and I've been wanting to visit the Hayes Valley location solely for their "tea people" neon sign #basic. Finally made my way here as the last stop on an SF food adventure fat day with my friend and felt that this location was mediocre. 

There's a lot of space inside for a boba guys, but from what I've seen walking by it sometimes, it's always completely crowded, so good luck finding a seat. The interior is very aesthetic, with clean black & white decor and wooden tables. There's even a second floor, which is rare in SF; however, it's closed off to employees only. The line took super long to get to the front to...I want to say we probably waited in line for 15-20 minutes, mostly in the heat outside :( 

What We Ordered:

-Matcha Affogato with Thai Tea Custard Ice Cream (2/5): This was super pretty, but it definitely looks better than it tasted, unfortunately. I've had desserts where the matcha and thai tea flavors melded together a lot better than this one. Skip!

-Matcha Strawberry Latte (3/5): This came strongly recommended to me by a few friends, and I'll admit that I ordered this just for the aesthetics. Again, the flavors just clashed too much for my liking...I was a little bit disappointed by this drink. The matcha was so starkly different from the strawberry that I had a very hard time drinking this without feeling overwhelmed.

-Hojicha Green tea at 50% Sweet (4/5): This really saved my visit to Boba Guys for me. I think that at the core, Boba Guys is still great at making just regular tea and more simple milk tea. This was perfectly refreshing with a strong, pleasant tea flavor!

All in all, this location is by far the prettiest Boba Guys location, but I still definitely prefer the Mission one and maybe even the Union Sq one to this!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
I have really tried to like boba guys. If you're into American-ized boba, this is the place for you. They don't have much of the regular boba flavors that you would find in other stores but you will find flavors like horchatta and strawberry Fresca. 

Every time I come here, I struggle to decide on what to get and I haven't found a drink that I absolutely love either. Best thing about them is their boba balls which is sweet, soft and chewy!
author: Denise J.

description:
Boba Guys is, hands down, the best boba place in the Bay Area! 

There are several locations in San Francisco with the one in Potrero being my favorite. It's next to a park, where you can enjoy your drink. This location is alright. It's not spacious (unless it's not busy) and it gets pretty crowded which makes it hard to exit out of the store sometimes. The one by Union Square and in Mission are the same thing AND are tiny. Although, each location is different, the quality of their drinks, the customer service and the staff are all the same -- outstanding! I order 24oz of iced matcha latte with regular milk and 50% sweetness every time and it's always good! My boyfriend orders the same thing except with oat milk and that, too, is pretty tasty. What I love most about this drink is how you can ACTUALLY taste the matcha and its authenticity. The boba pearls are awesome as well! It has the right amount of sweetness and chewiness. Their lines get pretty long though and they're a little pricier than most but don't let that hinder you from drinking their delicious and good quality drinks.
author: Celina A.

description:
Let me start off by saying I'm not a boba person. 

Stopped by because everyone always raves about it. I ordered the matcha strawberry and my boyfriend ordered the horchata. Horchata is... blah. My bf is Mexican so we for sure have tried way better horchata. It tasted like water downed super sweet milk with no cinnamon what so ever (haha!). The matcha strawberry on the other hand was delicious! Had the person amount of sweetness to it. Would come back for that drink and MAYBE consider another drink...
author: Juana E.

description:
This is what all Boba Tea places should aspire to become!  Definitely on our to-do list whenever we visit the Bay Area from up north.  We usually get coffee teas here, but I decided to go off script and try something new:  Strawberry matcha green tea.  You HAVE to try this tea... with Oatly milk.  

The Strawberry Matcha Green Tea is SO good (with Oatly).  It is the perfect blend of sweetness, richness, deliciousness!  I personally love Oatly milk as well (I'm switching over from an Almond milk drinker as I'm lactose intolerant).  

I love the vibe, the drinks, and the ability to really get the perfect drink that you're looking for.
author: Bryan R.

description:
This place was talked up to me, and it was really not as impressive as I was expecting. The prices are a little steep (and at least vary between locations if not seasonally) - $5 for a 24 oz. drink. I got a Hong Kong Style and my friend (who has been several times) got a Jasmine Milk Tea. In literally the most Bay Area move possible, their milk options are organic regular milk (what we got), organic soy milk, and almond milk. I have no doubt that this jacked the price up an appreciable amount. Boba is an additional 50 cents, but the tax is already factored into their pricing. I did medium sweetness (50%) and am typically someone who doesn't like super sweet things.

My qualms are as follows. They put an inordinate amount of ice in. It was at least 25% the height of the beverage, which is a great money-saving move for a business and an absolute rip-off for a customer. I would guess they do this because they put the boba in hot, which is good to know that it's fresh, but this (a) makes the drink really warm at the bottom, (b) necessitates all of this ice just to keep it around 40 degrees at best, and (c) waters it down during the summer if you don't shotgun it. I've had milk tea with boba of the exact same quality sans ice and for half of the price and without this perturbing temperature gradient in my drink.
author: B. G.

description:
The space in front of the cashier is small so there's a line out the door, but it is roomy and spacious inside! My friend ordered the strawberry matcha latte and I ordered the tea fresca. I forgot which fruits were in mine but it was on their board of specials. We both really enjoyed our drinks and I really loved how my tea fresca tasted of fruit and tea rather than sugar or syrup.

The location is clean and the staff are friendly and it's a nice walk from/to Dolores Park.
author: Cristy L.

description:
Bring your boba bae or your boba guys here! They actually sell boba guys and boba bae crewneck sweaters for $40 per.

This place (like the other Boba Guys) is almost always busy. There's usually some sort of line. This boba shop is a bit more American-ized than most other boba shops as there are no TVs with some type of Asian drama playing. It actually looks more like a coffee shop than a typical boba shop. The drinks are also pretty good. I like their Hong Kong Milk Tea and I just recently tried the Strawberry Matcha Latte which was pretty good as well. Not too sweet, but just sweet enough. I've also tried their Ube ice cream with Frozen Kuhsterd and that was really good. I'm sure you'll love the drinks and desserts here.

The employees are all really nice and they'll even offer free samples from time to time. The tea samples come in these tiny beakers. I was offered Rose Black tea and that drink was not as sweet as the other drinks that I've tried here. They also have these nice and unique postcards along the wall if you wanted to grab some. There are some tables if you wanted to bring your laptop to do work. They even have free WiFi here. Don't think there are any outlets though. Parking is also a bit harder to find for this Boba Guys location as it is all street parking.

I would recommend Boba Guys and this location still supports that thought. Definitely try the Ube ice cream if you're in an ice cream mood or the Strawberry Matcha Latte if you wanted a non-milk tea drink!
author: Alvin Y.

description:
I have heard about Boba Guys for a long time but I finally got a chance to try last weekend and it was GREAT.

I ordered Matcha Latte w/ Almond Milk & the Mochi Cake. Love them both! The Matcha Latte had a really strong matcha taste, which I like a lot. Mochi Cake I used to get it from Asha, glad they are also in Boba Guys. Kinda sad that I missed the Matcha Custard. Definitely will revisit again in the morning so that I can try the popular matcha custard!
author: Clare L.

description:
I gave into the hype and decided this was going to be a stop for my SF trip. 

There were a variety of drinks-- they have your basics/ original teas like Hong Kong Style Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Taro, Fruit teas etc., but they also have their Specialty Drinks, which is what everyone instagrams. People do it for the gram!! The Matcha Strawberry looks cool, but the idea of mixing matcha&strawberry didn't sound like a good combo to me. So I opted for the original matcha latte with almond jelly and 50% sweetness. The almond jelly was fresh, but not as almond-flavor-y as I expected. It was also on the more bland side. Tried my friend's matcha strawberry and it tasted like strawberry ice cream, which was slightly underwhelming, but the boba was definitely good, meaning good consistency and fresh! I wouldn't go out of my way just to get boba/ tea from here. I mean if you're in the area and wanna try it, sure! I've had more flavorful matcha lattes in SoCal. 

Parking: Welp, it's SF. If you can't find residential parking around, might just gotta keep circling man.
author: Christy Q.

description:
There are a gazillion boba places in SF, but deep down, I prefer Boba Guys (except for their Mission location- that one is not bueno due to poor quality drinks). 

I recently had the chance to visit their Hayes Valley location and I was immediately impressed by the space and the minimal decor. I have always visited their Union Square location (quite cramped tho), so I was happy to see this location being more of a sit down cafe setting. 

My Hong Kong Milk Tea with boba did not disappoint. Even at regular sweetness, it was not overbearingly sweet like other boba places and I appreciated the warm, freshly made boba! I could tell that Boba Guys have trained their staff well to provide quality milk tea and boba.
author: Eva L.

description: Ordered the large Jasmine Almond Milk Tea 75% sweet ($5) and it's pretty good! I really enjoy the creaminess of milk tea, so I probably won't be ordering the same drink with almond milk next time. Even though it was 75% sweet, it was still REALLY sweet. Would recommend the next level of sweetness down personally. However the tea was very strong and fragrant 10/10! Even thought it looks a little watered down from the almond milk, it's def not watered down and it's still very flavorful and tastes like traditional milk tea.
author: Sarah C.

description: Shorter line than the Mission location (4pm on a Saturday - and by the time we left, there was no line). Bigger space with more seats. My boyfriend got a Classic Milk Tea with boba and it was as good as always, the boba perfectly soft and chewy.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Definitely a  premium when it comes to boba/tea shops. Boba Guys offers a few flavors that you probably wouldn't find elsewhere in quality that is, generally speaking, second to none. 

I ordered myself a matcha latte with almond pudding at 75% sweetness. The barista warned me to really stir up my drink and she definitely wasn't lying - the honey stuck daftly to the bottom of the cup then to the straw. Some sips definitely tasted more like I had ordered a honey milk tea than a matcha latte. Overall, this drink definitely hit the spot on a warm San Francisco day.

I especially enjoyed the seating at this location. The huge windows allowed for a lot of light to flood in providing that nice, modern cafe feel. There was also no pressure to leave although when the shop got full, I definitely got quite a few bumps from behind while people waited for their drinks to be delivered.
author: Elaine Y.

description: 4 stars for what I had today (kiwi guava with tapioca), but probably will update. The tapioca was amazing: chewy, sweet, and not too dense. The tea, however, was both too sour and too sweet, with sugar crystals when they weren't expected. I've been told the non-fruit teas are the way to go, and the tapioca is reason enough to go back.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Love the brightness and airiness of this location, & love that there's actually seating! 

I sometimes (not often) deviate from my Jasmine milk tea with almond jelly to indulge in a couple other bebidas on the menu. Condensed milk makes their Hong Kong Style tea so sweet, it doesn't need anything else (I'm writing a note here to remind myself it wasn't all Love the past two times I've ordered this...) And although I'm generally not a fan of matcha tea (so very grassy tasting!), I sometimes order a Strawberry Matcha Latte because the combo works; the only problem with that is I don't stir & end up drinking all the yummy puréed strawberry goodness & kind of messing up the delicious balance! 

Going outside with drink in hand, sunglasses on makes me feel jolly AF!
author: Fancypants X.

description: I love Boba Guys! It's becoming my weekend routine now to get some boba as a pick-me-up before Monday hits. Among all the boba places in SF, Boba Guys is one of my favorites! Super clean, brightly lit, friendly staff, and creative flavors! Growing up in Taiwan I know what good old tradition boba tea should taste like, but I gotta say, I love the creative twist of some of the flavors at Boba Guys, as well we the option to sub with oat milk! My go to flavor currently is Strawberry Matcha Latte with boba, I go full sugar and 25% ice, I've got crazy sweet tooth so for most ppl you might want to scale down on the sugar level lol. One tiny complaint regarding my last visit to the Hayes Valley location, the amount of boba was definitely way too little considering I got the large one. Hopefully they were just too busy that Sunday and was just trying to rush through all the orders so missed out on the portions.
author: Johanne L.

description:
Despite living in the Bay Area for years, I hadn't gotten around to trying Boba Guys until about a month ago. They are definitely worth the hype. 

This is seriously some of the best Boba I've ever had. Their Thai tea is amazing, as is the Strawberry Matcha Latte. 

I'll definitely be going back when I visit the Bay.
author: Merisenda A.

description:
This place is a very consistent! I haven't been disappointed yet and plan to keep coming back.

So far I have liked every drink I've tried except one but not because it wasn't made well, just preference. My favorite flavor milk tea is the premium Muscat Oolong. I like both the raspberry pineapple tea fresca and the strawberry jasmine tea fresca. One of their secret menus is the raspberry pineapple tea fresca with calpico on top. I didn't like this combination because it was too tart and I have more of a sweet tooth so i would've preferred the drink without it. Boba is always the perfect texture and sweetness.
 Customer is super friendly and very quick when the line gets long. Good amount of seating but they could use some ventilation besides the back sliding door.

If you're a part of a business in the Hayes valley area, let them know for the neighborhood discount.
author: Laura Y.

description:
Finally made it out to this Boba Guys location after wanting to hit it up FOREVER! 

As always, I am giant fan of their drinks. I usually gravitate towards the coffee milk tea and the thai tea because I literally have not had better versions of either drink at any other boba place. Super delicious. And well, with a name like Boba Guys, you can only expect that their boba is bomb. Right amount of chewiness and a good balanced flavor.

I love this location because there is a good amount of seating. You can grab a drink and sit down/chat with your friends for sure! I also liked that they had the bottled milk teas at the front. because I was able to grab a drink for later! I enjoyed trying out a few different tea samples while having my boba as well. 

Overall, another great Boba Guys spot for tea! You should definitely drop by if you are in the area.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
My first time at Boba guys! Sunday at 5 30 before close, there's a line out the door. But it was worth it!

I got the jasmine milk tea with 75% sweetness.
It has a very strong floral flavor, and at 75% it wasn't sweet enough for me. They do offer to make adjustments, but I found it too busy to ask!

MAtcha strawberry with 75% - way too sweet for me! But it was definitely delicious!

I would order the two drinks again but perhaps get the match strawberry at 25% and jasmine at 100% sweetness.

The inside is very cute and hipster pairing for wonderful photos for foodies!

As for the boba! They were sweet and chewy! Not over cooked! The best I've had!
author: Sandy C.

description:
Is boba guys overrated? I don't think so. I think they serve high quality products. Is it more expensive than other boba places? Probably but sometimes you have to pay more for better quality ingredients. I mean they use Straus organic milk for god's sake! 

I think they have good variety of tea flavors but not so overwhelming like other boba places who might have 50 different types of drinks and 25 different types of toppings! They also  serve almond milk and soy milk for those who don't drink regular milk. 

I typically just order the classic milk tea or the jasmine milk tea. I recently ordered the black rose milk tea, which was pretty good although I would like it to be a little bit stronger/darker/ more concentrated; it was a bit too milky for my taste. I like that you can specify the sweetness level. 50% sweetness is just perfect for me. I'll be back to try other flavors.
author: Sam M.

description:
I love boba guys! They have a unique selection of boba that you don't normally find at other boba places. They have high quality boba, teas, etc which makes up for the price! 

The lines can be suuuper long but they go by quickly because the workers work at a fast pace :) so don't be discouraged to not get boba guys because of the long lines! Parking is hard to find but not impossible! 

My favorite is their Jasmine milk tea with boba and my boyfriends is their coffee milk tea! Two simple drinks but really good!
author: Katty X.

description:
I was really impressed by the size of this location. I love the spiral staircase behind the counter too. The overall atmosphere of this location is nice, everything is white and airy, like their other location. This is definitely a go-to spot for boba and hangout...if you can find parking.

I came on a Thursday afternoon. As usual, there was a line, but it went by quick. I tried their chicken rice ball (looks like a triangular spam musubi) and it was a great snack! Good flavor and served warm, yum!

My absolute favorite drink is the Iced Matcha Latte almond milk with 25% sweet. Their teas are definitely premium/authentic tasting and so refreshing. However, their boba is nothing special. Kind of hard in my opinion. I prefer their almond jelly, which has subtle sweetness.

Boba Guys needs to up their game by having a point system like Tea Pumps and maybe even online ordering!
author: Christina L.

description:
Yes, I would definitely consider this place as having the best boba in the city. But, being that it is the best boba spot in the city, $5-6 for a drink is expected. The wait for this Boba Guys is more bearable compared to the one in Union Square. Also, this shop itself is bigger and also has seating inside. 

My go-to favorite drinks are the Hong Kong Style Milk Tea, Dirty Horchata and Matcha Latte. Get them all a little less sweet and of course, with BOBA. It is literally the place with the best boba ever, perfectly chewy and soft. MMM doesn't get any better than this!
author: Nancy L.

description: I thought is something new I haven't tried... the hype is not so real here. The wait was a dragged 40 mins wait.. 20 mins wait once ordered.. there goes 1 hr just waiting to get a boba drink. It tasted alright nothing over the top.
author: Hannle P.

description: The guy at Tea People made us such refreshing and tasty drinks (mock tails). He was also super nice and knowledgeable about Tea and where the teas are coming from . Definitely worth a visit
author: Deki T.

description:
My SO is a boba fanatic and Boba Guys is his absolute favorite.

Location/Seating: 
- This location is so much easier to get to than the other ones. 
- Located on the corner of a main street, it's easy to find parking and walk over to the location.
- Plenty of seating, both times we came in the afternoon and had no trouble find a seat for two

Drinks: 
- We ordered the Jazzcat, Strawberry Matcha, and Coconut Green Tea. The Jazzcat was my favorite one. The boba super soft and chewy, not tough in the middle.
1) The Jazzcat was very light and mixed with green tea. It is almost creamy, does not remind me of grape like the menu suggests. I was able to sub it with almond milk.
2) The Coconut Green Tea definitely had a coconut flavor but I would pass on it. It would be fantastic with flakes or pieces of coconut in it. 
3) Strawberry Matcha
- Don't remember much about this drink but I was tired by the end of the drink because it ended up being too sweet 

If you haven't tried Boba Guys, I'd recommend stopping by and checking it out. This location even has tea tastings for $10 which is a cool aspect and would be nice to do for an activity.
author: Pryscilla T.

description: Too sweet. Everything. Is too sweet. But the place looks like a nice place to hang out.
author: Byron L.

description: I'm really surprised that I'm giving this place such a good review considering I didn't really like it the first time I tried it. I had tried some kind of coffee milk tea and wasn't a big fan. I returned only because I had seen really good reviews about their matcha. Because I'm a very big fan of matcha and there was one close by me, I gave it another shot. The barista was very helpful when I asked her what she recommended, I definitely prefer sweeter drinks so I took her advice on ordering the strawberry matcha. It was sooo good! I was honestly surprised at how much I enjoyed it considering my previous visit, it seems like an interesting combination but it's definitely a drink worth trying!
author: Monica M.

description:
We were going to grab some crepes, but weren't too hungry, so decided on boba. Neither my friend nor I have gone to this place, but have heard about it.

I agree with another post here that this place is pretty westernized. Totally hipster and a trendy joint. Most drinks look like an Instagram dream. However, my friend and I lean toward more traditional milk teas so he tried the Hong Kong style and I the classic.

A few notes: they use condensed milk for their Hong Kong drink so you can't customize the type of milk used. It is also a bit on the sweet side. For the classic, I ordered it with less ice, half sugar, boba, and almond milk. I personally thought my drink was a bit watery (even with less ice) but it may be due to the almond milk, I don't know. 

Overall not that amazing of an experience for us. The food looked good though so I may consider coming back for that. The lines can also take a while, so be prepared for that too. Once I put in my order the drinks came pretty quickly though. Overall I'd say 3.5 stars; I'll bump it to 4 stars since service was decent.
author: Kathy O.

description:
Location: Very limited street parking only; would definitely recommend not driving here. There's a few tables inside. 

Service: Great team and drinks come out very quickly. Don't let that line intimidate you! 

Drinks: I like to consider myself somewhat of a boba expert (haha, I really am not..) but Boba Guys consistently blows me away. Their balls (lol) are always on point and their drinks are delicious every time. My favorite is the Strawberry Matcha Latte - creamy matcha goodness with a tart finish.
author: Shelley K.

description:
Boba Guys has definitely been my go-to boba spot whenever I'm in SF. Though on the pricier side for boba, I think that their drinks are still worth it for the quality of ingredients and taste.  I've been to both this location and the one in Union Square, but so far I think that I prefer this one in Hayes Valley because the store is much larger with a nice ambiance for sitting down and hanging out with people. I came here on a Friday evening around 8:00pm with some friends, and there was not much of a wait. 

*DRINKS*
Price for drinks range from $4-7 depending on the type of tea and additional toppings. My go-to drink is the Hong Kong Style Milk Tea, which has been very consistent and has the right balance of sweetness and tea. It is a bit on the sweet side because they use condensed milk, so be sure to ask for 75% sweetness if you prefer something less sweet. A regular size with boba came out to be $4.50, and the boba was cooked perfectly being both chewy and sweet! I would also recommend their Muscot Oolong Milk Tea and Horchata Milk Tea. 

*LOCATION*
Though there is parking right next to the store, it is not that easy to get. Every time that I've gone to this location, I've always had to drive in a circle a few times before a spot opened up close to the store, which is on the corner of a busy street. I would recommend looking for parking in the small streets that connect Octavia and Gough St. Besides parking, the interior of the store is very nice with white walls and fancy chairs to add to that hipster environment. There is a lot of seating with tables and bar stools to watch the baristas make drinks. 

*SERVICE*
Great service with friendly baristas. My drink came out within 5 minutes of me ordering, and the workers are very accommodating with making adjustments.
author: Christine V.

description:
My favorite Boba Guys location in the city, open space and lots of seating options. Come here for the tea flights! I love the experience of being educated by a tea expert and getting extremely caffeinated - recommend sharing a flight with one other person. It was great to try all the different types of tea, steeps and chocolate samples. Get the Kaya toast if you're craving a snack!

My favorite drink here is the Strawberry Matcha Latte, I love how fresh the puree is and how special it is. I can't find another boba place in the city that has such a wide variety of unique flavors.
author: Chelsea W.

description: Came here to meet up with some friends after work hours. Even though I had heard about this boba joint chain many times, I had never been to one until now. As this was my first time ever at this joint, I decided to get a black milk bubble tea, which is essentially my litmus test drink to see how good this joint would be. After further evaluation, I'm glad to say that this place is a decent boba joint. Drink-wise, the milk tea was smooth & consistent, the boba was great in consistency, and the taste was great due to uniform consistency and so forth. As a heads up, you can also adjust toppings (boba, almond or grass jelly), milk (organic, almond, soy), and sweetness levels. This joint also offers premium milk teas & specialty drinks, which are definitely worth a try. I'll have to do so the next time I'm in. All in all, a great boba joint worth getting your boba fix at.
author: Jack M.

description:
Now that I've been here a few times, I feel like Boba Guys is more on the overhyped side of tea establishments.  Don't get me wrong: the Octavia Street location has an open, airy ambience that makes it a nice place if you are looking to lounge around and enjoy your beverage.  The prices are a bit higher than average but not too far off from other Bay Area bubble tea establishments.  The fact that they pride themselves on their use of high quality ingredients is something to be commended.

However, I always leave feeling like their drinks are on the "meh" side of things.  I most recently tried their matcha latte, and it was overly sweet with a underwhelming matcha flavor.  I thought the boba was nicely chewy, so that's a plus.  I just don't think this will ever be a must-visit place if I'm in the mood for bubble tea.
author: Keith H.

description:
Boba Guys has definitely become one of my more favorable teashops. The drinks can be quite pricey, but they use the most authentic ingredients and create their concoctions down to a science. I usually get the Matcha Green Tea Latte, but decided to change up for the Lychee Rose Green Tea ($4.25). The neat thing about this location is that they have seasonal items, so there's always something different to try.

The drink itself is pretty standard. Be weary of how sweet the drinks are as I would opt between 25-50%. They also have alternative for the dairy in the drink and I love that they have a soy milk option although I believe they're replacing it soon. We sat at the counter and the worker there was testing out the oat milk replacement to the soy milk. It was super awesome how much goes into creating the drinks. He even let us sample a couple of his batches!

This is probably my favorite Boba Guys location with the seating and high ceiling windows. Grab a bar seat and watch them make the tea --just as fun as people watching.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
So hyped up! Sure, this place is cute and hipster looking but the drinks were just aight. Maybe it's because I'm biased towards Boba Truck, but this place was nothing special.

I got their popular green tea latte drink, half sweetened. It was kind of watery. Their milk teas were just okay. My sis got the strawberry yogurt drink. That was just okay.

I think this is a place you should try at least once to get your Instagram pics.
author: Cynthia J.

description: Tried Boba Guys when I visited SF a month ago. I still think about the strawberry matcha drink with oat milk like every other day. It is one of the most delicious drinks I've had... and I can't have it as frequently as I'd like. I am obsessed with this drink and I talk about it all the time. I heard they are expanding to LA. I hope this is true!!
author: Dayae K.

description:
Nice location on Ocatvia but not a huge fan of the Boba Guys franchise although I acknowledge that some people are. 

The service at this location however is very good and when I go at least they usually aren't very busy. Boba Guys does a good job of finding locations as well where there aren't a lot of competitors nearby or maybe it's the other way around where competitors don't want to be by THEM.... 

I think that some of their "other drinks" are good but for me their "regular boba" is not that good compared to other venues. 

I have boba guys at a 5/5 on the milk tea taste/boba taste in my ratings scale. 

Rod M tours San Francisco area in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  I have a more comprehensive Tiered Bay Area boba list 104 boba spots and counting. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #42  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible

* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.  A place could have a higher Yelp rating than it's boba score would imply , if it sells things other than Boba that are good. 

SF/Daly City Rankings:

1 Itea,2 Puppy bobar, 3 Caffee Central,4 Cool Tea ,5 The Boba Shop,6 Little Sweet, 7 Good Earth Café, 8 Hanlin Tea,9 Keep it ,10 Wonder Tea,11 Enter the Café, 12 Urban Ritual  ,13 Tpumps,14 The Ramen Bar,15 Eightea, 16 Super Cue, 17 Enter the Café,18 Steap  19 Tea Hut , 20 Sharetea , 21 Tanca, 22 Boba Guys, 23 Steep, 24 T&T Café, 25 Bobo Drinks & Pho , 26 Samovar Tea, 27 5 sweets, 28 Kestourine Macrons, 29 Asha Tea House, 30 E Tea , 31 Little Heaven Deli, 32 Maggie's Café, 33 Belly Good Café and Crepe , 34 Tea Bear, 35 Sweet Heart Café, 36 Honeycreme, 37 Elixiria, 38 Quickly, 39 Plentea, 40 Mi tea, 41 Ten Ren Tea, 42 Wonderful Foods/Desserts , 43 Out the Door, 44 I Café 45 Phusion 


Just a little taste of my greater Bay Area Tiers is below (there are 6 tiers I have in total, I've reviewed over 112 + boba spots now but obviously not enough room to list them all here) 

Rod's SF Bay Area Boba Tiers: This is based on my milk tea taste/ boba taste rating scale with 10/10 being the absolute best.  I have actual ranked lists for the South 880 corridor and San Francisco in case you're wondering. 
Tier 1 (Alphabetized) "Magnificent 4" aka" I'll get some even if I shouldn't..."
Bubbly, I-Tea, Pekoe, Teatop

Tier 2 : (Alphabetized) "The Almost Elite..but not quite" aka " I'm a fan but not a die hard" 
Caffe Central, Cool Tea, Factory Tea Bar, Good Earth Café,  Gong Cha, Hanlin Tea, Little Sweet, Passion  T snacks and Dessets Puppy Bobar, Soyful Desserts,  Tea Station ,The Boba Shop, 

Tier 3 (Alphabetized)  "The Above average spots" aka " Sure why not..let's roll" : 85 Degree, BlackBall Desserts, Bobapia, Cha Express, Che-Lo, Keep it, Super Cue, T4, Tastea, Tata Tea, Tea Six,  Tea Station, Teaspoon, Teatime, The Ramen Bar, T-Lab, Tpumps,Urban Ritual, Wondertea,
author: Rod M.

description: Came here after a workout session and ordered a Strawberry Matcha Latte, Coconut Green Tea, and a Classic Milk Tea with boba. You order at the counter and pick-up at the end of the counter. There's plentiful seating inside and upstairs. Decor is cute and they sell cute swag and other goodies. I gave their matcha muffin a try, which was dry so it wasn't quite enjoyable for me. The matcha flavor was there though. We also bought the Strawberry Matcha cotton candy to try, and it doesn't taste as good as the drink. I bought the cotton candy and went to the end of the counter for it, but after awhile, I asked and they said I was suppose to grab it from the shelves on my own... would have been nice if the cashier told me that. Strawberry Matcha Latte is my favorite here so far and the coconut green tea was also tasty if you like coconut. Drinks are good, food not so great.
author: Amanda C.

description: I've been dying to try Boba Guys for years and today I finally got the chance! I ordered their classic milk tea at 75% sweetness and really liked it! It was not very sweet at all, a little less sweet than I usually like it, and the boba was extremely squishy and tasted like honey! The boba was definitely the highlight of the drink and next time I'll be sure to get it at 100% sweetness to give it an extra something~*~ I will definitely come again when in the area! ¨
author: Lizzie W.

description:
I'm pretty sure i come here every time I come out to sf. The coffee milk tea with soy and boba is my go to order. I like how they don't charge extra for soy instead of regular milk. Very considerate. I also love the tapioca boba pearl things here, it's not too gummy but also not super like mush and taste not overly sweet. 

The drink itself does have a solid amount of caffeine in it too. 

There's really not much to say. Interior is very nice, kinda small. Line goes out the door most days. Service is good. My friends and I are always coming back here because it's delish and not too pricey.
author: Mariah L.

description:
FOR SURE MY FAVORITE BOBA PLACE BY FAR! Again, FOR SURE MY FAVORITE BOBA PLACE BY FAR!

I've tried practically their whole menu and my default is definitely the Strawberry Matcha Latte with Boba. Mix it well because when you get to the matcha part it will get kind of bitter because of the natural taste of matcha. Instagram it first before mixing because it will turn into a murky color after.
