Boba has nice texture and just enough taste and sweetness to blend with the flavor of the milk tea, matcha, and strawberry compote.

Whenever I'm in SF, I always try to go out of my way to go here. Even when I went to New York, it still tastes the same! It's crazy how consistent this place is across all locations in SF AND NY
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Finally tried this place and thought it was just ok. Don't think it's the best Boba in sf. And since I am from socal, it's definitely not the best Boba I've ever had. 

I'd give this place a 3.5.

Came here on Sunday at 12:30pm. Since they opened at 12pm,there was no wait. Thank god! Because I would never wait in line for Boba!!!

Had the Hong Kong style  (black tea) with Boba. Changed the sweetness to 50% which was perfect! Boba was good,  it was soft and sweet. Also tried the strawberry tea Fresca. It was refreshing as well. Liked my drinks but I wouldn't go out of my way for it and definitely wouldn't drive around looking for parking for it. So I'd definitely be back if there's no line and parking is easy to find.
author: Caitlin P.

description: Boba was good but customer service sucks, the girl who was making our order was just looking at us up and down and she looks like she hated her job. The cashier didn't even greet us, didn't even smile, she just stood there and took our order when we were ready.
author: Florence J.

description: Great boba, all manner of milks and add-ons, and they'll make you a new drink if you don't like what you order.  The cakes are awesome too.
author: Vipul V.

description:
Boba Guys has always been a favorite boba tea shop of mine, and I was so happy to start working near Van Ness so that this location is only a short walk away! 

I've been a few times now and everything is just as good as their original location! My favorites are the HK milk tea, matcha latte, and the strawberry matcha latte. I also saw on their specials menu that they have a mango fresca matcha drink... Say whaaaattt!!!!? I'm definitely going to try that drink next time.

Service is very friendly and they are willing to recommend you drinks. I went with a large group of my coworkers and they were really accommodating and got the drinks out super fast! The ambiance is really cafe-like instead of boba shop-like (lol), considering that their other locations are a bit smaller. I saw a few people on laptops doing work which was cool. They also sell merch here, the "Boba Bae" sweater is so cute!!! Maybe one day i'll be willing to fork out $40 for that.. One day!! Haha.
author: Tara A.

description:
Very interesting bougie boba place. I really like the inside decor! This is a place for when you feel like treating yourself to higher quality boba.

I ordered the iced matcha latte w/ boba. I can tell that this place is of higher quality when I noticed that they use Califia Almond Milk! Califia Almond Milk is actually one of my most favorite almond milk brands because it tastes more like almonds and it is carrageenan free, meaning they do not use a thickener for the milk that causes digestive problems. I also knew this place sells high quality boba when I saw that they actually whisk the matcha green tea powder. The matcha powder, I can taste, is purer than the matcha powder at Starbucks because the matcha powder at Starbucks actually includes a lot of sugar and is of a lower quality. Here, the matcha powder doesn't have any added sugar. 

The boba came warm and was very sweet. I do suggest you request the sugar level to be lower than 100% because the boba itself is really sweet so it compensates for the lack of additional sugar. 

Overall, I would come back to this place if I can and I would like to try the other drinks on the menu. But since it is a bit on the pricier side, I wouldn't go here every single day.
author: Iris C.

description: Such a hipster boba place. Hahaha. Maybe just this location though. Been to the other one near Chinatown and that one was smaller and no fuss. This location is a lot bigger than it looks on the outside. We walked in for a after dinner drink. I got the strawberry matcha latte with tapioca. Suck a pretty drink - they layer it with the matcha, a cream and the strawberry puree . But you need to mix it up to drink it. The matcha flavor is the overwhelming flavor but you could taste the strawberry too. Still very tasty and the boba was nicely cooked. Pricey drink though - $5 and and extra 50 cents for the boba. I didn't see the seasonal drinks on the side wall - I would've considered those too. The main menu has their usual drinks. And we sat for a little bit enjoying the drink.  Every table was taken. We found a bit of counter space but it was pretty busy for a Saturday night. Will be back to try their other options.
author: Alison W.

description:
Boba Guys Hayes Valley is now sampling their nitro cold brew Oolong tea - it's really interesting, not sure if I would order it, but awesome that you can taste some innovative concoctions at their tea bar for free!

* Matcha Almond Milk Latte - Add Almond Jelly - 25% sweet - 5 stars: My Go To.
* Boba Guys Sundae - Almond Jelly, black tea ice cream, tapioca. The ice cream was a little icey but I LOVED the flavor! Would order again but just want two scoops of plain ice cream!
* Jasmine Milk Tea - I love their Jasmine but it's best with regular whole milk, not nearly as good with almond milk.
* Matcha with Strawberry - Another go-to but on the sweeter side (can't adjust sweetness)
* Fresh Taro - Pretty good but since I'm not a taro expert I can't speak much to this.
author: Jess C.

description:
Super long line. 30 min wait with lines down the street and around the corner. When we finally got our drinks (jasmine milk tea and hk style milk tea), the drinks were really watered down. Considering we ordered one hot drink and one cold without ice, i cant imagine how it would taste if we had ice. 

This review only has stars because the girl who took our order was very friendly! The interior was also modern and clean.

Unfortunately because of the watered down drinks, we will not be returning.
author: Claire W.

description:
I've always wanted to LOVE Boba Guys but unfortunately, I just don't fall into the hype. I appreciate their mission in using the highest quality ingredients but tbh.. there are a lot of other better tasting boba shops that also provide that without the steep price. 

While they don't taste bad, their drinks are just average. Never have I left boba guys and been like
OHMERGAWDD I NEED TO COME BACK. 

If you do come here, I'd recommend going with one of the simpler tea drinks that aren't all fancied up. That way you can really taste the tea, which I'd actually give 4 stars. 

I honestly wouldn't recommend any of the dolled up drinks (strawberry match latte, black sesame latte, horchata latte) because it compromises the taste of the tea and becomes this overly sweet drink you, unless that's what you prefer. 

Overall 3.5 stars for Boba Guys. 3 stars because it's simply average but .5 stars extra because they over almond and soy milk free of charge!
author: Zizi W.

description:
I work near the Boba Guys on Stockton, but when I heard about the Hayes Valley one opening up I knew I wanted to check it out.  We were in the area Saturday night and found parking across the street so I was out to satisfy my boba craving.  We literally got there right before a line starting forming after me.  I asked the cashier about caffine levels for a few teas, and though she answered me she seemed really annoyed.  I'm used to the more friendly faces at Stockton though.  I decided on my kind of usual Strawberry Jasmine Tea Fresca and he went with the Horchata.  

After about 2 minutes our order was ready and the guy who gave us our drinks seemed friendlier and had a smile on his face.  I've never been to the Mission location, but here, there's the same great taste, same right on chewy yet firm enough consistency of the boba and same quality ingredients as the Stockton Street location.  This location has a bigger menu, a few more food items, and actual (plentiful) seating with wonderful lighting for all of your Instagram shots.  

While I'm the boba enthusiast, this was his first time trying Boba Guys, and he enjoyed his horchata.  He may not see the fuss in it, but I really appreciate Boba Guy's premium loose leaf teas, great flavors, and quality and natural ingredients.  They don't use syrups here and that's why it's not as sweet as those other boba spots.  Who wants a heavy serving of high fructose corn syrup anyways?  If I'm in the area again and parking is in our favor, I will definitely stop by again.  But, again, at least the Union Square location is by my office!  Cheers Boba Guys!
author: Cat C.

description:
Stopped by bobaguys before I leave SF.
But I was so disappointed.  

On my way to cafe, I've found the owners on the street (can imagine how much I like them by recognizing the owner of boba shop), so I walked to them just to say hi.  

But one of them came to me and pushed my back to get rid of me...  He was like the security of celebrity....  

I felt so scary and almost fell down...  
can't believe his ungentle behavior to female...  
he told me it's not good timing but it's enough to tell to me so, didn't have to push my back.  

Hard to understand his behavior to their customer.

Totally different from the image that they shared through their SNS, twitter, Instagram, FB.  

It was last minutes tea time before my flight to Tokyo and my final stop of my SF trip, but turned out my worst memory there...
author: H O.

description:
Coolest Boba guys I've been to this far! I thought it was two stories but turns out the stairs is for staff only. 

It looks spacious in photos but it's actually really cramped. Lots of bar seating by the window aka natural lighting for those photozzz, ayyyyeee! 

Staff was alright, could be friendlier.

Parking was difficult, had to circle around the blocks multiple times.
author: Tammy F.

description: I got the strawberry matcha milk tea with boba, and it was pretty good. Love the location. The inside is really sleek and trendy looking. One thing I would say is that the wait is pretty long when its busy. Be prepared to wait! I would definitely recommend the strawberry matcha milk tea. The boba is soft and sweet.
author: Victoria T.

description: Definetly my favorite stop in San Francisco! I was visiting my friend who took me all over and this was a frequent stop while I was there. I ordered the Matcha Latte with almond milk. Really sweet at first (not a huge sugary fan) but eventually learned that he sweeetness at 50% was perfect with the tapioca balls! LOVE!!!
author: Rachel K.

description:
I just want to warn anybody from Southern California that Norcal boba is absolutely nowhere close to what Socal boba tastes like. 

If you're an LA guy like me you probably came across Boba Guys on Instagram or Twitter and thought it looked super cool. Because it does. Interior design, branding, and presentation are all on point and if those were the only criteria for good boba/tea then this would be my favorite spot hands down. Sadly, boba/tea is not something that you just look at it, you put that shit in your mouth too.

I really REALLY wanted to like this place but sadly they just do not have good boba or tea. On top of that, it is way too expensive. 4 dollars for a regular cup of boba is outrageous. Let's not talk about to price, let's talk about how shitty their tea is. I ordered an original Milk Tea and my girlfriend had some coconut flavored milk tea. Both were insanely watered down and had an odd taste to it. They were both too sweet and didn't taste like traditional milk tea. It just tasted depressing. As a matter of fact, the coconut flavored one was so nasty that we re-ordered a jasmine milk tea which was also watered down. Mind you, they don't give samples so we basically threw away 4.50$ because it tasted like ass. 

Julianna was the young lady who helped us out at the register. She was kind, extremely knowledgeable, and very patient. She answered all our questions in depth and gave us amazing service. This review would have negative stars if it weren't for her.

I'm sorry. I know you had your hopes up on this place. It looks cool and you probably thought it was going to be great. It is not. If you want good milk tea go to Chinatown, or wait until you go back to LA.
author: Kyle L.

description:
Can't believe it's my first time at this location. I'm usually at the one on Stockton. 

Came here with love and ordered the jasmine milk tea (50% sweet) with almond jelly. Is this the only boba shop with almond jelly? I think so! 

The drink itself was standard but I loved the almond jelly! I think I finished the drink in 30 minutes. My whole cup was still full of ice... Not enough milk tea! 

I really like boba guys! Will be back!
author: Elaine C.

description:
Short version:
5 star boba
5 star service 

Long version: 
Whenever people ask for boba recommendations in SF,  Boba Guys is always my answer. I've never had a bad experience or bad boba at either the union square, fillmore, or Hayes valley locations (also the only locations I've been to) but this review in particular goes out to the care and attention the bobarista gave to my drink!

Not only was the matcha latte made to my liking (half sweet), but the matcha was layered on so perfectly. I've never seen someone put that much attention into matcha layering before and it was the cherry on top of a perfect boba sundae? The analogy doesn't work out that well, but check out the photo and see the perfection for yourself :) 

11/10 will be coming back!
author: Nadine F.

description:
Okay. I have to admit, BG is starting to grow on me. I had a pretty meh experience my first time trying their drinks. Their regular milk tea drinks are nothing special, and I would not order any here BUT I will come for their specialty drinks and desserts ;) 

FOOD:
So each BG location has their own specialty drinks and desserts/food items. This Boba Guy happens to have the Waffle Sundae (off menu), matcha affogato and a few special drinks. They also offer pastries from Third Culture Bakery (matcha goods!!!) including their custard cakes and scones. I ordered: 
+ Waffle Sundae w/ Black Vanilla Kustard $6.25: This is pretty much 3 scoops of black (charcoal?) vanilla kustard with their belgium waffles and I asked for shot of matcha (+$1.25). YES. This was heaven!! I just wished there were more matcha! (I'm a matcha addict) The ice cream was black but tasted like vanilla and had a grainy dense texture which I personally enjoy more than regular ice cream. The waffles were dense and did not get soggy and retained their texture! This is a lot for one person, so I recommend sharing with another person unlike me. I scarfed down the whole cup. Solo. Right after lunch. LOL. #lifeofafatass 
+ Matcha Custard Cake $3.95: There is no actual custard in the middle, it's more like a dense sponge texture with rich matcha flavor. Although I would have preferred actual custard, the cake works! 

SERVICE: 
The girl taking my order was very friendly and accommodating. Eventhough what I ordered was off menu, she talked to the rest of the staff and they agreed to my create my personalized order! :) And made my matcha dreams come true. 

AMBIANCE:
Surprisingly, there was a short line when we got here and our order came out in a decent time. This shop is really brightly lit, most seats are along the wall. There are some table seating near the back behind the stairs (Which I wish was accessible, but looks like it's staff only). 

Verdict: I'll be back to possibly try their other specialty drinks and the matcha scone the have (made by a 3rd party bakery).
author: Samantha F.

description: I really wanted to like this place but was so underwhelmed. Anything other than their black tea was just Meh... They have a cool logo though.
author: Gary C.

description:
Store ambiance: 
Cute and fun. A little tight for big groups.

Customer service: (1/5)
Cashier has the "I don't give a shit, just order already" kind of attitude. One word, unhelpful. On the other hand, the guy that gave me my drinks told me that I would need to stir my drinks before having them. 1 star to him.

Drinks: 
Strawberry matcha latte with boba: The drink itself is interesting. I can see why people rave about this drink! Ever since I have pearls from OneTea, other stores boba are meh. I have higher expectations for boba guys, but the pearls are just ok. I prolly will get it without pearls next time 

Matcha latte with almond jelly: 
I had it at 25% ice and sugar. Not too bad.

Will I be back? Yep! Will be back to try other drinks on the menu
author: Crystal L.

description:
Top quality boba drinks! Definitely one of my favorite boba shops 

Clean interior. Menu is neat and easy to read. Has some seating. Con is that the cashier is right by the door so MOST of the time you have to wait outside in the line which is not fun when it is cold, windy, or raining.

They sell other merchandise by the cashier. They offer snacks as well.

Boba balls are top notch. Sweet enough. Bouncy and chewy.

Most of their drinks are very good. You adjust sweetness level, ice level, and the type of milk you prefer.

A bit pricey but worth it.

Customer service is ok. They are not as friendly as they use to be in the past. I feel like I'm rushed to order. And when i get my drink it's just on the counter, they don't personally give it to you. 1 star down because customer service has gone down. It feels like its become kind of like a chain atmosphere. 

My top go-to drinks are: Thai Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Matcha Milk Tea, and Rose Milk Tea.
author: Michele G.

description: I mean is it that good? Not really.. but I think it's pretty trendy! Their drinks are definitely slightly different than other boba places. We tried the strawberry fresca and the strawberry matcha like some of the reviews already written, the strawberry matcha pretty much tastes like jam and matcha tea but it's not bad! The line does get long but it moved pretty fast depending on who's in front of you. We were tourists in the city too but there were a couple people in front of us trying the drinks before ordering... so it took a little longer. Only one bathroom for guys and girls so the line for the bathroom was pretty long too. We didn't stay to drink here- just grabbed and bounced.
author: Catharine L.

description:
I love balls! tapioca balls! good stuff here. 

Last year, I had the chance to help organize my high school's prom, and we were so, so excited to have Boba Guys catering. The drinks they brought (600) were gone within the first 30 minutes to an hour. Go team :-) 

Boba Guys is pricier than the average boba shop, but that's expected at a store who proclaims a battle cry of "fight the powder." Fresh is expensive! (a lesson quickly and sadly learned by a college student who thoroughly enjoys eating a lot of fruit). I popped by the Hayes Valley location for the first time over winter break with my sister and was 1) excited to find seating (vs. the other location which is quaint and chairless) but 2) disappointed that the swirly/DNA stairs we briefly saw in the Yelp picture thumbnails did not lead up to more upstairs seating :-( (I think it was storage up there, not sure though, it was behind the counter). Also, "popped by" is probably not the best verb phrase to describe it, there was line out the door and around the corner, but the service was swift and efficient! 

Previously, I've tried their Jasmine Milk Tea (this one's generally good no matter where you go) and their Horchata, which tastes like delicious Cinnamon Toast Crunch milk (I've never had "authentic" Horchata so I wouldn't be able to compare or say whether Boba Guys's matched up, but what I had here was good!). I really appreciate that the alternative milk options (soy and almond) come at no additional cost! And this time, I enjoyed the house-made almond jelly (in an iced chai + boba), which had a...  *strokes beard contemplatively as a I think of adjective to use*... majestically subtle yet soothing flavor B^). 

Last note, it'd be really nice to be able to adjust ice level choice, since the servings aren't that big, the ice takes up a lot of room and if you drink the liquid part too fast, the toppings can get trapped under the ice cubes!!! (My passion about this topic in poem form: http://miscell-annie-ous.tumblr.com/post/124049474718/thirtypercent)
author: Annie W.

description:
In one word: underwhelming

Boba guys has been the word of hype since I've gotten to SF, and of course, I was super excited to try it out.

I got the classic milk tea---cant go wrong with that---and had tapioca bubbles to go with it. 

The drink was really light. Even with 100% the drink was barely sweet, and the milk was barely noticeable. It tasted like fat free milk, aka water, with maybe a pinch of sugar. And the tea taste? Also super light and not sure where it went. As for the tapioca, it's decent and made the highlight of the drink; chewy and fun to eat, which goes nicely with the milk tea.

Not bad, but definitely wouldn't top the list of boba places I've been to.
author: Michael Y.

description:
Boba Guys is seriously my fav and go to boba spot! I love love love all the drinks but my forever favorite for the longest time was always the Strawberry Matcha Latte but now it has to be the Sesame Latte! 

If you've ever had  the Chinese dessert with the sesame glutinous balls that is what the drink tastes like! So so so good. I was super hesitant to order it at first but decided to try it and now I have a new fav! Aside from my main two drinks. The hojicha, Hong Kong, Muscat Oolong, Matacha and lets be honest every single drink option on the menu is super delicious! Def Grade A balls all the way. 



The Hayes Valley location is so cute and bigger. The staff is just as friendly and kind as all the other locations. They also have more swag you can purchase if you're all about that boba guys life. 

I love how you can genuinely taste all the high quality ingredients that are put in to make every single drink.
author: Yinja L.

description:
Prelim review:

Wonderful imaginative boba-tea combinations (such as strawberry matcha, black sesame latte, or dirty horchata), beautiful establishment, good base ingredients (Strauss Organic Milk), in-house made jellies, and above-average prices.

If their pricing was lower, or there was more in-house seating to have a coffee-house atmosphere, it would hands down be 5-stars.
author: Andrew H.

description: Plus two for another delicious drink but minus 3 for ATTITUDE. I just got a blank stare from the cashier after I say hi, and then a curt, borderline sarcastic reply about the premade sugar level of my Thai tea. I get you must get asked annoying questions all day, but that's the nature of the gig. Left with some bad vibes!
author: Thomas L.

description:
Simply ...  
    Very good tasting matcha.
    The  line is partly slow deciding customer.
    Otherwise the staff is pretty quick at putting an order together.
    Again ... It's a personal taste thing so come and
           see why there is a line ...
    Premium ingredients make better drinks ... simple
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Despite the expected value of return for the cost vs. how fast I drink; this place is on point! Like so many other Yelpers mentioned about the taste - a perfect equilibrium of satisfaction, taste, & sweetness. What makes it so good is the simple fact that it's practically not granulated/processed ingredients. This past year I found out that my body reacts to processed things like sugar, protein, etc.; therefore, this boba stop hit the spot of perfection! I ordered the Matchata & Taro Smoothie (which is the ONLY option of smoothie, sadly). Not going to lie, I was skeptical about no artificial for the smoothie as I had one before & it tasted horrendous. Needless to say...I was wrong! The taro was exceptionally AMAZING! The boba was freshly warm & the almond jelly was just as good too. I will have to order another one before returning to SoCal. Now, the Matchata (w/strawberries) was good in the beginning; however, as you drink the sweetness of the strawberry upsets the balance of the green tea taste. I would suggest drinking it quicker or avoiding the strawberry because the blend doesn't quite go together.

All-in-all this place got 4/5 stars. The only issue I had for not giving it 5/5 is because the lack of choices for a smoothie; but probably this is because it's NorCal & maybe smoothies aren't so smart for a year round relatively chilly weather - correct me if I'm wrong about this. I hope they add a few more selections for blended. Other than that I very much enjoyed it & will be back before my return home to SoCal.
author: Joshua G.

description:
REVIEWER #85

Big black chewy balls excite me! *Smiles* especially when their tasty balls! *Bigger smile* Not to sweet it has to be just right, you know what I mean right? If not, then what boba spot are YOU going to?

This place is hard for me not to think about especially when it's walking distance from the workplace. But good boba seems to be hard to find in SF! What is up with that?

In the East Bay boba joints are like a dime a dozen and I specially don't go anywhere else by I-tea but since this seems to be close to the workplace it leaves me with the only option and here is my results.

-I really like the building. From the outside it's nice because of the clear windows that helps you see right in and the décor. However, once you step in, it feels like you walked in a dang sauna! Seriously! The first time I walked in I had to run back out because I was sweating my hair out! That is not cool *frustrated emoji*

-I have to admit that every time I come in here I do get fantastic customer service. I remember there was a time where I ordered a Milk Tea drink and didn't identify what drink size I wanted and of course I was assuming that they were going to give me the regular size boba drink but when I picked up my drink it looked more like a teaser then a pleaser and I had to return it right back and ask for a bigger size and Andrew, the cashier was nice enough to swap my drink size out free of charge! Thank you Andrew!

-This boba joint is quite unique from the rest and here is why. They offer and serve many items on their board they wouldn't be offered at other boba locations such as:

* 3 teas and chocolate pairing for $10! Yes, Yelpers! This place serves tea flights! Exclusive baybee!
*Dirty Horchata for $4.75
*Boba Guys Sundae for $6.50
*Hibiscus Mint Iced Tea foe $3.75
*Hong Kong Toast
*Almond Milk Tea

Boba Guys offers Standard Drinks, Premium Drinks and Specialty drinks. What's another unique thing about this place is that they offer drinks Iced or Hot! Noice! 

Okay, so that's not all but I'll let you check this place out for yourself to see what else they serve that's different from the rest of boba businesses.

Inside they do offer a large variety of stool tables to sit and enjoy your food and boba with friends (In my option it's too hot to relax in there).

Verdict?
I personally love the idea of Boba Guys but when it comes to the quality of the drinks...I can't do it! I know I know...let's not all throw things at me at once. But true story, I didn't enjoy the drinks and after the 2nd time this would not be my first or second option. The balls weren't tasty and sweet enough, the drink was not as sweet as I would have liked it...It was just not tasty...*Sad face emoji*

I would go with 2 stars-"Meh, I've had better". Which is true! I honestly have had better but with the customer service being great, I have to give it an additional star which raises it to 3 stars. *smiles*

I'm sad to know there is a boba joint close to me that is not tasty enough for me. Hopefully another boba joint would open soon close to my job. In the meantime, I will stick with I-Tea!

REVIEW 164/196
author: Porsche C.

description:
Oh my gosh this drink was soooo goood I was in heaven. I ordered the matcha latte (sucker for anything with matcha in it!) at 25% sweetness with Strauss Creamery. PERFECT. The matcha was nearly clump-free AND the sugar level was perfect. Pro tip for non-Asians/non-boba-connossieurs : the balls already are SOAKED in sugar, so go easy on the sweetness in your drink! 

The drink was amazingly well-balanced. I only wished 1) line was shorter -- not gonna fault them for their popularity 2) the boba had a little more bounce rather than being more on the chewy side. But to each her own.

Also, I love the hipster take on the boba! Guess it's basic people like me ruining SF - Sorry not sorry.
author: Cindy W.

description:
EVERYONE told me to check out Boba Guys during my mini weekend trip in SF. There's a bunch of boba places already in LA so I didn't know what the big deal was about. BOY WAS I WRONG! I ended up getting their strawberry fresca with almond jelly and it's now my new fav whenever I go now!! The drink with the almond jelly is just soo refreshing and I don't feel as guilty when I drink it compared to if I get a boba milk tea. 

My friend and I went more into the store to find a place to sit when one of the tea baristas asked if we wanted to try their new "Nitro Tea". It basically tasted like oolong tea but it had the carbonation of....beer?? Weirdest combination/feeling ever but surprisingly I liked it!! He said that the nitro tea was currently in the process and I'm sooo excited when it launches and Boba Guys start to offer flavored drinks with the combination of nitro tea. The drinks are going to look super dope with the carbonation of the tea rising up while the colors of the drinks mix together. I can totally see it as a lava lamp looking drink! Be sure to get your phones ready cause that'll definitely be IG worthy!
author: Connie Y.

description:
Boba Guys is popluar all over San Francisco! I've been to Boba Guys for the last 4 years now, though I'm not a loyal customer, it's a great boba stop while you're in the city! 

I find Boba Guys a hit or miss, some drinks are delicious and some aren't. It really depends on what you get. Usually, I stick with a Jasmine Milktea with boba because it's always been consistently good! Will be back for more soon!
author: Lilian N.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place since I moved to the city and I finally got the chance today when I decided to treat myself after a 6 mile walking quest to find Warby Parker. 

Rating Breakdown:
1.5/2 Stars for Taste --
I ordered the Hong Kong style milk tea (75% sweet) because I was craving some condensed milk goodness. I kind of wish I had gotten 100%, because I suspect they gave me less condensed milk. It definitely wasn't as creamy as some of the better Hong Kong milk teas I've had (S&E lounge!) There was a good strong tea taste, which I like -- strong enough that I had to sip and savor.  I didn't get boba today because I wasn't feeling it...aaand I also couldn't really stomach paying $4.50 for a small.

0/1 Stars for Value --
OK organic, locally-sourced ingredients, yadda yadda yadda. If you're the kind of person who can pay $7.99 for a gallon of creamy bougie milk, then $4.50 for a small milk tea with pearls and $5.50 for a large will be acceptable to you. As for me, *spontaneously combusts...in the distance sirens* Could I taste the difference in quality? Maybe? If I closed my eyes and reflected on Maisy the SF cow whose teat was gently squeezed to send fresh, frothy milk directly into my decal decorated Boba Guys cup. (Yo, but that cup is pretty damn instagrammable. Maybe the extra $1 in price is for the cup alone.) Yeah, I'd rather get my $3.75 i-Tea double topping milk tea any day.

1/1 Stars for Customer Service --
Friendly, fast service. I asked for my iced beverage without ice (I hate diluted beverages) and the server didn't even blink. She also let me change the sweetness level of my drink after she had already printed the order...I know, I know, I'm a terrible customer, but in my defense I didn't see that 75% was the recommended sweetness level until after I ordered. There was quite a line when I got there, but I was in and out in less than 15 minutes. This location is pretty spacious and well-lit with plenty of seating. The decor makes everything about this place any food blogger's wet dream.

No bonus star because while I understand the appeal of this place, it's not even in my top 5 places for good boba in the Bay Area. Ok maybe half a bonus star because maybe someone can talk me into trying one of their more interesting drinks (sesame latte, matcha latte, etc.) at a later date when I'm feeling a bit more spendy.

TL;DR -- Good, but not $5.50 for a large pearl milk tea good.
author: Abby W.

description:
This is my go-to location! During weekdays, there isn't much of a wait. The cashiers are generally friendly and the drinks come out quick. There are boba-esque merchandise available for purchase (i.e. totes/tea dispensers/sweaters and shirts).

I like getting the strawberry rice milk with almond pudding + boba. Delicious!! (Also, I think you can get multiple toppings for a fixed price??)

I love you, Boba Guys!!
author: Alison H.

description:
Boba Guys is a must when I'm in the city. 

For the longest time, I was trying to get them to sponsor me lol, but I doubt that's gonna happen anytime soon or ever. 

My favorite to get there is their strawberry matcha with chia seeds. I really enjoy this combination, if only I could adjust the level of sweetness. I typically get this drink or the jasmine milk tea with boba. You can't go wrong with those two. 

I hope they expand more than just in SF. San Jose should definitely be the next spot to open one, hehehe.
author: Ruthie T.

description: Great quality boba that isn't too sweet and still maintains the integrity of the tea. My go to is the Hong king style milk tea with tapioca bubbles half sweet. I've had it both iced and hot, either way, it's delicious!
author: Ray K.

description:
This place is a must have whenever I come to San Francisco!! Everyone is so helpful and nice, and the customer service is awesome. Love the new store here because it's more spacious with two stories and there are places to sit, relax, and take a LOT of photos (not kidding).

The tiled floor with the "BOBA" text is one of the popular spots to take a picture when you get your drinks. There's also a sign in the back that says "tea people." 

They have a "tea bar," where you can sample and smell their different teas while being educated by Ben the tea specialist. He is very knowledgeable and knows what he is talking about.

I always come back to get the strawberry matcha latte with boba because it is one of the most delicious and unique drinks I've drank by far. They use organic milk and every ingredient is to perfection. No artificial syrup or sweeteners are added in their drinks. You can taste each flavor of the strawberry, matcha, boba, and a hint of honey with every sip! I also love how the drink comes out in 4 layers.

They're always creating special drinks so make sure to check with the cashier or the menu they have on the table for more details!
author: Vicky Y.

description:
This is probably the most expensive boba that I ever had so far. It is good, but is it worth the price ($4.75 with no boba)? I'm still on the fence about it. 

We came at a great time right before the rush. The interior looked pretty cool and the menu had interesting mixes that I have never seen before. We narrowed it down to muscat oolong and strawberry matcha latte. The muscat oolong was refreshing at 75% sugar. Any lower than that, it would be too bitter for my taste. This is rare to find nowadays since I usually get the lowest sugar setting and it still turns out too sweet in other boba shops. Anyway, the strawberry matcha latte was amazing! They layer the liquids, but I would mix it together before drinking. Definitely recommend this milky delight if you had to try one thing only.
author: Michelle L.

description: I've always been a big fan of boba guys because of the light taste and perfect sweetness of their jasmine milk tea.
author: Linh N.

description:
This is probably the best boba I've had in San Francisco! It's so delicious and customizable as well. I have tried a few of the milk teas, but my absolute favorite is earl grey milk tea with oat milk & almond jelly. The almond jelly is a bit of a healthier alternative to boba (they also have grass jelly if you want something completely dairy free). I also appreciate how you can customize the sweetness level of your drink. I usually get mine to about 50%- 100% sweetness is usually way too much so I would recommend going down (especially if you get oat milk, which is naturally sweet). Also, it can get quite crowded in here on weekends and evenings, so just keep that in mind. At the times that it isn't crowded, it's a great place to work with a couple of comfortable tables and lots of natural light. 

If you're looking for something lighter, you can also sit down and order some more unique teas and tea tasting flights, which is fun as well. 

The only reason I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it is quite pricey! Everything costs extra (including plain boba) and that can cause the price of your drink to add up. Still, the drinks are absolutely delicious, so I will always return!
author: Ayushi A.

description:
Having had a rather disappointing Hong Kong Milk Tea at their Manhattan location, I was rather hesitant to meet my friends at this new location in the city. I've never had the chance to try the other ones in SF so it was also a good time to give this new one a chance. (I always have room for some good milk tea. If it's good that is.)

This Boba Guys location is located on Octavia Street in the Hayes Valley area of San Francisco. It's mainly street parking and you probably have to drive around for awhile to find any because it's a large intersection. 

We walked down Octavia Street and I immediately noticed the shop on the corner. There was a line of about 5 people out the door which kinda scared me because I just didn't want to have to wait that long for my tea later. When I got to the door, that's when I realized that the place where you order the drinks is right in front of the front entrance. It's just badly designed. Wait til Winter when it's raining cats and dogs in the city and all the boba-hungry customers will need to line up in the rain. 

Ok while the front is badly designed, the back area is definitely an improvement compared to the other much smaller locations. (As seen in other Yelper's pics.) There's a big sitting area further inside the store and the high ceiling adds to the modern clean lines of the space. Of course their large signature Armadillo is up on their white wall. 

I wasn't going to order their Hong Kong Milk Tea again so I chose their Lavender Black Milk Tea this time around and hoped for the best. It had a strong tea flavor, but I could also taste the Lavender. I would say it's not for people who aren't into sweet drinks, but when the ice melted, it did lessen the sweetness. They do have other interesting drinks on their menu (Strawberry Rice Milk! Whaaat??) so I'll have to try the others next time.
author: Julie W.

description: Tried the strawberry matcha bubble tea after hearing so much about it - honestly it was average, below what I had expected. BUT my friend got the horchata rice bubble tea and I tried it, it was really good! Usually my favorite bubble tea flavor is just the regular milk bubble tea. I can imagine if I got that one here, I would've loved it. The shop itself is also very cute. I would definitely come back, and would definitely recommend!!
author: Rachelle H.

description: I think boba guys is my all time favorite milk tea spot. The strawberry-match latte is my no#1 choice! Oh! Be prepare u have to wait in the line for a while before u get the milk tea. This place is so popular!!
author: Gloria Y.

description: They should really advertise NOT ALL of their locations have food so people don't waste their time going to different locations trying to find the ones that serves food.
author: J. J.

description:
Made the trip down to SF from Seattle JUST for the bubble tea* and LETMETELLYOU... it did not disappoint. Yummy, milky, high quality milk tea! The interiors were clean, crisp, modern, adorable (I have no clue as to why they have an aardvark as their logo, but I am all about it) and instagram worthy. 

As a heads up, Some of their milk teas are pre-blended and as such aren't offered with dairy-alternative milk options. My boyfriend got the horchata milk tea, which he said was basically just horachata. Looking back, he wishes he would have just tried their standard milk tea, but he did really enjoy the horchata. I had the matchata which was delicious (make sure to mix it up!). My friend Emily got some strawberry drink that I can't find on their website menu now, but she said it was great. The boba was sweet, perfectly squishy, and delicious. 

We tried to re-visit Boba Guys the next day but found out they were closed :( please open a location in Seattle soon... we promise we will visit often! 

*This is an exaggeration. We came here to visit our friend. HOWEVER... Boba Guys was one of the highlights of the trip.
author: Angel B.

description: Modern and simple ambience inside. Many creative options on bubble tea! They have horchata, matcha latte, matcha strawberry latte, hong hong milk tea and other varieties that are normally not found at other places. We ordered a regular milk tea and matcha latte. You can adjust sugar and ice levels and choose the type of milk. It cost about $5 each. The layering of the matcha latte was beautiful! The boba tasted great - chewy and soft. Matcha taste was slightly bitter balanced out by the creaminess of the milk. Would definitely recommend!
author: Alyson Y.

description: Boba guys consistently sets the standard for good milk tea. Their attention to detail and high quality products has made them the top tea place north of Cupertino (personally I think pekoe dominates the south). Their boba is always perfectly cooked, with no hard spots in the pearl body. I recommend jasmine milk tea, it is probably my favorite flavor here. In the summer time a large jasmine milk tea never fails to quench my thirst, while in the summer, a warm jasmine milk tea is one of the coziest things I can think of. Boba guys is the gold standard for milk tea, I definitely recommend it.
author: Stanley W.

description:
This place is better than the one on the mission. They have a drink called the Cali-pico which is like the calpico drinks in the bottles. The drink consists of their strawberry fresca with creama but the creama has a yogurty taste which is the best part. 

Prices are standard for what you would get on San Francisco for $5 for a large with no boba.
author: Polly W.

description:
Boba Guys gal since day ONE.  Yea, since the pop up inside of Ken Ken Ramen.
I've been to all locations but  I love this Hayes Valley one the most. Clean aesthetic matches all the other ones but this one actually has some seating and a section for Tea People.

Perhaps the thing I enjoy most about Boba Guys is their consistency. Excellent balls for your mouth (yea, that was intentional) with great customer service. 

#bobafloorselfie
author: Susy C.

description:
This place has operational issues. No boba until after 11am even though they open at 9am. The company name is misleading. 

Many of their staff have complained about excessively rude treatment by select managers. I overheard it is mostly women being treated poorly by a few select males. I'm uncertain on the validity, and can't speak for the owners but hope they act quickly with integrity on this. Dignity for ALL employees is a requirement for an organization to receive my return business.
author: M E.

description:
Got Jasmine Milk Tea. Too much ice, drink tasted like sweetened milk, grass jelly was terrible - the non chewy, hard cubed kind.                                 

Get your shit together!
author: Susan C.

description:
The services and drink is OK. but the Waffle is not good, it's too hard, and too much sugars inside the Waffle. It was little expensive. Chocolate Waffle and Boba drink for $8.75
8-15-2017
author: Jackson L.

description:
Classic Boba Guys! God I'm a huge sucker for aesthetics. The design of the place was on point. Clean, hipster/modern vibe with a nice little patio. The place was pretty busy, but the workers were swift and friendly.

To be honest, when I had Boba Guys for the first time at another location, I really disliked it. I had the matcha drink, and it was too bitter for me. But I decided to go back and give it one more shot, and I'm glad I did. I had the classic milk tea and my boyfriend had the coffee milk tea. My classic milk tea was excellent, strong and flavorful tea flavor and the perfect amount of sweetness. The coffee milk tea was very strong as well. I liked my drink, he liked his. I would definitely come back to this specific location, love the vibes!
author: Veronica D.

description:
4.5 STARS

Me *talking to myself*: "Damn, I want some balls."
Co-worker: "Excuse me?!"

Me: "Oh sorry, I was talking to myself...I'm craving some good balls."
Co-worker: (o_O )

Me: "You know the ones that are perfectly chewy and bounce around on your tongue."
Co-worker: "Geesus woman, can you at least wait till happy hour so we can have this conversation?!"

Me: "Ummm ok...but I was just trying to figure out where to get a boba milk tea around the office."
Co-worker: "Ohhh, ummm...nevermind."

Me: "Omg, what were YOU thinking of?"

Hayes Valley and the surrounding area were in dire need of a solid boba place so I was super excited to hear that Boba Guys was opening their flagship store just several blocks away from the office in the new 8 Octavia building (luxury condos). 

I first visited Boba Guys when they started out as a humble pop-up inside Ken Ken Ramen back in 2011: http://bit.ly/1TM0lQh. At the time, no one was offering quality boba milk tea. They were the first pioneers to really elevate milk tea in the Bay Area by using top-notch ingredients like brewing real tea leaves, using Straus organic milk (no powders), and housemade syrups (fructose free). I'm happy that they're doing so well that they even opened a location in NYC. 

I visited their Hayes Valley flagship store (third SF location) during their soft opening (grand opening date TBD) and ordered a Large Decaf Milk Tea w/ boba ($5) and a Liege Waffle (pre-packaged - $3): http://bit.ly/1sr0T7a. Their menu is pretty much the same as their other Mission and Stockton Street location with 16 oz teas at $3.50 and 22 oz teas at $4.50. Toppings (boba, almond jelly, grass jelly) are 50 cents each. VERY reasonable prices given they use high quality ingredients. If you're a coffee drinker, they serve De La Paz Coffee. Cc's accepted.

Side Note: They're currently offering a 15% off (?) discount for their soft opening (I was only given my total so I think it's 15% off). 

For the lactose intolerant, they offer Califia Farms almond milk instead of the Straus organic milk. You can also choose your sweetness: 0%, 30%, 50%, 75%, 100%. 

For snacks, they currently have Sunny Hill's Pineapple Cakes (Taiwan), Suite Foods Liege Waffles, Frozen Kuhsterd Boba Sundaes, and Sugar and Spun Cotton Candy. Can't wait until they start offering their housemade onigiri and artisan toast. 

Milk teas are a rare indulgence for me. I can only enjoy them occasionally on the weekends because I try to avoid caffeine (keeps me up at night). Boba Guys are the only ones to offer a Decaf Milk Tea and it's just as good as their Original. The Decaf Milk Tea (50% sweetness) had prominent tea flavor with a nice creaminess and a light sweetness. The boba was perfectly chewy with a good bounce...not as bouncy between the teeth as my fav balls from Chatime but still very solid. Most importantly, they kept their texture in the cold drink. 

Service was very cheery and swift but I do miss seeing the personable owners behind the counter which gave it that special "mom and pop store" touch. But, when you're doing so well, I guess you can't be everywhere so that's understandable.

Seating was mostly window counter tops with one larger table in the back area (for their tea lounge?). Not sure if there's free WiFi.

Parking in the area is tough since it's all residential parking.

Thank you, Boba Guys for satisfying my ball cravings...though my co-worker somehow was thinking of other balls. Perv.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I do claim some sort of knowledge/experience with boba, as I grew up in LA and frequented the 626 nearly every weekend as both a young kid and a high schooler. I've tried everything from FTB to Au79 but don't mistakenly think of me as a snob, I don't look down on others for liking whatever they like.

Objectively and in short, I think Boba Guys is a reliable place to get good tea. The boba is typically cooked pretty well, not too chewy, but not undercooked. The lines can definitely be long at times, and when it gets to the point  where it's an hour long, I'd say it's a toss-up based on how much you're craving a drink. Servings aren't too large (which may in itself be a good thing), and I'd say that I've never had a drink that I'd happily wait over an hour for. So depending on your preference, you may elect to go ahead do so, just also consider things like parking if you drive, and again the possibility of a long wait. 

As for a recommendation, I do strongly prefer the strawberry matcha latte which I get predominantly whenever I go. It looks nice, for sure, but I like it more for how unique and tasty it is.

Overall, it's a good place to go to for boba, lines get long often, and it's ultimately up to how much you're craving tea.
author: Charles M.

description:
My favorite boba shop in SF so far! I've tried a few drinks and I definitely have my favorites, but also a few I would not get again haha. 

First, the boba here is amazing! So soft and chewy, yummmm.
 
Next, they offer organic milk. It's no longer a hipster movement, organic milk is offered everywhere now haha.

Now let's get to the real deal! The strawberry matcha and classic milk tea are my favorites! The horchata I probably would not order again. It was cool to have real green tea mixed with the horchata, but wasn't a personal favorite of mine! I still have a bunch of flavors to try, but it's hard when the first couple you try are already so good!
author: Andrew S.

description:
These guys make legit milk tea. They are super innovative too. Growing up in the heart of asian food in LA, I've been to A LOT of boba shops. Boba Guys is really different and truly uses good ingredients for a cup of milk tea. 

- there is ample lighting at this location, so bright! 
- price is standard. $3.75-$4.25 for a 12 oz cup of tea. Extra for boba. 
- they use a timer to brew the tea (12 minutes to be exact). Wow, that precision! 
- they use QUALITY tea leaves. Each specific type of tea (i.e. lavender black tea, rose tea) is brewed, not syrup added to a black/green tea base. You can buy a bag of tea leaves for $5 and make your own tea at home. 
- they use real milk, or non-dairy substitutes (almond, soy, OAT milk (wow, this was the first time I've heard of OAT milk) at no extra charge!
- you personalize the sweetness level - I recommend 50%, or even less than that 
- lastly, I learned (& taste-tested) that Boba Guys is making nitro tea. They make this with OAT milk. I loved it because this nitro tea tasted light & refreshing, and different in a really good way. TIP: sit at the bar and talk to the tea specialist, you'll learn something interesting and take part in a taste test! :) 

P.S.

-Only thing is that you can't personalize sugar level for certain pre-made drinks, i.e. horchata. Horchata is still super good! Just kind of too sweet for me.....
-I prefer to do work sitting in a chair w/ back. Here at Boba Guys, they only have stools. It's a perfect place to catch up w/ friends, but I don't think it's a good place to do work/study for a whole afternoon because it gets really crowded and noisy at random times since most people come in to buy boba, hang out for a few minutes, and leave. I don't know about you but I like to do work at a quieter place.
author: Dana Z.

description:
Boba Guys is terrible. It's the McDonaldlization/white- washing of a pretty easy concept- Bubble Tea. It's for customers who want to feel empowered by spending more money on an inferior product because of its packaging and Caucasian- feeling. 

I ordered a Matcha tea and asked for a tiny bit of sweetness and a tiny bit of milk. Lo and behold, the cashier/drinkmaker tried to give me diabetes by filling over half the mixing cup with cream and sugar. Why can't we understand the advantages of subtelty? My matcha was undrinkable. 

Also, the layout is questionable.  There's a very narrow aisle wrapping around the central area where two people can't walk past each other without turning to the side. Uncomfortable and scary.
author: Chris L.

description:
Boba Guys has several locations in SF but this location never fail me. I am from San Jose, every time I came to SF, I gotta come here for boba. Unlike the one on Stockton St, which is the location I went for the first time and they failed me, drinks here are made seriously with love and passion. The staffs are so sweet. We got our order taken fast and correctly. My friend order an espresso but she turned out didn't like it. She tried to fix her drink by asking for creamer. The barista saw it, he walk to our table and offer to make her a coffee milk tea to replace her drink. He made the drink and took it to or table. And my friend really loved her drink. This is the best customer service experience I've ever had at a boba place. Shout out to Boba Guys for having amazing, friendly and caring staffs. 

HK Milk Tea with 50% sugar, boba : 9/10
Matcha Latte with 50% sugar, boba : 9/10
Coffee Milk Tea with 100% sugar, boba : 9/10
author: Anh L.

description:
The drinks are good however the line is way too long. The bottleneck here is the cashier because there's too many options and most people still don't know what they want by the time they get to the line.

They need to set the menus out at the line so people can predetermine before they get to the cashier.
author: Ellen C.

description: Definitely one of the best boba tea in the world! (Proven by Taiwanese) Perfectly chewy and not to sweet boba with multi-layered tea taste !
author: Lily C.

description:
Of all the Boba Guys locations, this right here, is my favorite. I've been to all three locations in SF, but this one has the space for you to hang out. 

Now, I did take my friend here during the day and he mentioned how he was getting hot up in here. At first, I was thinking, "Stop your complaining" but then realized, it was a little warm. Maybe it is due to the concrete-like materials used to build the space, which I believe keeps in the heat if it's hot outside. Regardless, the space is still cool and hip.

But the main reason for the five star rating is simply, the Matcha Strawberry drinks I get here are delicious! I crave this drink at times and will drive up to SF with my hubby for this drink. I seriously will make it a point just to come here just for this drink and plan my other plans around Boba Guys! 

Shout out to one of the owners, Bin, for taking the time to talk to me and my hubby about the history and success of your business! PLEASE make that dream come true about opening up a Boba Guys in San Ramon. You already got two loyal customers ready to go there!
author: Loreto D.

description: There are so many locations opening in SF right now, it's truly amazing! I been to the location in union square and I have to say, this one is a lot bigger. They have tables here and it's way more aesthetic(one of the reasons why I come tbh). This time I wanted to try the Hong Kong Milk Tea and the Horchata. The drinks are mediocre, nothing really special I have to say but the service and the boba makes up for it. Their boba is soft to the touch but not over cooked, although there are some that were hard. Come to this location if you want to work on your computer bc they have tables and chairs here!
author: Lisa W.

description: Line is always out the door, but they do make the drinks pretty quickly after you order. This time, I tried the black sesame latte and added their home-made grass jelly. Both the black sesame flavor in the "latte" and the flavor of the grass jelly were very tame. I was worried about not being able to customize the sweetness level (since this is drink is part of their menu which cannot be customized) but sweetness was actually fine. Flavor could use a boost though.
author: Yvonne K.

description: Out of all the locations, this one is my least favorite. Parking is tough (worse than the mission location) and the staff was a little pretentious. They didn't smile and weren't friendly like the other locations. It just seemed like they were going through the motions and repeating a script. To top it off, I ordered a black sesame latte (my go to drink) and they didn't even fill up the cup all the way! Kind of disappointed but I usually go to theIr 16th street location and I've always loved the service and quality of drinks. The experience isn't a make or break for the brand, but I won't be back to this location.
author: Heather R.

description: Much hype with boba guys especially after Gwyneth Paltrow made a pit stop here while in SF- clean and modern with a lot of interesting combinations- noticed they use Strauss Creamery for their organic dairy - got the strawberry matcha latte - it did not disappoint! Delicious - hope they open some up in the East Bay soon
author: Christina J.

description: Great place to hangout for a milk tea! Lotta space in the back, nice people and they have tea tasting!  Strawberry Cali-pico with almond jelly is my pick.
author: Gino P.

description: I was craving some milk tea boba so my sister recommended we try this place due to the convenience of the location. Of course, the pictures looked amazing and I had to get one of their most popular drinks-- the Strawberry Matcha with boba. I was really excited to try this, but it wasn't that great =( I'm a person who loves boba AND matcha and this tasted watered down. Because of that, I would not purchase that drink again. I haven't tried any of their other drinks and don't know if I'll be returning if I'm in town. The presentation of my drink was beautiful though and service was average.
author: Shaina H.

description:
I'm not too big a fan of bubble tea and boba type drinks, but I was with friends exploring the city and we ended up stopping at the Hayes Valley Boba Guys for a quick drink. As we walked up to the store, I was surprised to see a line out the door! The line moved fast though, and within 5-7 minutes we were at the front of the line and ready to order. 
I must say, coming from Hawaii where there is not much variety in these kinds of drinks, there were a lot of unique choices at Boba Guys. I was torn between several choices on the menu, especially since they clearly designated their caffeine-free choices on the large overhead menu. As someone who is extremely caffeine sensitive, I really appreciated this! Ended up getting a 16oz iced black sesame "latte" (I say "latte" only because there is actually no coffee/tea as it is caffeine free) with almond jelly add-on. For most of the regular drinks, you can choose whether you want it hot or iced, and what level of sweetness you want. For the specialty drinks such as the black sesame latte, the drinks are only iced and at a set sweetness level. 
Not being able to choose a sweetness level scared me a little bit, because I usually choose 50% or less sweet. However, the black sesame latte was definitely not sugary at all! It was a milky version of the black sesame soup that I'm used to having at lunar new year, which was delicious. It was very sesame, almost to the point where it was nutty, which I loved. I thought the almond jelly was a good topping to go with the black sesame latte, as it also was not very sweet but very light and almondy. If you do get the black sesame latte, remember to stir often as the sesame does settle to the bottom of the cup!
Luckily our group of 3 was able to grab a table inside the back corner near the restroom. The place does get crowded though, so if you are a larger group I'd plan on just taking your drinks out and finding space in one of the nearby open areas in Hayes Valley. 

TL;DR - line moves fast, plan on taking out instead of drinking in, and do the black sesame latte with almond jelly!
author: Jasmine W.

description: I like this particular Boba Guys a bit more than the other ones in the area! Spacious compared to the other Boba Guys I went to and it's has much more of a chill atmosphere in the back where you can sit at a large table. Currently one of my go to tea places in San Francisco. Rose tea (the one in front) and Strawberry calpico!
author: Eric C.

description:
Boba guys is very popular. I'm a fan but it's very..... ummmm "Westernized". There are definitely a lot of boba places in the city. This one happens to be close to mine and you'll definitely taste the caffeine. The tapiocas are sometimes not cooked all the way through, so sometimes I do get lumps that are sticky to each other. 

Make sure though to check out the tea shop next to it (same family). The drinks can be a little pricey, and people seem to love the matcha. I personally like the Hong Kong style or the normal one. 

If you get confused with the size, choose larger (you can't go wrong). The place itself is pretty for pictures, though it can get a little crowded, and when that happens you're gonna be squeezed with other people in line to wait for your drink. The sugar levels are fine but in this place I recommend 50%, less than that all you taste is caffeine.

Don't forget to try the food as well coz they're as good as the drinks. The toast is my choice.
author: Kevin L.

description: This is one of the bigger Boba Guys that I've been too. There's plenty of space to move around and enjoy your boba. They've got nice tables and fancy bar stools and regular stools for you to sit at to enjoy or study or socialize on. I enjoy the various unique options of milk teas and fruit teas that Boba Guys offers. They have plenty of options of toppings and add ons to go along with your boba. My favorites are the boba (tapioca balls) and the grass jelly. They're also really considerate with drinkers who are lactose intolerant. They always ask if you would like to add milk to your drink and if you're okay with dairy. Also, they allow you to choose and adjust your sweetness level. 100% sweetness is the default option, so if you've got a sweet tooth, this is definitely for you! Come to Boba Guys for a good time with good company!
author: Brandon D.

description:
So tasty! You can taste the premium ingredients. This location is really beautiful as well as there's both indoor and outdoor seating as well as high ceilings.

I like that in addition to their beverages they offer food and snacks (including Taiwanese pineapple cakes. Nom!!).

While I've only tried a few of their drinks, I find 25% sweetness is best and I like to get half chia seeds, half grass jelly.

I love classic milk tea, and last time I tried the strawberry matcha latte. I asked if there was any way they could dilute it to make it less sweet, so they put less strawberry in and it did the trick. Super yummy!

I got the tuna onigiri and wasn't too impressed, unfortunately they were sold out of the salmon. Next time I come I'd like to try that and/or the Hong Kong toast.
author: Jenny L.

description:
The Hayes Valley location is spacious and beautiful! They also have more 'experimental' or seasonal drinks that they serve here but not at other locations. There's a lot of seating and they also sell their loose leaf tea and other small confections in addition to their boba.

I always like getting their Jasmine milk tea with boba, but have tried a lot of their other drinks which are all great. If you like Thai tea but don't want it as sweet, you can try their 'tiger' tea which is essentially thai tea mixed with some jasmine. You won't regret it!
author: Theresa L.

description: Been here a few times. The line is long on weekends. Service is pretty fast and staff are friendly. The place has few seating as expected but enough space inside to wait for your order to be competed.
author: Pa H.

description: I first tried Boba Guys at their Stockton St. location which is a legit hole in the wall and wasn't too impressed. I've been super addicted to boba recently and when I heard they had a Hayes Valley location I wanted to give them another try. This location is a lot bigger with more seating than the Stockton St. one. They have outdoor seating as well for those rare warm SF days. I ordered a matcha milk tea and my bf got the thai iced tea. Both were delicious. Boba can get pretty pricey depending on the size/ add ons but I don't think Boba Guys prices are any more expensive than other boba places I've been to.
author: Veronica S.

description:
So this is going to be a little unfair...but only Bc I don't drink many sweet drinks anymore. Coffee and tea as is. And if I get boba I will always get 25% sweet...

having this drink that's 75% sweet (which is how it comes no adjustments which is understandable) is a bit overwhelming for me. I personally can't finish even half of it. I'm waiting for the ice to melt down a bit and maybe make it less sweet.  oh. I should probably mention I'm having the strawberry matcha latte in case you didn't look at my picture. 

But with all that being said, it does taste fresh and is good. Just too much for my personal taste. 

Also - it's a bit pricey for me. It is in the city though so I guess I should expect that. 

Lastly - I guess Teaquation in Redwood City has broken me up from Boba.
author: A C.

description:
I like this new 3rd location of Boba Guys.  It's in Hayes Valley at Octavia/Hayes in a Huge building.  There is always gonna be a line because only 1 register!

I got Strawberry Matcha Latte Iced $4.75 for 16oz.  I have tried it before and still tasty.

Next time I go I need to try Black Sesame Latte $4.75/$5.75.  I didn't see it on the menu until I looked out other people's pictures.  

Friend got an matcha alfagato w/ Frozen Kusterd Thai ice cream and he said it was very icy, so skip it.

There is a Tea Bar - might need to try that one day.

Shoefie at the Boba floor sign; and there's the Tea Place signs to take pics and the Aardvark logo near the door.

There is some Pokeman Go creature there.

I will be back.
author: Ann L.

description:
My go-to is the iced matcha latte with almond milk and boba. I used to never drink boba but something about the boba balls here gets me every time. The quality is just outstanding. Plus I love matcha and almond milk so best of 3 worlds combined here. 

It's a cute place to get some work done if you need as every time I've come here, most people get drinks and go so you can probably secure a spot to get work done. 

My sister has gotten the lavender tea and said it's super delicious - but then again there are lots of different and unique options for you!
author: Cheri C.

description: Hands down my favorite boba shop of all time. I always have to stop by whenever I'm visiting the Bay Area. The HK style milk tea is my fav but I love their regular milk tea too. You can really taste the freshness and quality of the tea, whereas some places just use powders for their drinks. There's always a line, but it moves pretty quickly. The only thing about this location is that it's so hard to find parking, but it's definitely no trouble if you don't mind walking a bit. DO NOT let parking discourage you from visiting!!! Seriously can't find another place in SoCal that can satisfy my cravings for Boba Guys.
author: Kelley H.

description:
I came here on a whim when I was in SF, but wow this might be my favorite boba place in the world! Well-lit, well-decorated, very clean place.

Some background info, I typically don't like sweet drinks or powdery drinks, which most bubble tea places are known for making it with these 2 ingredients. Boba Guys aims for a more natural tasting drink.

Boba Guys feels more like a hipster coffee shop, but the bubble tea here is amazing. Definitely go for the Strawberry Matcha if you're into either Strawberry or Matcha, as it's literally the best drink I'v ever had.
author: Kevin L.

description: Service is great. My review is for my drink: hibiscus mint tea. It sort of tasted like toothpaste- too much mint. 2/5 but I've had the matcha strawberry latte with boba and that was delicious. :)
author: Alice W.

description:
Need a coffee fix? A boba fix? = Coffee milk tea. So good!! 

I like this location since it's a little easier to find parking and it's bigger than the other one i've been to on mission. Typically a long line but well worth it!

Much hipster vibez~
author: Mirelle M.

description:
Three locations in SF but they all taste great! Definitely recommend the Strawberry Cali-Pico but I heard the Matcha latte is great as well.

We came about an hour before closing and the line seemed to be out the door, but maybe because there wasn't space inside to order..lots of indoor seating though. They make their drinks relatively fast and everything tastes fresh. The interior decor is simple and is perfect for those who have a white background themed instagram! 
Staff is friendly and quick, would come back if I were in SF again!
author: Erica L.

description:
AMBIENCE

Love it! Its very hipster, white, very clean and aesthetically pleasing. Come here if you want to take some pictures for IG with boba. There are 2 stories with tables on the second floor. 

BLACK SESAME LATTE WITH GRASS JELLY

Love this combo. The black sesame tasted great. It reminded me of my childhood, when my mother would make some for me during the winter season. The taste would linger in my mouth after I swallowed it, which made me wanting another sip. The grass jelly complimented the latte, because it didn't clash and wasn't coated with sugar. Be sure to get with no ice, so you get more milk tea out of your purchase. I was left wanting more when I had finished my cup.

PARKING

It wasn't too hard to find parking. You just have to look for street parking across the street from Boba Guys. I'd suggest Octavia St. if there is still parking spaces. I believe it is only a 2 hour parking.
author: Alexander T.

description:
Finally got around to trying out Boba Guys and let me just say - I've tried MANY boba places before and this place by far has been one of the best boba places I've tried. I ordered the Matcha Milk Tea with boba and even though the Milk Tea was a little bit on the sweet side (probably my fault for not adjusting the sweetness to my liking) the boba definitely made up for it! They were so soft, easy to drink, and just very decadent. 

Other than that, I came in a Sunday afternoon and even though there was a pretty long line the staff was very friendly and efficient at the register. The drinks also didn't take very long to come out so you can literally just pop in and out of the location. If I had any complaints, I'd probably be the lack of sitting space in this location but that's just pretty minor to me. 

Overall, wasn't not disappointed with my first visit and I can't wait to try all their other drinks + locations!
author: Guinivere A.

description:
Man oh man this is my favorite bubble tea shop so far. 

Boba Guys is a premium boba tea location. They claim to use organic milk, house-brewed premium tea, housemade syrup, and make their own almond and grass jelly! I really appreciate their campaign to promote quality boba tea. 

The staff are friendly as the cashier contently answered my questions about the various drinks this one time. 

They have super unique drinks such as the Muscat Oolong and the Dirty Horchata! They're definitely some of the most unique I've seen so far and they all sound appetizing.

The Muscat Oolong was super good. It had a floral sweet aroma along with the classic Oolong tea taste. I got the standard sweetness but I recommend going 75% or 50% as my drink was a bit too sweet. 

The Dirty Horchata was a bit too bitter for my taste. I don't really enjoy the taste of Horchata all that much anyway. I didn't enjoy it. 

The Classic Milk Tea was very good and refreshing! It is quite basic but you can never go wrong with the classic.

The Strawberry Matcha Latte was really unique and tasty. The fruitiness of the strawberry and the grassiness of the matcha complemented each other well. You get the best of both worlds with this drink! 

The Lavender Black Milk Tea was decent but not my favorite. It has a natural lavender taste but it just did not fit my taste buds. The lavender taste was too overpowering for my liking. I recommend it to all of y'all who like the natural, legit lavender flavor. 

The Hong Kong Style Milk Tea is tasty. It has a nice bitterness and creaminess to it. It's a nice change compared to the classic black milk tea if you want a little change. 

Oh don't get me started on the pearls; they are the most decadent balls ever. They literally have VOLUME to them. They're like the king of all pearls. They're sweetened but not too sweet. They are big, soft, chewy, and dense all at the same time! They really do feel like top quality pearls. 

The price may be over the top for boba tea as they average about 5-6$, but the quality and taste are definitely worth it. 

Final verdict: I wish I could come here more often but I don't go to SF that often. I should though, because I need to get me a cup of this heavenly goodness. I recommend this place to anyone looking for unique and delicious drinks and the best pearls!
author: Amy H.

description: Way overrated. Overly sugary (asked for 25% sweetness).  Watery, bland flavor. Being from from Taiwan - the birth place of boba/pearl drinks - I know my boba.
author: J L.

description:
This place probably had the best boba balls I've ever had. 

I used to wonder why people would wait in these long lines to Boba when they're all over the place, but I get it. The boba makes a difference. I had the Rose Milk Black Tea (I'm on a Rose Tea kick) and my best friend had the Hong Kong. She said that the Hong Kong was life changing. I really like that they use Califia Farms Almond Milk (for their dairy substitute) too, you can taste the quality of the ingredients that they put in. 

PLEASE OPEN ONE IN LA!
author: Jacklyn K.

description:
I visited this location of Boba Guys tonight and enjoyed a delicious Dirty Horchata drink with boba. The ambiance here is far superior to the one on Stockton - and gave me just the right vibe. I really love seeing tea shops take on the ambiance of cafes and coffee empires. 

Boba Guys really focuses on quality and has definitely won my support as a loyal customer. I want to give some other shops a try in the bay area - but part of me just wants to have Boba Guys everyday while I'm here! The employees are also really friendly at the register and helpful - I didn't feel like I was being rushed to make a choice even though I'm super indecisive at the register (and in life lol). 

One thing I also really like about Boba Guys is that their drinks aren't overly loaded with sugar - you can customize the sweetness - but regardless of that I don't feel like the drinks really need sugar to taste good on their own and that is appreciated!

Little by little I hope to make my way through the menu - but I know more trips from Tampa to San Francisco are going to be needed for more Boba Guys experiences!
author: Carlos H.

description:
Boba Guys has always been my go-to for high quality pearl drinks. This location in particular is really nice, because they have seats and small tables for those post dinner catch up sessions with friends or a nice study space! All their other locations are more for grab & go, so it's nice they decided to open a shop that lets people hang out. They also have a little book nook in the front by the register, which is an awesome addition.

When I last came here, I got their regular milk tea with pearls and my friend got the strawberry matcha drink with pearls for his first time. If you're feeling adventurous, definitely get the latter! I tried it once before at their mission location and really liked it, but this time around I was feeling something more comforting to the soul. Whenever I go to any Boba guys, I'm never disappointed. Service is always super friendly and great, and the workers are always willing to do a run down of the menu if need be. If anything, boba guys is probably the equivalent of what those may consider a third wave coffee brand, instead third wave boba.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Big fan of this location of Boba Guys. There are less lines and more space to sit- but not sure if the boba here is as consistent or delicious their OG location in the Mission. Would love if they had a rewards program like other places, but they don't currently have one :/

I usually stick with the classic milk teas - which are all very solid - clearly not powder and the milk is rich and creamy. Can't go wrong with Thai Tea (though you can't adjust the sweetness down since it's already brewed), Hong Kong Style Milk Tea (condensed milk, yasss), Classic Black Tea, or Jasmine Green Tea. 

I have yet to try out their fruitier flavors/ more premium milk tea flavors, but I'll be back for next time.
author: Kristie M.

description:
Unlike a lot of other Boba Guys locations, this one has seating and a few nooks to sit down at. I'm sure it still gets crowded like a lot of the other places but when I happened to stop by it wasn't too busy and gave me a much needed place to sit and take my tea break.

The tea is great as it always seems to be with Boba Guys. The strawberry maccha latte with oat milk is my go-to and I'll go out of my way to get one when I'm in the city.

If you have dairy intolerance there are multiple milk alternatives to choose from, and sweetness and toppings can easily be customized.
author: Pandora C.

description: I was excited to try this place. Milky tea made to order and they have quality non-dairy milk avail. I expected to love my drink considering the price and fanciness.  However the tea was oversteeped and bitter, even with the milk added.  I'll just make my tea at home from now on.
author: Sasha R.

description:
First time visit.  My daughter is somewhat a regular at BG but not this branch.  She felt like a Pearl Drink so she dragged us all along.

The "Boba Guys Sundae" on the menu caught my eye.  It was Ube ice cream with a scoop of custard which sounded good.  When the order came up, I was surprised to see that the color of the ice cream was a cream color - not purple.  I could care less really about the color, but the Ube flavor was definitely lacking.  In fact, if I was blindfolded I'm sure I would be hard pressed to identify the flavor.  It wasn't worth the calories and I ended up giving it away.

My daughter enjoyed her Jasmine Milk Tea w/pearls, although she said you can find better tasting pearls at other Boba shops.  Her favorite shop is Tea-Era in Cupertino.
author: Darien R.
