description: Best boba place in town! So happy there are two locations. This is my go-to boba place if I ever need a drink thats tasty and something other than water. This place can get crazy at times so its good to find a time to avoid the lines. The strawberry calpico drink is amazing!! Like hands down its the best. I highly recommend that drink with coconut jelly. You will walk out feeling satisfied and refreshed!
author: John M.

description: Lines were long it seems like it took forever to order, but fast to get the drinks. Tried about 4 fdifgerent milk teas and it wasn't good, jelly Yates like it's from a can... but the matcha strawberry matcha is really good, milktea tastes bland
author: Lyna N.

description:
I'm from SoCal and I think the boba competition here beats NorCal...but this place is pretty good. I don't think that their drinks are particularly any more amazing than other places- but the quality of their teas is definitely paramount. I also think it's cool how you can customize the sweetness of certain drinks! 

I really enjoyed sitting by the bar area- one of the baristas/tearistas sampled a bunch of delicious teas for us to try! So sweet!
author: Juliana P.

description: I've only went to Boba Guys once and I must say the location itself is extremely beautiful and spacious! I love the decorations and arrangement of their menus and items around the entire store. The customer service when I went was extremely professional and kind. There's really no better way to be treated, especially when all I had in my mind is "BOBA PLEASE!" After receiving my beverage, it was absolutely amazing and I highly recommend everyone to try Boba Guys when you're around the area!
author: James V.

description: the strawberry matcha latte was good... its jus so hard to find a parking for this place...
author: Michael P.

description:
So this is my second time trying boba guys, first time at this location and I still don't see the hype??? The first time I had their matcha latte and it was ok, don't remember exactly how it tasted like because it was a while back. So I decided to try boba guys again since it was right off the freeway thinking that it was convenient..it was not. Parking was pretty limited, we had to circle the block a few times to find a spot in a sketch alley. 

Now onto the drink... I ordered the horchata and it was definitely not what I expected. To be honest, it tasted like the milk leftover after eating a bowl of Cinnamon Toast Crunch. It wasn't terrible but just not for me. Also, the boba was super hard. It tasted as if it was sitting out for hours. All in all, I think I'm going to stick to other spots for my boba because boba guys is a bit pricey for me and their drinks aren't exactly my cup of tea.
author: Joanne C.

description:
Being from LA I've had all sorts of Boba. I've had bad Boba and I've had good Boba. And when I say Boba I'm specifically talking about the tapioca balls. I don't care for the drink itself, usually. It just needs to be simple and not too sweet. I'm more into the texture of the Boba itself than the drink. The balls need to have that perfect balance between chewy and sweet. I despise Boba that's hard at the center. Hate it. The same goes for the mushy and unsweetened ones. Bleh. 

There's a lot of hype about this place. Being a Boba lover I had to try it when in SF. There wasn't too bad of a wait when my friend and I got here. It's a nice place, really simple and clean. The staff was very nice and helpful if you're new and unsure. Since I don't usually like complex Boba drinks I got the usual: green/jasmine milk tea with Boba, light ice. I got regular sweetness and regular milk. The drink was sweetened perfectly and the Boba itself was as well. However, my issue here is with the texture of the tapioca. While it was chewy, it didn't have that certain bounce that I adore from places like Half & Half or F.T.B. I was a bit disappointed. The drink itself wasn't bad; I'm just very critical.
author: Jia L.

description: Ordered a strawberry matcha latte, first time drinking boba guys. The strawberries jam was just too sweet for me and the matcha was just OK. Overall the drink tasted more like a juice than real tea.
author: Liyu W.

description:
Freaking outrageously incredible strawberry milk drink with the finest boba around town in my opinion. They have several vegan and decaf options which was great for me. I tried the oat milk and it was very rich, creamy and delicious. 

Aside from the quality of their ingredients and the modern but relaxed environment at this location, the staff were super friendly and helpful for me. They were patient and helped me navigate their various options and were willing to let me modify some of the menu items. I'll definitely be back.
author: Jay N.

description:
Now been to all three locations in San Francisco and this one is by far the best - ample seating, usually not a line and terrific lighting/backdrop for those Instagram pics :D 

The drink you're looking for with the colorful layers is the strawberry matcha latte. Also recommend the black sesame drink for a less picturesque and equally tasty option. They also have seasonal drinks - like a pumpkin flavored something, which keeps me coming back to stay current.

After unknowingly drinking powder / artificially sweetened boba back in the days, I'm ready to upgrade. You can genuinely taste the difference in their strawberry flavors, since if I'm not mistaken they make their own jam.  

Also seems like they're expanding their menu options to include more food, like Kaya toast and onigilly YES. 

You win, Boba Guys. The boba revolution has begun.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Overpriced delicious milk tea in a hipster setting with long lines. 
I'm not gonna lie, the tea was good. It was delicious. It was definitely in my like top 20 tea places. I liked that I could customize the tea any way I wanted. But it's a bit pricey for what you get. I'd recommend going there if you want to treat yourself.
author: Jasmine N.

description:
Boba Guys is my favorite boba shop in the city, and I personally like this location the best. The interior is pretty large compared to the other locations. Every time I've been here I was able to actually find a spot to sit and chill.

I only ever order black milk teas from boba shops, so that's my point of comparison. My favorite drink is the HK milk tea at 100% sweetness. I'll usually ask for less sugar at any other boba place, but the sweetness level here isn't too overwhelming. The milk tea is a bit frothy and their boba is super fresh and soft.

I'm glad I don't live near a Boba Guys because I would treat myself every day and probably turn into a boba ball.
author: Alexis N.

description: As an asian, how could I possibly resist a hyped up boba place? The boba here was good, but the drink was only decent. It was overwhelmingly sweet even though I have already controlled the sweetness. I love the staff and how friendly they were. The line was long and this place was overhyped.
author: Lucy P.

description:
I never thought boba would have a renaissance, but Boba Guys achieved it!

I was a big fan of boba back in the early 2000's, but everyone was serving it in pretty much the same ways. The artisanal slant of Boba Guys' offerings has been wonderful. The ingredients are startingly delightful. Although I still love tapioca pearls themselves, I actually love egg pudding more. The BG's homemade pudding is awesome: firm, creamy, fresh. 

Looks like menu options can vary based on location. I've enjoyed both the Strawberry Rice Milk and the Taro Smoothie. There is no artificial tasting flavor that you usually get at typical boba shops because of non-dairy creamer. The taro wasn't the typical lavender chalk! 

Since the drinks are a bit pricy, I only indulge myself occasionally with BG treats. The Hayes Valley location is such a beautiful space - great light and soothing finishes (tile, wood, stone). It's somewhat small, so don't expect to hunker down with a big group here.
author: Tina W.

description: I finally got it try it after my friend talked about it almost every day. She's a huge fan of Matcha and so I got the Matcha boba. Honestly, it was simply amazing. I regretted it a lot that I didn't have discovered this place earlier.
author: Megan Z.

description:
I love you boba guys!

The Hong Kong milk tea is my go-to for a reason. Not only does it remind me of the authentic milk teas I have whenever I return to Hong Kong, but it's actually (do I dare say it?) better...

I don't know how to describe how their milk teas make me feel but it's definitely the best I've ever had. I recently had their strawberry matcha latte and it was really good as well! Definitely would be my pick if ever I crave something fruity when I come here!
author: Tiffany W.

description: I must always have to visit Boba Guys every time I'm in SF. I love their iced strawberry jasmine tea drink. It's quite refreshing and the right amount of sweetness. Overall, the atmosphere and location is hipster/modern. The place gets quite busy so I applaud the staff for working efficiently in making sure everyone gets their drink without having to wait for long. I love this place very much and will always be coming back when in the city exploring.
author: Tuyen H.

description:
My friend and I were hanging out around Civic Center and she told me how great Boba Guys was. I've never tried it so I wanted to give it a shot. When I first stepped in, I was amazed by the interior decor of the shop. So hipster, I loved it! 

I personally love floral teas so I ordered the lavender black milk tea with boba and soy and half sweet. The lavender taste was pretty strong, the way I like it. The boba had the perfect texture and sweetness. I wouldn't say I crave Boba Guys or that it's my favorite, but I will definitely want to try everything else on the menu. 

Note: good vibes, good tea, black and white, natural lighting, good boba
author: Jessica C.

description: I've been to Boba Guys a few times now and of the few times I've been, all of my experiences have been great! The drink choices are amazing and they're something different than the usual drinks/flavors​ that I find at other boba stores. The amount of toppings available is still a little limited, but that's nothing too big to worry about. The interior styling of the store has a really modern feel to it and is very suitable for young people of this generation (like me). Looking forward to buying from Boba Guys again and again!
author: Tiffany C.

description: My husband and I are visiting from out of town  (Houston!) , where the milk tea places are pretty good as well. One of our friends recommended this place and we liked it. The milk tea didn't taste like pure sugar (I ordered half sweet regular milk tea with the organic milk , almond jelly). My husband  ordered the lychee  green tea with tapioca and aloe jelly, no sugar . He has a bit  of a sweet tooth and he thought it was "bitter" but again, he loves his sweets! But he did finish his drink  and enjoyed  his tapioca  jelly. For my milk tea, I enjoyed how I could actually taste the drink and it didn't feel like pure sugar. Also, the almond jelly was delicious ! The line was out the door the entire time we were there, and we were there with some friends who live in San Fran for over two hours, approximately.  A great place to visit :)
author: Charlene T.

description: The ambiance was very homey and aesthetic. Parking is a struggle (no duh it's SF). I have gone to the other 2 Boba Guys locations and this one is the biggest. Boba Guys is always a hit depending on what you like. This time I tried the Hong Kong style. It was okay, not for my liking, but was bearable. Very sweet and strong. I was actually kept up all night because of how late I had it. Service was friendly and kind enough to describe this drink to me.
author: Kimberly D.

description:
Hype hipster fancy boba. I've been to my fair share of good boba joints in LA and had high expectation here due to the raving reviews. I got the strawberry matcha latte with soy milk and boba. Pretty colors and great for insta and snap. After I mixed it all together, it tasted like a watered down strawberry smoothie and the matcha flavor disappeared. I got the 16oz and with boba it was $5. Dang. Maybe I need to get used to SF price boba but for a little cup of drink at $5 that didn't taste that great wasn't worth it for me. 

We came on a weekday around 7pm and it was near empty. So not that crowded at night from what I see. 

They do change their menu frequently and my friend ordered the egg horchata with egg pudding. His drinking was $6! Yikes. The drink tasted like a normal horchata you can get at a Mexican fast food place. 

I appreciate that they are trying to bring boba to the American market but I think I'll stick with the more Asian boba places like sharetea or t4. Overall, come once to see what the hype is about. Otherwise if you don't really care, other decent boba joints in the bay will do just fine. Esp with the price points.
author: Sarah I.

description:
I love the Boba Guys in the Mission but I have to say that this location is definitely winning some / all of my boba points. The decor and ambiance is 10 times better because there's actually seating inside the store. Plenty of the space and I love the Hayes Valley area so everything is a plus. 

The best part? The tea tasting corner! The person I talked with (sad that I didn't get his name) was super knowledgeable about his tea. We shared our tea experience from our tasting at Song's Tea and Ceramics. My friends and I didn't have time to try the tea flight but I will consider that next time I'm in the area. I would recommend chatting it up with the workers or try the tea flights if you want some more background in where they source the tea or the different types of tea that Boba Guys uses. 

My typical go-to drink is always the Strawberry Matcha but I love how they have the jasmine milk tea to-go in a bottle. One to drink and one to-go? Of course! The price is pretty standard and Boba Guys will remain of my favorite boba spots in the city :) 

(Parking is a bit hard to find in the area but I didn't have too look for too long to find a spot on  a Sunday).
author: Tram N.

description:
First time at this Boba Guys location and like the other ones I've been to, it did not disappoint! The line was out the door just to the corner, but moved along pretty fast and the workers were efficient in taking orders.

Usually order the matcha latte but this time around I ordered the coffee milk tea for the first time with almond milk at 25% sweetness and enjoyed it! The coffee was not watered down or too strong and you could actually taste the tea from the milk tea, so I thought it was a good balance of coffee and milk tea since one wasn't overpowering the other and vice versa. 

Also had a sip of my friends' matcha latte and strawberry matcha latte, which were both very delicious. Don't forget to stir the matcha latte well though so you don't get a big sip of honey as it may be too sweet.  First time trying the strawberry matcha latte and the combo of the strawberry and matcha works well together and not too sweet. Will definitely get it next time I go back and recommend it if you are a fan of matcha and want to try something different!
author: Andrea F.

description: Really yummy matcha boba! I love how you can pick your milk, which includes a non dairy option & you can choose your sweetness level which is amazing because i can't tell you how many times I've ordered boba and it was so sweet that it was undrinkable - this was perfect!! I also usually don't like boba balls and loved deez balls yo
author: Courtney C.

description: I want to love Boba Guys, I really do, but just not blown away by these guys. I've tried their Jasmine Milk Tea with organic milk and boba, which is just fine. But it's that... just  fine. It has strong tea flavor, but not milky enough. I do like the texture of the boba, which had good texture and slightly sweet, and 25% sweetness is the perfect amount of sweetness. I'd say about 1/3 of the cup was filled with ice :( The 16 oz goes by really fast, so I'd up the size if I try it again. I tried my friend's Thai tea, which was good, but it's also really hard to mess up Thai iced tea.
author: Ke C.

description: I got the strawberry matcha latte. We parked our car around boba guys, got drinks, walked to dinner, and on our way back I had to buy another drink. I am so in love with this place now! It was so good and also super pretty!! First time I got it I got it with soy milk, tapioca, and normal ice. I knew I shouldn't drink a second one in the same day, so I got it with soy milk but no ice so I could save it for later without it getting watered down. To my surprise, even when you get no ice, they still fill the cup all the way! Some places you can see that they put less in the cup where there would normally be ice. If you are confused about what to get. Please please please do yourself a favor and get the strawberry matcha latte (if you like matcha that is).
author: Trini B.

description: I'm picky with boba but here, it is so chewy and delicious. I like their house made almond jelly too! Strawberry matcha latte is addicting.
author: Michelle L.

description: Finally got to try this place for the first time last week! I couldn't decide if I wanted to try to Matcha Latte or the Strawberry Matcha Latte.  I went with the Strawberry Matcha Latte because that was something they looked popular for on Yelp.  I was too excited and got the biggest size and should've gotten almond milk or soy.  I had an upset stomach after finishing the drink, but it was pretty good! It was something different than other milk tea places, and the boba (pearls) were sooo good! Not too sweet and great to chew haha. I would love to try other things on the menu! Grab a drink and head to Dolores Park after. Definitely something good to sip on while enjoying a great view :)
author: Leanne N.

description: Honestly don't know what's the differentiator between the Boba Guys and any other boba places that costs more than $3.  Yes I guess the drink quality is pretty good but is it a deal breaker? Naw.
author: Fumihiko S.

description: I'd been very eager to try this place bc I've heard and seen this all over social media. So it seemed promising. I can really appreciate boba shops that use all real ingredients bc it's just higher quality. But I have to say that I was left w a subpar impression. Idk if it was the drink I ordered or if all they're drinks are more on the light/bland side but it was okay. And I know you can adjust the drinks to your own preference. I'll definitely give this place another shot when I'm back in the city, so I won't say it was overall not great.
author: Samantha L.

description: This has been long overdue from my first review.  Ever since my debacle with their pineapple cakes, the owners of Boba Guys made up by replacing my pineapple cakes as well as a free bag and more cookies.  The owners so nice and accommodating to fix the mistakes.  It took me a while to go back, but now I have full faith with them again.  I've ordered from them three times in 2 weeks.  My standard is the classic milk tea with 50% sweetness... but now I've upgraded to the Golden Honey Black.  I like the fact that their ingredients are fresh compared to the international chains (I-tea, Sharetea, Quickly) where there is a particular filmy tea taste.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Boba Guys occupies the top tierl of boba crafters i've experieced.
 in the beginning, Quickly and Tap. Ex, etc brought boba to everyone using premade ingredients. (syrups, premade boba/soga, sweeteners, premade tea). other Boba crafters used italian sodas, made their own boba.

Boba Guys appears. selling everything self made(boba, selected tea (not self grown as i know),milk sourced locally, not crema. alcoholic boba tea (burp!)

taiwan boba is all in:: Sharetea, Monster, I-tea. Gongcha, Chatime, Kung Fu, T4U. etc/
-all interesting with their strengths and weakness (too much ice/sugar)

drink:Hong Kong Milk tea (3.75)m
-strong tea taste with characteristic bitterness of good tea.
-it's been so long since tasting HK milk tea. B. Guys nailed it.

take outs:
-toasts, waffles, various pastries, chocolates. and teas available.
-large seating area though stretched out.
-new creations constantly, haven't kept up.,
author: Victor G.

description:
This location is amazing because it actually has tables for you to sit and chill! 

Since I always get the hong kong milk tea, I opted to try their bottled milk teas. It was tasty and not too sweet!! I wish I could've brought a cooler back of Boba Guys milk tea with me back to LA! ): 

Boba guys is definitely my favorite boba shop in the whole Bay Area. Quality and constancy is on point every time I go!
author: Lisa W.

description: I like this location which is bigger with big glass windows. I like ordering things that are different, so I got the black sesame latte with boba. The flavor was not lacking, but I wouldn't say I would order this again. There are lots of other drinks I would like to try.
author: Helen H.

description: Honestlyyyyy. All boba guys are the same but this location is slightly less crowded than the others. The tapiocas are a little too sweet but most people like that. I would ask for less ice and sugar! Their drink options are so unique :) Sesame latte and strawberry matcha latte is so good XD
author: S L.

description:
my friend got a jasmine milk tea ($4.25) which had a moderate tea flavor and a good level of sugar. overall solid milk tea but nothing special about it. 

i got a strawberry matcha latte ($4.75), which was delicious. the matcha is strong, and holds its own against the sweet strawberry (which i'm glad to say tastes like the fruit rather than say, strawberry milk or some other form of fake strawberry). and the whole milk makes it super creamy and mellows everything out oh so nicely. 

solid place to get milk tea and such, but the parking here (and at their mission outpost) can be a bear.
author: Heather F.

description: Been coming here for awhile now and in love! Matcha latte & Strawberry Matcha are definitely my favorites... the only thing that kills me is the price. A large Strawberry Matcha + boba is $6.25..... BUT I would say this is the most high quality matcha boba I've had in the city.
author: Carrie L.

description: What a great addition to Hayes Valley. I am loving the teas and milk teas here, even though I am not a huge fan of their boba. The coffee milk tea boba was a great coffee flavor. Not that artificial coffee flavor at all. If you're looking for something special, check out their specials board. And I recommend the tea frescas. I like the strawberry pineapple tea Fresca. Very refreshing. I also liked the iced matcha tea latte. The matcha flavor was strong. You can even customize your sweetness level. Even the regular sweetness is a little too sweet for me. Fairly large menu with interesting flavors like the black sesame latte. I keeping coming back for more! They will also have a tea bar that offers tea flights. Nice space with casual seating.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I've been to Boba Guys a couple of times before way back when and yesterday, I really was wanting some Almond Jelly so I went. My my have times changed. Drinks are def better and for the first time in a long time, I ordered a milk tea plus 3 other drinks but still a milk tea. The Strawberry Matcha Latte to be exact. I was impressed and the only reason, its not a 5 is because its still a bit over priced for a little cup. 

I ordered:
1. Rose Tea with Almond Jelly - LEGIT even unsweetened
2. Strawberry Matcha Latte - they were nice enough to add less strawberry but it was GOOD. drinking strawbery milk which was a youth fav of mine
3. Mango Matcha Fresca - simple matcha cold brew with mango puree - also delish and not too sweet
4. Lychee Green Tea for the hubs - he gave it 2 thumbs  up too.

Def 4.5 if it was't so pricey but then again at least I know its organic?
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Aardvarks and all, Boba Guys be baaack at it + the flagship is #igdaily. 

+1 as always for the quality + customization. For the unenlightened: you can choose sweetness levels, toppings (boba/jellies), caffeine/non, milk (reg/almond/soy), and of course the delightful seasonal flavors like raspberry-fresca-glory-filled-mango-jango-idk.

I always stick with my classic milk tea, but here I'm intrigued by the tea flight - the guy at the bar was knowledgeable and super enthusiastic so that's next on the list. 

Ordered the classic HK brioche toast & a salmon sriracha rice ball (comes with a mini edamame slaw salad). I don't even like sriracha, but the flavor was mild enough that it added a nice little zing to it. They gave us the other toast (a coconutty jam one) on the house too since they made the wrong one at first. If you like thick slabs of brioche, butter, and all the good things in life then you'll like these.

Like a third wave coffeeshop, except tea! Whee!!
author: Vicky G.

description: I've been to the Boba Guys in the Mission a few times now and this was my first visit to the Hayes Valley location. This location is much more spacious and open, with beautiful glass windows facing Octavia. I stopped by with my sister, niece, and nephew on Sunday and there was a line out the door. I know Boba Guys was popular, but I don't remember it being this popular! We ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea, Regular Milk Tea, and the Strawberry Matcha Latte.The Strawberry Matcha Latte was by far my favorite - it was the perfect balance of strawberry and matcha flavors, neither flavor over-powered the other. Their boba and grass jelly were good as well.
author: Elaine N.

description:
I had their jasmine milk tea from a food truck and it tasted clean and refreshing. I was shocked at the high quality and strong tea taste. When I visited today, I was trying to keep my expectations low just in case whatever I got tasted bad. I came at 11:50 am so the store wasn't open and there was no line. 

This is the first time I have ordered matcha flavored milk tea. I got the strawberry matcha and it was very good!! The strawberry purée at the bottom complemented the matcha. I also tried the scoop of custard: black sesame. It was not too rich. Will definitely be coming back if in the city.
author: Uma A.

description:
Out of all the boba stores in the Bay, Boba Guys is the BEST (my absolute favorite, if you couldn't tell). They never fail to deliver quality drinks and service.

Their shops in the Mission and Union Square were small and couldn't do their brand more justice. So I'm super thrilled to see that they opened this flagship store. What's different is that they:

1. Have made-to-order food e.g. onigiri, toast (coming soon)
2. Include a bar offering tea flights
3. Are in an accessible location with more parking options
4. Have seats and tables, outside seating too! 
5. Have a clean environment with high ceilings and tall illuminating windows

You can tell they have definitely looked at their performance in their other shops and are being very successful and creative in reinventing the tea space. 

DRINKS:
My (and a lot of my friends') favorite is the Muscat Oolong Milk Tea with Almond Milk and Boba. As expected, the flavor is consistent with the drink I get from their other shops. Their balls are always chewy and sweet and pair well with the drink.

Other notables include Strawberry Jasmine Tea Fresca (refreshing and sweet) and Strawberry Matcha Latte (very strong matcha flavor and not that sweet). I've yet to try more, but their selection always blows other places out of the water (or "tea").

Note: Their Large is more of the equivalent of a Regular size you would get at another boba store. What I'm saying is, if you get the Regular here, you will finish it and then ask yourself "That was it?!"

Excited to see what's next for Boba Guys, as they supposedly open a 4th location in Potrero in the near future.
author: Scott C.

description:
Boba Guys flagship store is very unique. I'm an avid third-wave coffee drinker and enjoy exploring different roasts and brew methods. Until now, I've never thought about the tea experience in the same as coffee. To me, Boba was always a grab-and-go drink, not a scientific craft. 

We got a trick or treat tea flight (and horchata milk tea) from our barista Benjamin who went above and beyond to deliver a memorable visit.  It's rare to find a barista that is so knowledgeable and passionate about what they do. I found this very inspiring and characteristic to the "tea people" bar.

I would highly recommend getting a tea flight for the exposure into the world of tea. Benjamin did a great job explaining what characteristics to look for in each tea and how those hints of flavor came to be.
author: Watson L.

description: Nothing's ready by 11am    totally unprepared. Big let down.  I only was able to buy 2 drinks
author: Emily C.

description:
Boba Guys never fails me. 

The tea quality is as good as it gets and the interior of this building makes it a great low-key hangout spot. I usually get the jasmine or matcha latte w/o strawberry. 

When my friend and I were there, the tea maker invited us to sit at the tea bar and offered us free tea tastings of their oolong teas. I can't remember the name of the tea, but the charcoal oolong was amazing! I love the bottom of the rice pot burnt taste and this tea sample hit the spot! I would definitely go back and test out more of the teas from the bar.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Great! But I came in one morning for bubble tea and they told me they don't make tapioca before noon. It's so random, why are you open then? Why doesn't it say that on your menu or anywhere else? Just FYI.
author: Anastasia O.

description:
Boba Guys is pretty hyped, and I think most of the drinks on their menu are worth it. 

It's always really busy, so be ready to wait in a line! 

I would recommend the strawberry matcha latte, which my friends and I (almost) always go for. It's definitely a fan favorite!
author: Michelle P.

description:
we ordered 3 drinks. they screwed up on 2 drinks. 1/3 accuracy is not good.
on top of that, besides screwing up the 2 of the 3 drinks in the order, the drinks were not made with the same consistency. two of the drinks were HK milk teas. The HK milk teas were of different consistency as one had more tea and the other had more milk.  HK milk tea did remind me of hk milk tea but on the watered down side.  Everything tasted great overall, but messing up the orders and having inconsistent drinks within the same order didn't shout high quality control.

oh yea, after ordering, it took more than 10 mins to get the drinks with no one ahead of us. workers just seemed spaced out?
author: Jason C.

description:
I loveeee me some boba, but as I was walking through to find a table to work at, the "tea geek" at the back counter enticed me over to try some just-steeped pu-erh in a cute little beaker and I was hooked! 

I decided to get the milk oolong which is so smooth, sweet and creamy without the addition of milk. A perfect hot tea for a cold day. 

One star off for no outlets :/ A beautiful modern place with great service and tea though- highly recommend!
author: Jill L.

description: Strawberry matcha latte is as good as advertised. So bomb. But 4 stars because it's so dam expensive. Must try if you in town tho.
author: Kevin C.

description:
The strawberry matcha latte with tapioca balls is my absolute favorite drink. You can't adjust the sweetness like their other drinks, but you could always ask to have more of the strawberry purée or tea if you don't like their default sweetness. Their tapioca balls aren't too sweet, which is actually perfect for the drink because I hate when the tapioca balls are too sweet since that affects the taste of the drink. 

The only downside of this NEW location would be that the door is too small since there are people in line to order which takes up half or more of the space and people are also trying to squeeze by to leave.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Oh man, Boba Guys is good.

I used to write it off as "hipster bubble tea" (aka why would I pay more for bubble tea with great branding and aesthetics?) but the quality is undeniable.

I love that they have Califia Farm almond milk and organic soy milk since many people (especially Asians) are lactose-intolerant. The menu and ordering process is so organized and the Hayes Valley location is beautiful and sleek. 

My friends were not a fan of the matcha drink (too bitter) but I loved my jasmine milk tea with boba -- it wasn't too sweet, the flavor was fragrant and nice, and the tapioca was perfectly chewy. I'd love to come back and try the black sesame, horchata, and coffee milk tea!
author: Valerie L.

description:
This is amazingly big. Way bigger than the other 2 branches I've been. They also have a cool tea bar where you can drink tea and have tea flights and tea pairings. (Kind of reminds me of Asha's tea bar in Berkeley)

Also kudos to the fantastic guy at the tea bar who gave us tea samples and helped us take photos. (And plus points for trying to get Pu erh pronounced right!)
author: Han Teng W.

description: The boba guys in downtown San Francisco is way better. The milk tea taste watered down and it was hard to find parking in that area.
author: Weiwei L.

description:
Kinda annoyed bc of the cashier I encountered last night (09/09/17 @ around 9:30). I went to the union square boba guys  2 weeks ago and got a really good drink from there. So I was craving it and came to this boba guys. I couldn't find the drink on the menu anywhere so i described the exact way they described it on the menu at boba guys union sq. " strawberry tea w/ a shot of milk in it" the cashier didn't know what the hell i was talking about and kinda gave me a stank face :/ so I was like ok w/e I'll get another drink. 
After waiting for my drink I looked through boba guys union sq yelp and... oh I found the name of the drink! It was "strawberry cream". When my drink was done I asked the barista if they had strawberry cream drink there. And it turns out it's on the secret menu. Well, it all makes sense now! But I was just annoyed how the cashier was not helpful at all. She should know the menu even the ones on the secret menu. Not only that, I asked for a regular & she charged me for a large
author: Kim Vy T.

description: The only legit Boba Guys is in the Mission. These Hayes Valley guys, can called themselves Boba Imposters. The boba pearls at this location are far worse quality than the ones in the Mission. Seriously, please make your boba pearl quality consistent across all locations. I don't understand why this is so difficult to do. The boba pearls at the Mission location are to die for!!!
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
To be frank, I feel like this place is overhyped. A lot of people seem to rave about the Strawberry Matcha Latte so I finally gave it a try. I had high hopes for this place since the first Boba Guys location opened on Stockton Street. Never seemed to make it to their original location. 

Their marketing is done so well which is why I believe they are blooming as a business. So about the drink, it was alright. It wasn't as amazing as I thought it would be. I just don't think strawberry goes well with matcha. BUT, I would like to say that they made their boba really really good. I'd have to come back to try other drinks on their menu but not sure when that would be since parking is such a hassle for all of their locations.

Their service is a bit slow. There was maybe a couple of orders before me and over 6 people working but it took over 10 mins for my drink to come out. I mean if there were 6 people back there, the service could have been a bit quicker...
author: Silvia N.

description: Love love love love THIS PLACE it's the best boba guys in the CITY  U GUYS Rock in every way.
author: Ely Y.

description:
I went around 5-6pm, and it was soooo packed! There was a line, and it was hot. Why would I make such a decision to go here? Because I'm basic, and they had matcha pour over + their sesame latte. The overall drink was alright, pretty underwhelming. Matcha pour over + black sesame is super bitter, but if youre a masochist and love boba guys, might as well try it. I think the only reputable item at boba guys is their strawberry matcha latte. Its always consistently aesthetic af, and it tastes great. Otherwise, I think you can get better boba som ewhere else. 
However, I can just bag on the establishment. The people are super kind, and made this secret menu item (matcha sesame latte) for me w/o any sass. If anything, I like the mission location better just b/c of Dolores park + birite ice cream. 
The space is wide w/ decent seating. I dont think it will accommodate everyone in line, but you can definitely find seating if you want. Downside is that theres a green house effect inside. It felt soo hot, like the hot air was trapped in there.
author: Aleex J.

description:
Review based on the Hong Kong Milk Tea:

Fortunate enough to not wait in a ridiculous line for boba. Having just come back from a trip to Hong Kong with a new obsession with HK style milk tea I was so excited to see this on their menu. Ordered the Hong Kong milk tea with boba and was SO disappointed. Their HK Milk tea tastes like regular Taiwanese style milk tea. No special condense milk/evaporated milk and lack of the strong tea brew that defines a HK milk tea. 

Order the HK milk tea if you want your average milk tea, but don't expect a special cup of HK cafe style milk tea that is 10x tastier than regular milk tea.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Finally Boba Guys has made me change my mind about them. Before, I made the conclusion that they were just an overhyped and over sweet boba shop. BUT NO MORE. 

I chanced upon their new flagship store when looking for a place to do work at night on the weekends (they close at 10pm). I really like their new store vibes and they even have a fluorescent sign that just screams "Instagram spot"! 

I got their coffee milk tea with regular sweetness and boba. As always their boba is the best in SF but this time I was pleasantly surprised that their coffee milk tea was not overly sweet and it was a great drink  

I'll definitely be back!
author: Sean S.

description: Being a longtime supporter of Boba Guys, my friend was able to work her magic and book this place for a private party (a surprise birthday gathering for her husband). This is a great new space, with lots more room to sit than BG's other locations. This is their flagship store with all of their regular retail, plus a few extra items like egg pudding addition to boba, a tea bar, and a chocolate drink on the menu. They also have different varieties of onigiri that they rotate in and out. Definitely worth checking out if you're a Boba Guys fan!! The "Boba Guys" are usually around, working behind the counter and ensuring the best experience possible. Always great to see them in the kitchen!
author: Christina G.

description:
tldr; same high quality Boba Guys you know and love but with a new revamp with seats and a tea bar with tea flights!

I've been a big fan of Boba Guys since the beginning, and it's awesome to see their latest evolution in their shops. This is the 3rd Boba Guys in SF -- it's located in Hayes Valley, and it's their first SF shop that has seats! I've always loved their drinks and food but have never been able to sit and enjoy my tea in a set place. 

Same usual Boba Guys goodness, but with a special twist. This Boba Guys has a Tea People section that is essentially a tea bar. They have tea flights and other special teas to try. I didn't get a chance to try during this week's soft opening, but am definitely looking forward to coming back when they're open full time. Place is very spacious, lots of bar seating and some table seating in the back. It's in a beautiful glass building just a few minutes away from Patricia's Green at the heart of Hayes Valley, so it's a super convenient, easily accessible location. Huge upgrade from their Mission and Union Square stores. 

I got the Hong Kong Milk Tea hot and the Hong Kong toast. Given that it's still their soft opening and I think they're still trying to work out kinks in the shop, it was pretty good. Service is a bit slow for hot drinks, but they made the toast much more quickly than their other stores. The HK milk tea was a little less sweet than I expected relative to their normal drink, but still delicious. HK toast is still one of my favorite Boba Guys signature desserts -- a thick slab of brioche with some of the most delicious creamy buttercream and honey you'll ever get. In general, this third store is definitely still serving the same high quality Boba Guys goodness.

Boba Guys definitely has some of the most authentic tasting tea in the city, so I'm really excited about having this location so I can have tea in the store! We also had a sample of their oolong tea to introduce us to Tea People -- I love that they serve everything in a beaker, it's awesome.

Great experience so far -- looking forward to seeing what they come up with in the upcoming months!
author: Jasmine X.

description:
I don't so usually come to this location so -- NO. Will health and safety inspection please check this place out!? Why did I find a long stringy straight black hair in my tuna/kimchi rice ball?

Boba Guys please stop and clean up this location, it's gross. Signed A Concerned Customer.
author: Lil R.

description:
I come here about four times a week and get milk tea almost everyday. Can say I'm well versed in my boba game. I spend about 7 hours studying here at a time and the staff is friendly, environment is perf. I try expanding my horizons by ordering something new but ALWAYZZZZ go back to the Jasmine Milk Tea.  I do regular sweetness, light ice Cus I like to drink mine slow and don't want it watered down. You can ask for less sweetener, but in case it's not sweet enough, they have sweetener in a container next to the straws and you can add more yourself. 

I tried their non-caffeinated black milk tea but wasn't a fan. 

Pros: high quality boba, unique menu, cute aesthetics, fast free wifi, clean bathroom, good music, young demographic lol, free water in a cute container where you can help yourself. There's usually available tables to study/do work, as well as a communal table. They also got cute little to-go premade regular and jasmine milk tea jugs, but there's no boba included. 

Cons: parking- I usually get lucky parking right on Octavia in front of boba guys but half the time parking is restricted due to construction. However you're allowed to park closest to the stoplight even though there are "motorcycle" looking lines on the ground. I've asked plenty of times. THE LINE, sometimes goes out the door and wraps around the corner which suxxx when it's cold outside.
author: Alana T.

description:
Jasmine Milk Tea |$3.50| 

Love love love boba guys ! This place is so vintage looking and loved that they opened this location. The milk tea itself is good quality and the fact that you can adjust the sweetness level is a plus ! My favorite is def the jasmine milk tea with almond jelly ! I'm in love with the milk tea and just has to get a togo while I was there !
author: Terilyn W.

description: Did not like the matcha strawberry at all. So sweet and thick consistency. And the tuna kimchi onigiri wasn't great.
author: Laura D.

description: I've been to Boba guys in the Mission before and this was my first time trying the one on Octavia. Parking maybe a hassle though since it's all street parking and you may need to park far depending on if it's a really busy day or weekend. I stopped by with my friend on a Saturday and we luckily found parking right outside. We both ordered one of the special drinks which I can't even remember what I ordered tbh but it was a fruity tea drink. Nonetheless, I think everything on their menu is pretty good. I've had the horchata milk tea before and it was pretty good. Boba is on point too. Can't wait to try something new next time! :)
author: Monica W.

description:
I have been converted! I recently tried the classic milk tea with almond milk instead to see what it would be like and it tasted just as good to me as the regular milk did. The fact that it doesn't cost more to use soy or almond milk and that it doesn't make much of a difference in tastes mean I can trick myself into thinking drinking boba is good for me and I can go on with my life, happy and full of boba. But tbh almond milk is a little better for you than regular milk!

The lines can be a little long, but they work pretty efficiently and get the drinks out as fast as they can with the best quality they can. You can taste the difference in this kind of tea, where they use real tea leaves versus a place like Quickly, where they use the powder. Not that I'm complaining, Quickly has been a staple in my life, but boba guys makes boba feel just a little better.
author: Larissa L.

description:
Honestly, I think this place is overrated. I went for the hype, but really it's all hype. It tastes like normal boba and I think it tastes just as good as share tea. 

I got the Jasmine Milk Tea 16 oz ($3.75): I got it iced and 25% sweet with boba. I wish I had gotten 50% sweetness because it was way too bland. If you like floral tasting drinks, this drink is for you! The boba balls were good though...
author: Esther Y.

description:
Stumbled upon this location in Hayes valley, hot SF day, so why not.  Got a Matcha green tea with almond milk.  It normally comes unsweetened.  I would say, add some sugar!  It was a good bold cup of matcha latte.  Their boba are soft, chewy and slightly sweet!  Definitely a nice treat! 
They have waffles and onigiri that looks good.  This location is spacious with a lot of seats.  Nice pls e to hang and watch ongoing traffic.
author: Linda T.

description:
Went here around 3:50PM, there was a small line out the door and I waiting only about 5 minutes. 

I ordered a sriracha salmon omnigiri and a rose black tea with boba. 

The rice cakes are a definite must try but they aren't THAT spicy, at least the one I tried. It was nicely portioned (about the size of my hand) and it came with a small side of bean sprouts, tofu and edamame  

Rose black tea was delicious (the tea was really fresh) although the boba was hard  because it was mixed in with ice (because boba is naturally soft when it's room temperature), I got 50% sweetness in a 16oz and it was the perfect amount.  

Service was great! I was asked about my sweetness level and if i was okay with creamer and was recommended which omnigiri to get. 

Location wise was small but very nicely decorated with a lot of seats past the register. Would suggest staying too long since it can get packed

Would definitely come again!
author: Faith C.

description: Great vibes and great boba. I love this location as opposed to the one by Delores Park because there is actually place to sit and there is a theme to the shop. The feel is modern and there is a lot of space. The Boba is tasty and the drink options are classic but trendy at the same time. Would definitely come again! Their boba is a huge step up from your Quickys!
author: Jackie C.

description:
I love boba guys!! I think this is one of the newer locations, I usually go to the one on Stockton street but this location was closer at the time so we went here. They have a lot of space inside so it was nice and the drinks were made fast! Luckily when I got there I was only second in line but I was scared it was going to take forever for my drink because I had a family in front of me that ordered a ton a drinks. It may be hard to find parking in this area so you're going to need some good luck. The drink will be worth it though, I promise. 

When I first tried boba guys I had the matcha drink and I didn't like it at all which made me a disbeliever of boba guys but one of my friends really insisted that I try it again but with another drink - the classic milk tea. I was realllly skeptical so it took me awhile to come back but when I tried the classic milk tea I knew why my friend liked it so much. Their classic milk tea has a very unique taste to it and you can really taste the tea in it. It was also the perfect amount of sweetness without me having to ask them to adjust it. 

I've also tried the strawberry matcha latte before and it was just okay. I usually like things with matcha but I guess there is something about boba guy's matcha that I don't like. 

The one thing about this location that may be different than the one on Stockton street is that their boba wasn't as soft and chewy, it was kinda hard! When I first had it at the other location, their boba and perfect! Maybe it depends on the day but I would come back to this location if I was in the area.
author: Sherry L.

description: Boba guys is the place to go for consistently great milk tea flavors and perfectly chewy pearls. Boba guys does not disappoint and always has new flavors to try. Would recommend!
author: Henry T.

description:
This is fancy ass boba, dare I say designer boba. You can tell that they really care about the craft and it shows in their tea, boba, and really all of it. Of course, quality comes at a cost, this is as far away as you can get from Quickly or TeaWay... I don't go to these places that often. Boba Guys, in my humble opinion, is pricey for what it is. To get the full experience, we bought rice balls to go with our drinks. For 3 milk teas with boba and rice balls, the bill came to around $40, which I found to alarming. But, if you stick to just the team, you'll be fine.
 
Let's be real, Boba Guys brings some class to the game. It's the answer to what would a high-end modern joint look like and it's a nice alternative from your Irving St go to.

YUMMER SCORE:    Food - 8    Service - 8    Experience  -  7
author: Ryan M.

description:
Beautiful new Boba Guys flagship location! Plenty of seats and an outdoor patio, a new tea bar, and extended menu options.

This location has several new flavors not available at the other locations, including taro smoothie, chocochata (chocolate horchata), matchachata, dirty horchata, and black sesame. Toppings include: regular boba, grass jelly, almond jelly, and egg pudding (new)!

They also have several food items available, including onigiri, frozen custard, and their usual HK toast and kaya toast.

My fave flavors:
- Their new raspberry pineapple tea fresca - super refreshing!
- Matcha strawberry or regular matcha latte with boba (request 75% sweet)
- Indian chai with boba
- Classic milk tea with boba

The drinks are a little on the pricey side for boba, but totally worth it for the quality ingredients and housemade boba. ALWAYS go for the large. Everytime I get a small, I wish it was bigger.
author: Vivian H.

description: BEST BOBA EVER!! Definitely get the strawberry rice milk with boba it's amazing. I'm from out of town and only wish I lived here specifically to come to this place.
author: Ally W.

description:
Like the design a lot, clean environment 

Drinks are 4 out of 5 

We ordered HK style Milk Tea VS the HK Milk Tea I had in HK, there still a big difference, not as smooth
But serve the propose. It has that little Lipton taste to it. 

Strawberry Matcha Latte, can't really taste the matcha much, strawberry over ride the other taste. 

jasmine green milk tea in a already made bottle, taste great! 

Will be back to try their hot drinks
author: Mack A.

description:
since they're not doing any full disclosure, i will

when they ask you if "dairy is okay?" what they should be asking you is "is half and half okay?"

just like Philz, they used HEAVY CREAM in their drinks and don't tell anyone

i love it as much as anyone else, but TELL ME if you put something out of the norm in my BOBA drink

at least Starbuck's default dairy is whole milk and not half and half
_------------_

And I'm pretty sure I'm getting my 4th cold of the year because a drink preparer here has a cold.  An hour after sipping my drink, I had a sore throat that got worse over the next couple of days.  This is the second time that happened and I'll buy convenience store drinks from now on.  Make note of who prepares your drink and if you get a sore throat an hour after drinking, I'm pretty sure I know who it is.
author: Samantha W.

description:
This location for Boba Guys seems to be its largest and a fairly close walk to the hub area in Hayes Valley, closer to the freeway exit. I like the location and the decor, the tea bar, the people I saw sitting around just gives that young SF-foodie vibe to me. 

Personally I was not impressed with their drinks, one of their specialty milk teas, might've been Golden Oolong or something along that line but I did not taste much tea, the milk having masked most of the tea flavor if any. Also tried friend's Lychee Tea which just tasted very strange and nothing like Lychee...I'd be interested to know what they did to get their Lychee flavor because I was speculating that the Lychee was just unripe or something haha. She thought it tasted like Smarties candy...which was not a far off description.

I was able to sample a brewed tea from their Tea People bar and that tasted great, which makes me think I should stick with the pure teas here from now on...out of three milk teas and fruit teas I've tried I've been a bit let-down, especially given the price. I would also suggest marking their milk teas with their names or symbol because we received our drinks and did not know which was which.

And of course, with the oft-comparison between Boba Guys and Asha Tea House, I'd go with Asha still.
author: Daniel C.

description: I LOVE THEIR BOBA AND THE DIFFERENT UNIQUE DRINKS THEY HAVE! Such as the strawberry matcha latte! My favorite!!! The different locations they have are all so cute and definitely a place you can go with friends! A place you must try when you come to SF!!! It is just boba but it's different from most places! I always come back for boba and I always get a large because it's more worth the price
author: Tiffany C.

description: On my SF adventure I had to drop by at a Boba Guys and am so happy I was not disappointed. At the time we arrived the line was starting to form outside the door, luckily it didn't take too long. On the recommendation of my friends, I ordered the strawberry tea fresca. It was a very light drink with strawberry flavor. I also tried a hot coffee and a mango matcha drink. The mango drink was quite interesting. All the drinks I tried were very unique and I've never had anything similar to them. Overall would recommend to drop by and try their drinks!
author: Kathy N.

description:
This review is for the Kaya toast and the Earl Grey milk tea with boba. Love the flavor of the tea. Get 50 percent sweet because I think 100 percent is probably too sweet and will mask the tea flavor. The toast is really good and very similar to the local toast found in Singapore. The matcha tea latte isn't bad either.

This location is right off the freeway and a few blocks from the heart of Hayes Valley. It is not as busy as the Mission district location, probably because it's new. We went on a Sunday afternoon and there was no line: There is 2 hour parking around the store and the decor is really nice. 

I want to try their tea flight one of these days. $10 for 3 teas and chocolate pairing. The employees are very friendly and hard working. Can't wait to go again.
author: Cicely T.

description: This place is great! I went when I visited SF and loved t so much that I went three days in a row. The first two days I got the Strawberry Matcha Latte with boba. It was so delicious!! The Strawberry gives it a nice fresh flavor because it doesn't taste like artificial syrup. The boba itself is also great. It's sweet and has a good level of chew. The last day I got the Strawberry Jasmine(or maybe it was green) tea Fresca, 50% sweetened so it was a bit too diluted for me. I also tried someone's coconut milk tea, in which I also got 50% sweetened. I recommend for those two to maybe go 75% instead, of you enjoy less sugar. I am definitely craving the Strawberry Matcha latte now. This location specifically is nice because it has seating.
author: Judy H.

description:
I'm sure people around America think San Franciscans are ridiculous.  How can anyone justify paying the kind of rent that we do?

Well, I have the answer.  Boba Guys.

To be within walking distance of the best combination of well-made tea and soft chewy boba... it's the American dream.

tbh, I'm aware that there's a Boba Guys in NY too.  But you know what, rent is super high over there too.  So I'm gonna go ahead and say my theory still holds. Boba Guys, high rent = super correlated.
author: Andrew O.

description:
no matter how many locations pop up, they're still consistent.

great drinks + if its not right, they'll make you a fresh one.

I love that this location is near smitten ice cream...so many cravings satisfied within a five block radius.
author: Whitne Y.

description:
No Boba available until 11am when they open at 9am. Disappointed. I settled with grass jelly in the Hong Hong milk tea. Good combination but I was really looking forward to getting my boba fix.
Taste of tea was good
author: Yuzu H.

description: I hope it was an honest mistake but when I ordered almond milk in my tea, that's what I hoped for. Instead I got dairy and was sick for the next two hours. Soooo doubts I'll be coming back.
author: Mandi W.

description: Love the ambience and set up of this place! It's very chic with great service! The cashiers are super friendly and provide great recommendations for tea if it's your first time there. They have an incredible selection of teas with unique flavors and let you adjust the sweetness and add-ons to your tea. Most places have tea that runs really sweet, so this place was amazing at accommodating different tastes. And you know it's popular when every time you walk-in you see Postmates couriers taking out orders--definitely a go-to SF boba spot!
author: Emily G.

description: So happy there's a boba place in Hayes valley now. I finally came here after hearing about its opening. This Boba Guys is consistent (in terms of quality) with its other location in Mission (haven't been to the third one... yet ;) ). And the service is friendly and fast. Although it's kinda a bummer that the upstairs part is just used for storage or something rather than customer seating, there's definitely more seating (on the ground floor) at this location than the Mission one - definitely a bonus on cold and/or rainy days when you want to hang out indoors for a bit. Long story short, I'm sure I'll be back soon for another visit, eager to try more.
author: Bianca C.

description: Good place for some bubble tea.  I tried the coffee tea and it was pretty good. The tapioca itself is a little sweet so it's probably good to go 50% sweet on the tea itself.  There is also a nice little patio in the back to sit and sip your tea!
author: Ravi S.

description: This location is much bigger than the first one I went to on 19th Street. If I lived nearby, this would probably be my new study spot! There are plenty of seats to hang out here, it's an open layout, and it's clean. They have a nice corner spot so you can't miss it when you're driving down Octavia. They also serve Frozen Kuhsterd collaboration items here - the Boba Guys sundae and waffle sundae!  AND they open at 9am?! Don't know when I would ever want boba at 9am, but it's nice to know that option is there. As far as the drink items, everything looks pretty much the same as the other location. Today I went with the mango matcha tea fresca - it was definitely refreshing as stated in the drink description. The mango adds sweetness to the otherwise bitter matcha. It's a great choice if you're not feeling like a creamy drink. And as usual, their boba is really fresh. Definitely one of my top boba spots in the city!
author: Ashley C.

description:
I've been eyeing this place for a while as I looooove boba and could basically drink it every day... not that I would recommend anyone doing that. I've heard they were more of a natural homemade type place and finally got the chance to try them this past week. Wow I was impressed by the quality of the boba pearls as they were very tender and delicious. I made the mistake of getting the tea with absolutely no sugar (which I usually do at other places) and found the tea/and boba mix a bit odd. 

Usually at most places getting the tea with no sugar is okay as the toppings sit in a sweet syrup. Not here. The egg pudding was hardly sweet so I would recommend going no lower than 25% if you are not use to the stark contrast between black tea and sweet boba. My brother got the same as me but minus the egg pudding and with 50% sugar. That was a better choice as the milk tea and boba flowed together so well. I will definitely be revisiting. 

Oh and they spelt my name right! Which is so incredibly rare. Great friendly service.
author: Priya D.

description: Boba Guys is one of my favorite places to get Boba every time I come to the city. I love the layout of the store, employees are always so happy to be there and although always a line when I go, it does go by quite fast!! Each time I have came, I have tried a different drink and have been satisfied with every choice. My favorite drinks so far are the Strawberry Matcha Latte & the w/ Boba & Almond Jelly & the Mango Matcha also with Boba & Almond Jelly! I normally stick with the standard 75% sweetness with all my drinks and find that with that its not too overly sweet which I appreciate. I love the consistency of this place when I come and my drinks are always made right & I leave happy and satisfied!! Now if they can only open one closer to me!!
author: kristina n.

description: Space is lovely and clean, staff are fantastically efficient and friendly -- they move it along with a smile even when very busy. Teas are tasty -- my favorite is the strawberry fresca though  I wish you could adjust the sugar without adjusting the recipe. So why the one-star off? As a successful business with a lot of traffic, and one that clearly spends a lot on merchandising, I wish the chain -- all the locations, would switch to environmentally friendly cups and straws. If a small mom and pop boba place can afford a plastic film cover machine (uses less materials instead of plastic covers), certainly this chain can? In enviro-friendly SF, I'd prefer to spend my treat money at places like Smittens, Salt and Straw, Plentea, etc. that think whole-earth and use compostable/reusable cups, straws, etc.
author: Kate A.

description: It is just not worth the line. I ordered HK style milk tea, it tasted so strange. Probably it is a Taiwan style tea shop??? And the pineapple cake is over priced.
author: Sammi Z.

description: Came here with a couple of friends since it was nearby my home. I am still trying to figure out why I paid so much for a cup of tea. Or why it's so popular in the Asian culture, they must like to suck on small balls        drinks.
author: Scott T.

description:
Being from Southern California, I wanted to see what all the hype was about. This place definitely lived up to it!
I tried this location and the one on Mission and damn they make some good tea. The Jasmine milk tea was amazinggg. Although the boba was a bit too chewy for me (in a somewhat undercooked way), I guess everyone prefers their boba at different chew-rates lol. I also got my sister the coconut milk tea and she said it was great. 
I guess you could call this a "bougey boba spot" but the quality is there in their teas and the dairy they use for their drinks. It's a bit pricey but I honestly don't mind when the fantastic quality is clear. 
If y'all every open a location in Southern California, please do it soon! I will be a very loyal customer :)
author: Emerald N.

description:
Holy expensive boba, batman! 

What we got: 
I had the strawberry matcha latte, small (16oz.), $5.75. 
GF got the golden honey black milktea, small $4.75. 

Service: 
Good, the person that took our order was nice, and the person handing out samples was friendly and thorough in this explanation of what he was serving. 

Flavor: 
strawberry matcha latte 2.5/5 - probably my mistake on this one, generally don't get flavored boba because I don't care for the sweetness, but decided to be adventurous. My GF does like sweet, but even she said the strawberry flavor overpowered the matcha. 

golden honey black milktea 3.5/5 - I liked this much more than the one I got, but still unremarkable. 

Location: 
I think I know where the extra cost went, overhead. The place is nice, lots of wood. Think mini sightglass or any modern cafe. Probably a nice place to chill, but I took mine to go. 

Quality:
Straus milk and no artificial flavored powders, that's cool. Perceived quality is high, but I still don't see the value.
author: Christopher W.

description: I am a big milk tea fan. Came here for the first time with my family and WowErs!! I got a Rose Milk tea with almond jelly..yumm!! Hopefully there will be a Boba Guys in Milpitas soon!!
author: Tiffany D.

description: This place is not worth the hype. There's certainly better tasting boba drinks elsewhere. On this visit I got the thai tea with boba. Location was nice and not busy during the time I visited (Tuesday @~noon). Drink was made quickly, and the people who worked there were friendly. Towards the end of my drink I sucked up this white plastic piece that was unknowingly sitting at the bottom of my drink among the boba. No idea where this came from, but I was not close enough to go back to notify them of this. The drink itself was meh (not good not bad), but after I found this piece of plastic in my drink it became instantly gross.
author: Cassandra C.

description: Phenomenal quality tea and you can customize your milk for free. Their boba are definitely grade-A balls. It's our go-to place for boba tea in the city even though it is a bit pricey and usually has a line, but standing in lines is a hobby if you like good food in SF right?
author: L. W.

description: You know why you're here, and you're going to do it every time. Their balls are the best in the Bay. Their milk tea might also be the best in the Bay too. The jasmine milk green tea is a classic, and you'd be wrong not to get it at least once or twice or three times. This place has some seasonal offerings as well, such as their pumpkin special tea, but again, go for the classic, and get the balls. Trust me. If it's SF cold (50 degrees), then get it hot. You still won't go wrong. Yes, the milk tea is at a higher price point than other places, and you're going to be looking around for parking in a less than ideal neighborhood, but what the hell, you're already here. Their decaf teas are so so, and the sweetness level is hit-or-miss, but it's a modern space with lots of sitting room for working. Beware of hipsters.
author: Danny C.

description: Most likely the best bubble tea I've encountered in CA or NY. They brew real tea leaves and do not use powder. I loved the almond pudding with my milk tea!
author: Theresa Y.

description:
This is strictly about the matcha latte i ordered here.

It was nothing special including the almond jelly i had with it. 

If u guys ever visit LA, please try Japanese matcha latte at the original Urth cafe. U ll see why i only give this 3 stars
author: Audrian N.

description:
Where have I been all my life??? Not in SF apparently. Boba Guys has been in my bookmarks from when they first opened and I'm so happy I finally got to try it and I love it!

I love all things matcha so I got the Matcha Latte. I was really happy they have a soy milk option as well. The service was quick and the drink was very tasty. It was too sweet and they actually use honey for their drinks! 

Overall, I highly recommend Boba Guys! I will definitely be coming back to try other drinks!
author: Wendy Y.

description:
I'm a big fan of Boba Guys for two main reasons: 1) the almond jelly is delicious and 2) the sparse clean interior. The tea is good, they have everything from the classic black tea to fresh brewed tea. You also have three different milk options (regular, almond, and soy). 

I typically don't see too long of a wait at this location or the Mission location. This location also is much larger (and seems newer) than the other two, with much more seating available. The location near Union Square tends to have a long line. 

The onigiri was also very good. The one I got was big and warm with flavorful salmon inside. It also tasted fresh.
author: Rica Z.

description: My all around favorite boba spot in SF. You are never disappointed with the flavors as their quality/taste is always consistent. Moreover, they also have a wide-selection of healthy choices such as (almond/oak milk). The only downside is that they don't open late and often closes around 9/10:00AM and depending on location/time, there might be a long wait. Overall, one of the best boba places in SF. I would definitely recommend getting the strawberry matcha latte, muscat oolong, jasmine and classic milk tea! Their desserts/food items are pretty good as well.
author: Linda L.

description: The line was out the door when I came by. But the line moved pretty quickly. The drinks are a bit more expensive than other boba places. I got a $6 strawberry drink with almond jelly and it was delish. You could tell the strawberry was fresh and nothing was artificial about it.
author: W A.

description:
Would recommend the matcha strawberry latte with boba! A very unique combo- its creamy, and taste kind of like strawberry and green tea ice cream mixed together. The strawberry syrup makes it sweet and the matcha gives it the deep tea flavor. 

Great service and while I was waiting for my drink, a nice server at the tea bar offered my friend and I some tea samples, which we really appreciated.

Would give them a solid four stars, but knocked off a star for their prices. Expect to pay an upwards of $5+ here for a drink, but it seems that this is the norm lately for San Francisco boba places. I do appreciate their story of using quality ingredients and the customization they offer with the choice of whole, almond, or soy milk. 

Other things I've tried:
- Boba Guys Sundae- 2 scoops of frozen khusterd icecream, topped with boba, almond jelly, and condensed milk... YES!! delish! One of my favorite things to get and would recommend, also its quite a big portion so its sharable with a friend!
- Jasmine Milk Tea- didn't really like this, tasted watery and not strong flavors of anything. Perhaps I do appreciate the artificial creamers that usually comes with milk tea sometimes.
- Horchata- also didn't like this, also tasted watery/watered down.
author: Kathleen Y.

description: I was feeling adventurous so I tried the matchata but the cashier could read the apprehension on my face so he reassured me that they would change it if I didn't like it. Turns out I didn't like it at all LOL but I was going to suck it up and leave bc I felt bad making them make another for me. As I got up to leave, however, the cashier guy asked me how I liked it and I'm pretty sure my face gave it away. He had the baristas make me a brand new jasmine milk tea instead, which was AMAZING. Best jasmine milk tea I've ever had (it's my go-to everywhere, so I know the drink quite well). Amazing drink with even better customer service - needless to say, I can see why Boba Guys has been so successful. I'll definitely be back!
author: Madalyn N.

description: This modern style boba shop completely surprised me with the quality of their drinks. I came on a Saturday after lunch, and there was a very long line that extended about 20 people out the door. I tried the strawberry matcha latte and the black sesame latte. I didn't know what to expect with their unique type of drinks. They were very sweet (which is what I like). The taste of the strawberry matcha latte was dominated by strawberry, with a slight aftertaste of matcha. If you enjoy strawberry beverages, this drink is for you.
author: Justin Y.

description:
I deliver for one of those app based food delivery companies and I did a pick up here last week. They were packed but were still super attentive. I decided to come and check it out bc I've seen their ads in other parts of the city (this one is on the corner of Haight and Octavia) and my customers drinks looked BOMB. 

AND THE DRUM ROLL PLEASE 

MY DRINK IS FREAKING LEGIT!!! Yes. I just screamed that. I LOOOOOOOVE horchata and for this to be on the same level as my Moms horchata says a lot bc I NEVER compare anyone's food to my Moms unless its on some triple OG legitness!! 

CHECK THEM OUT!!
author: Maria R.

description: Been to the Mission and this new location.  This one is not too crowded, has a bright, airy feel, and offers some nice alternative menu items.  The boba and tea is always solid.
author: Benjamin H.

description: I ordered their famous Strawberry Macha Latte with Oat Milk and coughed for hours with sharp strawberry seeds stuck in my throat. Painful!
author: Chris B.

description: Boba Guys: Serves up above-average boba drinks in a light-filled, modern minimalist space that is easy on the eyes. Artificial flavorings, creamers and sweeteners are discarded in favor of whole tea leaves, Straus milk, and housemade brown sugar syrups. Non-dairy milk options (soy, almond, and more recently, oat!) are available upon request. Sweetness levels are also customizable-- as BG drinks skew on the sweet side, I recommend requesting a sweetness level one notch below your preference. 50% sweetness in my matcha oatmilk latte was almost too sweet for me, but the quality of the matcha powder still managed to peek through the syrup. I'm placing BG firmly between Fantasia and Asha: a fantastic option for SF. :)
author: Tianyi S.

description:
Boba Guys finally has a flagship store, and it's hipster gorgeous! Located in a spacious loft-like space in Hayes Valley (a little off of the Hayes Street strip) on Octavia, Boba Guys is a fun, welcome addition to the bustling Hayes Valley scene.

This location has all the old favorites, such as the matcha strawberry latte, jasmine milk tea, the slow bar with quality teas, with a few fun additions such as the black sesame boba, taro smoothie boba, and a tea flight option! In addition, they also offer made-to order foods such as onigiri and Asian brick kaya toast. They also have liege waffles, Frozen Kuhsterd sundaes, and a variety of other Asian snacks, which looks to be on a rotating basis. Unlike the Mission and Union Square locations, this Boba Guys has plenty of seating, so you can enjoy your boba and food slowly. 

If you're not familiar with Boba Guys, their claim to fame is that they use quality syrup, quality milk, and non-GMO tapioca for the boba pearls, which means that the prices are higher, and your boba doesn't come out of a pre-made mix made dubiously behind the screen (I'm looking at you, Purple Kow). I'm not bashing those places either, given that I've grown up with some delicious unhealthy boba in SoCal, but if you're really conscientious about what you consume and you're curious about boba, Boba Guys might be your best bet. 

My go-to is always the matcha strawberry latte but I want to try the strawberry fresca tea and the strawberry horchata. I've found some of the more specialty drinks to be a better bet at Boba Guys than standard orders such as jasmine milk tea, but your mileage may vary.
author: Kate M.

description: Whenever I am in town I always try to have good boba. Yesterday, my mom and I hit up this place that was really a disappointment. My friend and I happened to hit up Hayes Valley today and theres a new boba guys in the area. I generally don't like boba guys but I need a bit of caffeine and I was really thirsty. We hit this place up. Kind of in a random location but it was really nice and spacious especially compared to the one on Stockton. Really big glass windows and pretty hipster looking on the inside. The prices were a bit better than I expected. My Jasmine green tea with almond milk and boba was quite delicious. Although the ice melted really quickly and it felt really watered down. Overall, boba guys is now back on my radar.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Got some solid boba here, but definitely need to come back and try all the other goodies!

Jasmine Milk Tea - Great! A tad bit too sweet, but that can surely be adjusted. I just always get my first MT at an establishment with 100% to see what they're about.
Milk Tea - Good stuff! This one was not as sweet especially after tasting the JMT, but I would totes grab one of these to-go! YES THEY HAVE TO GO BOTTLES HERE!
Boba - Good texture and taste.

Will be back if I'm in the area! Need to try the matcha and horchata!

BTW: VERY HIPSTER LOOKIN BOBA SHOP. Felt like I was inside an intelligentsia coffee shop or something!
author: Teresa T.

description:
A flagship store? At first, I was skeptical of what that meant, however, after walking into this location, you can easily see why. Out of all the various spaces, the Hayes Valley store has a huge amount of space (even a tea bar included). The ambiance is amazing and the store gives off a very sleek look. 

Unlike other boba shops, this place provides next level service and the staff is extremely knowledgeable. The consistency of the boba is always perfect and their loose leaf tea gives off a very satisfying taste. Since its summertime, I indulge in the tea frescas because they are greatly refreshing. 

It is with pleasure that I can say my 20 minute drive to the inner city is well worth it. Thank you boba guys for your great service & products and I will be waiting for a south bay location!
author: Nick M.

description: My favorite boba place and trust me I've had my fair share of boba teas. But I mean haven't we all of you live in the Bay Area.  I like how they have natural ingredients and support smaller food companies that offer them. My fave is the matcha one and you watch the milk swirl with the vibrant green match. Mmmm just thinking of it now makes me want one now! I like the sitting area in this one and love the minimalistic aesthetic. But there's not always seating available cos it's so popular! But there's nice places to walk and sit around there so no worries.
author: Marisa L.

description:
This place is worth a visit if you are in the area, and is pretty standard in terms of Boba Guys locations. This one is located in Hayes Valley just a few short blocks from the Biergarten. I tried the Matcha Latte with boba, which was tasty but I do feel like I have had more flavorful matcha lattes at other boba places. Getting a large drink with boba was also a bit pricy, and around $5 if I recall correctly.

I think the biggest downside to this location is the size of the actual store. There is usually a line out of the door, and its popularity means that it takes a moment for drinks to be made (so probably not best for those who need to grab and go quickly). There is some seating here, but it's usually quite crowded, so I've always had to take my drink togo.
author: Daniel H.

description:
First time here and there was a line around the store. I was pretty excited because of the hype. I'm just going to just leave it as the hype.
