The classic bubble tea taste no different compared to milk tea you can get at an Asian bakery. I couldn't taste the tea because of its sweetness. I just got regular 100% sweet. You guys probably think I should get 0% to taste the tea. Although that may be true, many other bubble tea place I've been to, I order regular everything and their sweetness is at a level where it compliments the milk and the tea leaves not masking it. 

On the side note the bubbles are pretty hard. My first time trying the drink and I ask a recommendation between the classic and lavender milk teas. The cashier seems to have no clue on how it tastes. The answer
I received was if you like caffeine or not.
author: Justin K.

description: I'm a fan of boba guys and this location has a slightly more reasonable line than the others. Inside, they need more ventilation and more than one exit though. It feels really stuff and cramped inside the store. Nonetheless the drinks are as good as any other boba guys and the boba is always great!
author: Alfonso C.

description:
Back in the day, as a poor young tween, I was all about the $.99 Teaway milk tea boba deal. But now, as a poor young adult, I am all about the quality boba and Boba Guys really is the epitome of quality boba :) Their tea is top notch, alot of it imported from Asian countries, and they don't use any artificial sweeteners!

They have so many unique and delicious sounding menu options and after spending way too long deciding I got the Matcha Latte (25% sweet; almond milk), and I love how you can customize the sugar levels and also how there's no extra charge for soy milk or almond milk (looking at you Starbucks...)! My Matcha Latte was sweetened with honey, and it was the PERFECT and I mean PERFECT level of sweetness for my taste buds and I was so sad after I finished my drink. 

There is space to sit/do some work and theres wifi but no outlets!!

Most definitely will be back to try more off their menu
author: Jingxi Z.

description: I've had their Matcha boba at their pop up location and it was decent.  But the Strawberry Matcha boba, now that's something to brag about.  I took a sip of the Black Sesame and I think that was enough for me.  The black sesame was very strong and a little too thick; my friend had to add a few ice cubes to thin it out.  The drinks have good flavor but my only gripe is that the balls were a bit hard.
author: Linda N.

description: I think "obsessed" would be an understatement. I LOVE BOBA GUYS and lately, I've been drinking this stuff at least once or twice a week. I know. It's bad, but I can't stop :( This is probably my favorite location due to how cute the inside is. It's big enough that you can actually go in and chillax and stuff. I've been to other boba guys though and all of the workers are all super friendly and the drinks are consistent at all locations so you can't go wrong. My go to drink is lychee green tea with almond milk and almond jelly. 50% sweet is good for me since I don't like it toooo sweet. This drink is perfect and is so yummy in my tummy. At first, I thought lychee and almond flavors sound weird together.. But for some reason, it just works. I can barely taste the lychee so that's probably why. It's become my favorite drink and I'm now craving it as we speak. Definitely give this place a try if you love boba! Or tea. Or if you just wanna drink something gOoOooooood :)
author: Jenn N.

description: The tea is good (and the oat milk is delicious) but I especially love the weird secondary stuff they sell here. For example: Sunny Hills pineapple cakes from Taiwan. I think you will have a hard time finding a supplier for these in the Bay Area! There's also several varieties of onigiri, all of which sound interesting and tasty; earl grey shortbread cookies; custard-filled buns; and a few other oddball items off to the side. The location is lovely with lots of light from the outside. Thumbs up for keeping it interesting!
author: Alexei B.

description: the first opportunity i had to try boba guys was during a rare pop up shop in nashville  i enjoyed it so much however it was unfortunate that is discontinued. ): boba guys is amazing! since then i waited for my next opportunity, the perfect time came for my trip back to sf. where better to try than the flagship store!! hands down... best boba in all of america! MUST go while in sf or any location!
author: Juliet Q.

description: It was the best experience I have ever received at Boba Guys!! Ask for Aerin, the owner, the next time you go! She's so sweet & lively, she will chat with you all day if she could :) I recommend the strawberry matcha with their grade A tapioca balls! Always a must when i'm in sf.
author: Vivian K.

description:
[Same review as the Fillmore location] Boba Guys is my absolute favorite boba place in the Bay Area and it's gonna be hard to top this place. I've gone to the Hayes Valley location before coming to the Fillmore spot and both times have been an absolutely great experience for my tastebuds. In terms of boba, I've had the jasmine milk tea, matcha latte, and coffee milk tea. Let me start by saying that Boba Guys does not skimp on the flavors AT ALL. When I order milk teas I always look for strong tea flavors and the jasmine milk tea really fulfilled that. The matcha latte wasn't overpowering and had the right amount of matcha in it as well as a decent amount of honey as a sweetener. In addition, there weren't any matcha clumps like I would get sometimes at other places. The coffee milk tea and matcha latte was a bit on the sweet side but, to be fair, those were ordered with the regular amount of sweetness. Nothing like a few adjustments to fix that the next time I go. 
From the Hayes Valley location I've had the spicy salmon onigiri which was absolutely flavorful (not too spicy) and had a nice rice to filling ratio. At the Fillmore spot I ordered the matcha soft serve which gives a nice matcha flavor that isn't overpowering and is really nice for a hot day. 
I would recommend Boba Guys for lots of my friends who haven't had boba yet. I can't wait to come back :)
author: Emily T.

description: Delicious and cheap!! Basic and modern boba place. The line does get pretty long and there is a lounge area towards the back.
author: Mary C.

description: It's all about the strawberry matcha for me! Boba Guys is an important part of my weekend ritual. You really can't go wrong with anything you order from there. Also the stores are clean, the staff is friendly, and their snacks are really good!
author: Yue X.

description: I'm Mista BoBBA Bobba! I'm mister fantastic very fantastic- blah blah blah im mister RO RO mantic- Shaggy That is the song that pops up in my mind when I come by here. I am a fan! Bravo BRavo for the Boba guys! I enjoy the different locations they have here because they are sorta look different. The Boba guys has a nice modern / urban feel to it. So I dig it! I forgot the name of the drink I always get here but it has green tea in it with bobba's. Freakin amaze bobba (BALLZ). When you in the city of SF you must go here! Please come here for bobba! Expect somewhat of a line but when things are good you just have to wait for it, and when you get it.... ohhh baby you get it GOOOOD!
author: James L.

description: Creative Strawberry Matcha Latte to quench the thirst! With bubbles! Feels like Korean & Taiwan all at one go! Could provide some sitting area for the tired legs whilst waiting lol :)
author: Angelina A.

description:
does this place even need another positive review? probably not, but i'll write one anyway. 

i'm still at boba guys writing this because it was too good, i had to write my review while i was still on my good-food high! i got a classic milk tea with tapioca, organic milk, and 100% sweetness as well as a kimchi onigiri. the milk tea was delicious, but i would not recommend full sweetness unless you like sweet drinks. next time i'll go for 50% sweetness. the tapioca is the perfect chewy texture, and is also a good sweetness level--when paired with a lower tea sweetness, i think they would compliment each other well. 

the rice ball was also great! compared to other onigiri i've had, this one was big, but it was okay for me because i hadn't eaten yet. if you're just looking for a snack, they have other smaller stuff (waffles, etc). there were a lot of flavors to choose from, so if you don't like kimchi, they'll probably have something you do like. the kimchi was admittedly not super traditional, but it was still one of the best i've had. 

the atmosphere is a little bit loud, but overall well-lit (huge windows) and with good vibes. definitely come here and take cute instagram pictures! lol
author: Leah C.

description:
Pros: If you want super high quality boba, you have found the place! They have an open kitchen (like most places now) where you can see their premium ingredients on open display. Their milk is the good stuff and you can see them put in high quality ingredients giving you that fresh taste at a reasonable price! I got their matcha green tea and it was delicious! The setting is surprisingly large, roomy, and clean!

Cons: None. This place is awesom!

Overall: I would definitely recommend this place for boba and drinks!
author: Timothy Y.

description: This location is the nicest out of the three locations in San Francisco! Theres plenty of seating inside and it looks aesthetically pleasing. I always order the Hong Kong style milk tea with boba its always delicious. I like this drink too much to try the other flavors... maybe one day I'll order something new
author: Kelly S.

description:
Great boba. 

Never a bad cup. Good consistency with their drinks. 

Favorite drink is the earl gray.
author: Bleue H.

description:
We had just finished a 4 hour class in the LGBT center and the instructor mentioned boba guys! we're like heck yea!! so we walked right over before we went home

I tried the strawberry matcha latte!! Its the cool 3-tiered different color drink! 
it's the perfect mixture of fruity and tea. I really liked it. 
the spot is hipster and cool. a little hot in there though.

but yea, can't go wrong with any of their drinks!
author: Christine M.

description: This was my first time trying Boba Guys. I knew they had several locations but when I first looked at their menu a few years ago I wasn't impressed. Recently my friend, Danster, a fellow yelper was raving over their drinks and so I thought I should give them a chance. My gawd I'm so glad I did! I got here on a Sunday afternoon a little before 3pm. There was a short line out the door. Waited 10 mins to order my drink. I ordered the Lychee Rose with soy milk and Strawberry Matcha with soy milk. Waited another 10 mins for my drinks to be ready. My first reaction to the Strawberry Matcha was MMM so yummy! It tasted like sweet, ripe strawberry with a side of matcha flavor. The drink was also very pretty. You could see the tri colors in the cup. Then I tried my friend's drink and I noticed there was boba which we didn't ask for. I also tasted cinnamon...wait a minute... it's horchata with matcha! They gave me the wrong drink but it was still pretty delicious. When we left the line had tripled! I will be back.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
Boba Guys is slowly winning my heart back because of this new location. During my recent visit at the location, DP, I was devastated at the quality and taste. However, this new location changed my mind. 
I ordered the rose black milk tea with almond milk and 50% sweetness. The cashier was extremely friendly and patient. He asked if I wanted regular milk or the alternative options, soy or almond. He then repeated the order to make sure he had everything correct. 
The drink itself was not bad. You can taste the flavor and the sweetness was just right. I will be back to try other drinks.
author: Kelly O.

description:
Boba guys are over rated. Nothing special about their boba or their drinks. 
- milk tea with grass jelly: disgusting, I think the grass jelly polluted the drink, never again. 
- lychee green tea and boba: I liked the flavor of the drink. The bob was ok, not as soft as t-pumps boba
- thai tea with almond jelly: the Thai tea was ok, and almond jelly was ok. Nothing great about this drink
author: Helen N.

description: I ordered the strawberry matcha with boba and kimchi onigiri. The staffs were very friendly. My drink came out to be a little bit sweeter, but I guess I should have told them to make it less sweet. The entire atmosphere is so cool and modern. Thank you Boba Guys!!
author: Mona E.

description: This place was busy!!  I ordered the strawberry matcha latte with boba. It was pretty good.  I need a bit more boba in my drink though. The price was more expensive than other places but it's real tea and real Strauss milk, I'll pay for it!
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Ugh - sometimes those cravings just don't go away. Boba Guy cravings that is.

After many disappointing moments going to different Boba Guy locations seeing ridiculous lines and getting discouraged I finally got my Boba Guy fix. Strawberry matcha latte all the way - not sure if I'll ever be able to try anything else.

Also, these guys have to work on making the line move just a bit faster (the Union Sq location, ugh is awful).
author: Nicole L.

description: Great place! Sometimes the line can be long, but so worth the drinks. I love the classic with BOBA! Parking is difficult at this location. I like that they have seating available. The staff is friendly and overall a great experience.
author: Tania C.

description: As an SF native, I'm constantly searching for great boba places. My friends and I stumbled upon the Mission shop a couple of years ago, and now Boba Guys is one of the staple places we visit during our food adventures. The service here is always great, and I love that they're constantly coming up with creative drinks like the Dirty Horchata or Black Sesame Latte. My favorite is the Lavender Black Milk Tea. If you happen to be craving quality milk tea (and grade A balls) in SF, I'd say Boba Guys is the place for you!
author: Josie D.

description: Boba guys has the best flavors in the city. Hands down the best. I am obsessed with their matcha strawberry milk boba with almond jelly!!! Yummy!
author: Jacqueline P.

description: Comparing with other boba guys, Stuffs are rude here. Also, drinks are not well made. I ordered Strawberry cal pico which I always ordered from other locations. White thing (like white jerry or white cal pico or something) was floating on top which I never see it from other location.  The white thing would not mix with it, so taste nasty. I always finish my drink, but not this time. I throw away.
author: Emily K.

description: New boba guys location! It's a lot smaller than I expected but still artsy enough to satisfy your hipster needs! This place is extremely photogenic with large windows that let in natural lighting. I got the matcha latte but I think my friend's horchata milk tea tasted a lot better! I'll be back!!
author: Katie L.

description: Um. Can someone say overrated and overpriced? I've come here twice and both times the milk tea was watered down. I basically could've just drank some water. Don't waste your money here. Go to Sharetea or Super Cue instead.
author: Danny L.

description:
Yummmmm. I had so much fun talking to the employee about the tea selection. This location had a tea bar in the back so feel free to go back there and sample some. I love the attention they put to each drink. The matcha is actually whisked! And the teas are brewed. It is well worth the money if you haven't had boba like this before. 

I suggest going for lower amount of sugar since you can add on by yourself right next to where you pick up the order!
author: Lisa T.

description:
This is my all time favorite boba shop in the bay area. I love everything about Boba Guys from the quality and authenticity of their ingredients, to the friendliness of the staff, to everything they stand for. They are very transparent and honest with how their teas are made as you can even look up how they make their jasmine milk tea.

I love this location because you can finally sit down and enjoy your drink instead of just getting it and leaving! I'm such a big fan of Boba Guys and have tried nearly half of the menu, but my all time favorite is the Hong Kong Style Milk Tea just because I have a really big sweet tooth when it comes to drinks. I go to school in San Jose so whenever I'm back in town, I buy tea leaves from Boba Guys and bring it back to school with me so I can enjoy my favorites and share it with my friends! Some people don't think that Boba Guys is worth the long wait, but being the big fan I am, I think it's worth every penny and minute! 

This is the only milk tea place i frequently come back to and the only place I get milk tea in San Francisco as I refuse to go anywhere else besides Boba Guys.

If you have time, definitely sit down and grab a tea flight to share with a friend. They steep the tea as much as 2-3 times so you can definitely get your money's worth for $10.
author: C H.

description: Came here about a month ago. Wasn't too impressed. I order the Tropic Thunder. Initially it tasted amazing, then I got a taste of whatever the red ingredient was. Maybe it was pomegranate or dragonfruit, i don't know what it was, but it was very very bitter and make the drink unenjoyable. Would've been better without it. Unless my friends want to go here, I don't see myself coming back. If I do, I'll just order something else and hopefully it taste better than the last drink I got
author: Rommel A.

description: We were here on a Saturday afternoon around 4PM and there was still a long line. I appreciate their mission to use high quality ingredients and I like the variety they have. I've only been to the Stockton St. location and I was glad that this store had more seating available. The upstairs is their office, not extra seating. We ended up just grabbing drinks and walking to Patricia's Green to hang out, which is also crowded on a weekend :P
author: Yumi H.

description: I got coffee milk tea and strawberry matcha bubble tea. You can choose which toppings, which milk you want to add for 50-75 cents. I will come back and definitely wanna try more of their tea selections. I tried their sampling of roasted green tea -I would buy the whole bag.
author: Justin W.

description: First time trying Boba guys and its SOO good! Glad they're opening up more locations and hopefully they'll spread towards San Jose soon! Their tea is top notch and they have unique flavors as well. Loved the Strawberry matcha latte. The boba was tasty as well and the service was fantastic. Cashier was friendly and helpful and patient. Definitely coming back! I also love that they do packaged milk tea that you could bring home.
author: Jasmine Q.

description: First time here and I must say the jasmine milk tea is my all time favorite. Great customer service!!
author: Kingston L.

description: I am allergic to cow dairy, and I can't tell you enough how amazing the boba at Boba Guys is. You don't get that artificial syrupy taste in your mouth that you get from other chains. Their tea, milk, and almond milk suppliers are all local and organic. I recommend the iced matcha latte with almond milk or the Duke of Earl Grey with almond milk. My only complaint is that some of the 'iced' drinks aren't truly iced. They are slightly warm when you are given the drink. To fix that, just stir vigorously with the straw for approx. 20 seconds. Definitely a regular customer now.
author: Arianna N.

description:
Visited on a sunny Saturday so the line lined the outside and around the store. If you're a snow or slush type of person, this isn't the place for you :( But fear not they have a range of quality teas (and horchata and coffee!!). They also have a range of milks and toppings to choose from. I got the Hong Kong Style Milk Tea with 75% sweetness and a Thai Tea with Almond Milk, both with regular boba (tapioca). Although the line took about 20 minutes, my drinks came out about a minute later! 

Truthfully, the HK style tea tasted like a regular black milk tea with a slight bitter tea taste, but this may be due to the fact I didn't get 100% sweetness. The Thai Tea tasted good! Not too sweet not too bitter. The tapioca was fresh and chewy, not like some boba places where the tapioca might taste old and stale. It's no tpumps honey boba, but it's still some fine quality tapioca.

I enjoyed this place, even though some may think it's a over glorified vegan hipster boba joint. It was well worth it and I'll most likely stop by again if I'm in the area!
author: Diego A.

description: Matcha Latte is Flames, A1, Best of the best. I used to be addicted to milk tea and knew every boba spot in SF and I eventually realized how unhealthy it was. I took a long break from boba and would only get it if my friends wanted to go out and get it instead of just going alone. The other boba shops put all this garbage in their drinks that make it so good. That clear liquid that spews out of the machines at the asian boba spots like t pumps, t4 , purple kow, quickly, gong cha, etc is high fructose corn syrup or some unhealthy concoction of chemicals. BOBA GUYS is the future of BOBA. Healthier, High Quality, Aesthetically Pleasing, and Better Tasting. It makes me feel better knowing what I am drinking is not some china garbage. I used to feel really bad after drinking a cup of milk tea. Congrats Boba Guys I will be constantly coming back. 50% sweet is a must. First boba spot ever to have a tea bar where you can try a variety of teas.
author: Brian C.

description:
I would like an option to give a neutral review since what I wanted to get was not available, but I can not give less than five stars without the full experience of the place. 
I wanted a delicious jasmine milk tea with boba at 1044 am, alas, no boba, "it takes an hour to make" was the attendant's explanation. I should have thought that "Boba" being the first word of the name of the business it should always be available.
author: Proberta G.

description: OVER RATED. Milk Tea was so watered down and so were all my friends. Don't see what all the hype is about here. HALF & HALF in LA still takes the number 1 spot.
author: Maya S.

description: ;___; so good. I want to say it's the best boba place in the SF area.
author: Rai K.

description: Excellent boba with freshly brewed tea and juicy sweet boba.  They also have aloe jelly and other things to add to the tea.  There is also a small selection of snacks and breakfast items.  Lots of people hanging out in there like it is a coffee shop, people on dates and on laptops.
author: M S.

description: I gotta give it to them, they're pretty consistent with their drinks and their boba pearls are great. The drink overall is OK. 3 stars because I don't see how this could be the best boba...? I'm a boba queen/snob. I guess Boba Guys won SF's heart but the real good boba spots are in South bay where all the Asians are located. True fact. San Jose and OC may have won the best Boba milk teas.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Even though the price point is higher, I'm ok spending a bit more money on a drink because you can really tell that Boba guys uses quality ingredients compared to other boba tea places. They're boba balls are so sweet and fresh. My only gripe with this location is the layout. Who designed the space? From the outside it looks like such a large space, but its mostly space for the employees and tea prep area.  The entry space from the register to the area where you wait for your drink is very narrow, and in between the order counter, people walking in and out the door and the counter with stools next to the large windows, I felt completely smashed and claustrophobic. At one point there was a lady in a wheel chair trying to get out and I literally had to walk over and move all the stools out of the way for her to fit through the space. It does not seem like the narrow entry space is very wheelchair accessible.
author: Marite C.

description: There's no denying that this is one of my favorite places to edit photos with a side of quality boba! I'm sorry plentea but your glass bottles ain't gonna win me over. When they say next level quality, they really mean it when I see a giant pot of boba being freshly boiled. This ain't the place where you'll taste that cancerous powder you'll get at budget spots. I've been coming to this location since the soft opening days and the quality has never disappointed me in the countless times I'm here. Whenever a visitor outside of SF comes here, it's OBLIGATORY for them to visit and I always have that need to drag them here. This spot is where almost half of all the friendships I started this year came from, including the friendly staff who work here. Now next time you're craving a cup of quality milk tea, make your way over here because you won't be disappointed, God forbidding you're close-minded in favor of powdery drinks.
author: Daniel F.

description: Honestly, I still don't quite understand the Boba Guys hype. I've been to several locations multiple times throughout the years, and while the tea has always been fine, Boba Guys has never been on my list of boba places that I have cravings for. I've always found that their tea is kind of weak and my drinks taste more like milk than anything else. I've had the black milk tea, Hong Kong milk tea, and coffee milk tea, and those have all been average at best. Maybe they have other specialties but I feel like black milk tea is a good baseline. I do like that they have multiple milk options, and their flavor selection isn't bad, but it's definitely more of a trendy hipster-type place.
author: Em F.

description: Wow, the new Boba Guys Hayes Valley location is the next step up in their business.  This location is a lot larger than their other spots, making it an enjoyable experience that you can now have a seat inside!  Boba Guys is probably the most famous brand for Boba at this point in SF.  And for good reason.  They take a lot of care in the drinks they make.  They select only the best ingredients and carefully perfect all of their concoctions.  Some of my favorites would have to be the Strawberry Matcha Latte, any of the Fresca Series, or the Coconut Green Tea from the slow tea bar.  The food and pastries they offer here are also fantastic.  I love their rice balls, very tasty and the perfect afternoon snack.  Also, compared to their other locations, this one seems to be less busy (for now).  So if you're looking to avoid the lines, maybe make your way out to Hayes Valley.  I also hear they have special drinks only available at this location too!
author: Bryson L.

description: My favorite boba place in SF yet. Strawberry matcha latte is my favorite! Perfectly sweetened! Boba was sweet and chewy. Can't wait to go back for another drink!
author: Yoomi C.

description: The line is still out the door, which is both great and a bummer at the same time.  They have some interesting recipes, like the matcha latte and coconut green tea. The matcha had bolder flavors which we liked!  The coconut green tea was lighter and a bit more watery.  Presentation of the matcha latte was great!  A little pricey when you walk out the door (about $6 each for a large) but I support using real ingredients.  We'll be back!
author: Fanny Y.

description: I found the boba tea here to be extremely underwhelming! Was excited about the Strauss milk and almond milk option, but the tea tasted very watery (I asked for less ice) and not creamy or milky at all. The boba was okay, slightly on the hard side. It was also unpleasant to wait for the drinks because it was super hot inside. The atmosphere looked nice and the staff was friendly, but what I really wanted was amazing boba tea and got diluted tea water instead.  idk this place was popular and maybe just got a dud. Hopefully tea will get better and reflect its reputation.
author: Kaila C.

description: My family came on a Sunday in the afternoon and the line wasn't too bad. I'd give this spot MAYBE a 3.5. Their service was good and they did have somewhat of a selection but I can't say it was the best I've ever had. I decided to order the classic milk tea because it's my go to and it's easier to judge and compare when you order the same thing. I asked for 100% sweetness but it still wasn't sweet enough for me. If you like that strong tea taste, you'll probably enjoy it more than I did. I did like how they have syrup on the side available so you can add sweetness to your drink. I also tried other orders my family got. The strawberry matcha hella tasted like soggy special k strawberry cereal which could be a good or bad thing if that's what you like... I didn't think it was bad but I personally would get tired of the taste pretty quick. The dirty horchata was just OK a little too strong. The regular matcha (extra sweetened) was probably my favorite out of all the ones that I did try. Their boba was a little harder than my preference.
author: Roxanne A.

description: Came here for a tasting session to select tea flavors for a catered event. We were met by co-founder Andrew, whose passion for his craft is visible in how he talks about his company. Instead of the 15-minute tasting session, we ended up chatting with Andrew for almost two hours about his journey and how he selects only the best ingredients. Did you know that the oat milk they use is a specialty milk from a Scandinavian producer and not available in stores? Andrew was both super generous with the boba tasting (three cups!) and his time, which says a lot about him and Boba Guys. We will definitely be back the next time we're in SF!
author: Bryant T.

description: A lot of hype but it was pretty bomb. I got the strawberry matcha, it was... interesting. I really tasted the difference in quality compared to Quickly's or other boba shops. The staff was amazing and helpful which I appreciate, I can totally understand how stressful it is consistently having a long line outside, good job y'all! I'll probably come back next time I'm in the Bay.
author: Victor V.

description: I love Boba Guys! I've now been to this location and the one on Stockton. This location is definitely nicer. It's bigger, with a lot more room to sit down. The large windows that they use bring in a lot of nice natural light when it's sunny, and it was really sunny the day I was there so it was great. I really should have tried something new...but I fell in love with the Matcha Strawberry Latte a few days earlier and decided to get it again. And it was just as good here! Just the right level of sweetness, and the ratio of matcha to strawberry syrup was perfect. The syrup isn't too sweet, and the flavor doesn't taste disgustingly artificial. It's quite good, actually, and pairs with the matcha surprisingly well. The whole milk adds a good underlying rich flavor, and the match and strawberry flavors make the drink refreshing. The pearls that they use are delicious with just the right texture. And you can taste the honey that they cook it in! It's a very well-balanced drink! Highly recommend trying this drink if you're unsure of what to get. I definitely need to venture out and try some of their other drinks...but can't seem to get tired of this one!
author: Ashley Y.

description: Hands down my favorite Boba spot in SF! Whether sits Rose Milk Tea or Hong Kong Style Milk Tea - this place never disappoints. Not only is everything delectable, but their design and branding alone will reel you in.
author: Mandy A.

description: The new location is awesome. If you haven't been here you need to come check it out. It's more spacious and very well decorated. The staff is great as always. The tea wasn't as good as it usually is at the other locations but 5 stars anyways. Hopefully they'll figure it out on my next visit.
author: Joshua F.

description:
I want to love boba guys but lately, I just can't. I know this is a review for the Octavia location but I've noticed in general that their other SF locations have been lacking recently as well. Too much to manage? The teas have been a bit over brewed and bitter recently, especially at Stockton and this location. I can tell because I rarely order drinks with sugar added unless it's a tea Fresca or specialty drink that's pre sweetened. I am a life long tea lover/drinker, and niece to a tea farmer so I know how unnecessarily bitter tea tastes. I've been frequenting boba guys since their first brick and mortar opened and I haven't felt like returning as regularly as I used to. There is also something off with the customer service at this store, many of the workers don't seem to know what ingredients are included in which beverages, so when I'm out with friends who have varying dietary needs, we can't really enjoy it much because the answers are always changing depending on who is working or completely inconclusive. Customer service has been shoddy a few times, not horrible, I understand the servers are probably stressed due to long lines. but it's hard feeling like you aren't as important as the friends who are visiting that they are chatting up or the Pokemon lures they are setting off. Lines are already pretty long so it can be slightly bothersome getting to the register and being put on hold for what appears to be frivolous conversation. 
I know my review has been mostly negative but I would like to end on a positive note. I do enjoy the expanding rice ball menu (but I would love to be able to know the flavors on a menu or something?) and I enjoy the aloe jelly very much and new toppings they have steadily added. I think the direction boba guys is going in with the fruit based drinks and smoothies/thicker drinks (taro, black sesame) are really delicious and exciting for when caffeine is not what you are craving. This location is in a beautiful space with a nice atmosphere for socializing or getting work done on fast wifi. The matcha based beverages and rose-lychee milk tea are real stand outs and worth coming in for. 
All in all, I think that this is a big stepping stone for boba guys and I would like to see the quality keep up with the expansion. With some tweaks, this could be a true stand out. There is a lot to enjoy here, but I do feel as a loyal customer, there is some work left to be done.
author: Ashley G.

description:
JUST A NOTE: No boba until later on the day. If you come in the morning, they only have almond jelly or grass jelly. I think almond jelly is the better option compared to the grass jelly. 

Parking is pretty sketchy--simply because it's street parking. When we got out of the car, a few cars we passed by had their windows broken and glass was all over the side walk, which scared us, so we needed to make this trip fast. 

Can I say aesthetically pleasing? Because IT IS. Also, this place has a bathroom which is very much needed, especially in the city. The environment was clean and the cashier was very accommodating with our questions! I ordered the decaf coffee tea with almond jelly regular sweetened and it was great! No regrets. The vibe of the place is awesome, I just wish it was in a safer-ish area---but then again, it's SF, so things like that can happen.
author: K D.

description: A great twist to your typical boba drink. Yum!
author: Lisa S.

description: Love how enthusiastic employees are. Also bomb tasting milk tea! I will definitely be back again
author: Julie N.

description: Super pretty place to hang out, but no outlets. There is wifi though! Since the store is bigger, they more food and beverage offerings, including grab-n-go. Seating is quite limited especially on their very busy weekends. Would not recommend coming here to get work done on weekends as it gets really loud and busy to the point where you can't even hear yourself think. There's a back patio with two tables as well--just be careful with the sliding door. It's a little sticky so you have to pull really hard. The drinks were fine, even more consistent than the shop in the Mission.
author: Alison M.

description:
This place serves very high quality boba!! Yes, it is more expensive than standard boba from Chinese places, but the fact that I can taste and see the difference in the quality here is worth it.

I highly recommend coming here when you're in the city.
author: Ssrajput S.

description: I was a little disappointed with this location. I'm a boba guys fan but the boba I had was hard and not chewy. It was only their soft opening so hopefully it'll get better
author: D L.

description:
My boyfriend and I really love boba guys, so we were excited to see them expanding! We've never had a problem with their teas or pearls, always fresh, delicious and consistent. So please keep in mind that this review has nothing to do with their teas, we totally recommend all of their other locations. 
Around 7:30 yesterday we made our way over to their newest location from Hayes Valley, props to it being walking distance! When you walk in you're greeted with high ceilings, a sleek design and plenty of seating. But we were also greeted by some of the rudest customer service i've ever experienced. We appreciate that the staff must have a lot to do in a day, and that a lot of the times it's hard to manage what you're doing when customers are constantly coming in and you have to leave your station in order to help them. We try to be mindful and only walk up to the counter when we know what we want to order, but when we were greeted by a woman in a tan dress our entire interaction consisted of her rolling her eyes at us, huffing, finger tapping and rushing us. We felt super uncomfortable and unwelcome at that point but besides that our tea was great as usual, I just hope that they take their customer service into consideration in the future.
author: Sylvia T.

description: Bobs guys is my favorite boba spot. However, this location steps it up a little bit with their unique drinks. I finally got to try natural taro smoothie. Sooo good if you like it natural but if your used to the powder it may be a different experience for you.
author: Anthony R.

description: Definitely the place to go for authentic tea and boba! The use all organic straus milk as well. I recommend the Jasmine milk tea or the strawberry match latte!
author: Madison K.

description: Pretty good hot match green tea with boba. Had to do 100% sweetness to avoid the bitterness of the matcha.
author: Michelle S.

description: Was walking past Boba Guys yesterday and got reminded that I read about them on Hoodline, so had to check them out. Had the Horchata with Boba and it was out of this world. The tapioca is perfect texture and the drink was sweet, but not overpowering. Also, their cups and straws are top notch. Really liked my experience and am definitely coming back!
author: Bella S.

description: Love this place. I think they've definitely tried to elevate the boba experience. I really enjoy their jasmine milk tea! The tea is fresh and flavorful, the boba is nice and chewy and the milk they use is high quality too. There are lots of places that sell bubble tea, but the quality you get here is worth the trip and if you really love boba, then it should be worth the $4-5.
author: Zoey M.

description: Let me just start off this post by saying I have tried many many Boba shops in SF... and have never liked it.  When I saw Boba Guys opening up in the neighborhood my husband works (where I visit many days of the week) I was very skeptical.  I assumed I would try it once and move on with my life.  A few days after they opened I decided to give it a go.  I told the cashier that I had struggled to find a boba tea that I like.  She recommended I go with the classic milk tea. When I received my tea (only a few minutes later) I was extremely impressed.  For the first time ever I liked it! The boba was sweet and the drink was so delicious.  I highly recommend trying it.  Even my husband likes it (who only drinks water).  I pretty much come at least once a week now.  So good!  Boba Guys... you have changed my boba life!
author: Rachel B.

description: Sigh. I crave this place, oh pricy boba I love you so. They have a handful of no caffeine options, the black lavender tea is so good. They make it just the right about if milky and have vegan options if you don't do dairy. The coffee with black tea drink is really tasty. Like most boba places you can mess with levels of sweetness and they will happily remake your drink if it's not right. The line moves quickly, this place is on point.
author: A S.

description: Love the space and that we have a boba place so close to work! Went with some coworkers and tried their Strawberry Tea Fresca (very refreshing) and their Salmon onigiri (instagram worthy). Will definitely be back to try their other varieties.
author: Carolyn J.

description:
This is a bit of a sad occasion - you can see from my previous review that I'm normally a HUGE Boba Guys fan, and I come here quite a lot (like, on a nearly weekly basis). Unfortunately, that means I've come here often enough to have some really questionable experiences that make me think the staff is no longer dedicated to quality (even if their ingredients are still high quality).

Let's go through the points, shall we:

1) Discovering white, chewy mystery blobs in my Jasmine milk tea (I ordered grass jelly, which is a dark color so ???)
2) The water pitcher in the downtown location was growing mold (I don't think they've ever refrigerated it, and it's definitely not an NSF-certified filter)
3) The water dispenser at this location was once chock-full of mystery contaminants (a lot of black stuff floating in it) - they ended up dumping the whole container
4) Getting sick from drinking their boba at a catered event
5) 80% of the time, the boba pearls are maddeningly inconsistent - some pearls will be just right, some overcooked, and some undercooked (and hard!). This is rather baffling because this will all be in a single cup, so it's not like it was a bad batch or something. Are they just... not stirring it enough as it cooks? I'm really wondering. This makes it really hard to recommend their boba though unless it's freshly made (ie. at opening, or if you happen to get lucky later in the day).
6) Every single "premium" milk tea I've ordered has been weak as hell - you're basically just drinking tinted milk for more money. Their standard offerings are the expected strength.
7) Their jellies sometimes have really hard / chewy / undercooked bits in them, which makes for an unpleasant surprise.
8) A lot of the baristas are *hella* sloppy - splashing water, tea, milk, sugar, and dish soap / cleaner everywhere as they make drinks. The latter part is the main concern - I've seen some baristas splashing stuff into other peoples' drinks-in-waiting as they work on an order, which seems like a pretty bad health code violation? I dunno. Pretty much every other boba place I've ever been to is more careful than this Boba Guys.
9) The sweetness levels vary wildly - a lot of times my 50% sweet drink will come out tasting like an 80%, and a 25% will come out tasting like a 5%. I've watched how they do sweetness levels (using a pump to get syrup into the cup), and I'm not surprised this happens - a lot of baristas seem to just wildly smack the pump and not measure the resulting syrup output - real dedication to quality there, y'all.
10) I've seen baristas leave milk out unrefrigerated for long stretches of time. Hmmm.

And as a bonus non-food related thing, they never put out nonslip mats on the floor when it rains - they have a tile floor, so this means the whole place is a slip-n-slide on rainy days. I mean, I get that it hardly ever rains here, but this seems like a pretty basic thing.

All in all, this might seem like a series of minor nitpicks, and for most businesses that's probably all it'd be - but since Boba Guys pride themselves on "serving the highest quality bubble tea in the world," it's incredibly disappointing to see what's become of them. I really hope they take this feedback to heart and make sure their staff actually *practices* quality instead of just preaching it.
author: M. Q.

description: larger location, now with expanded menu.  usually sticking with the tea frescas, nice raspberry pineapple version with aloes, if you get the milk teas, the strauss half and half starts to dominate over other taste.  consistent pearls and expanded to NYC.
author: Rob C.

description: This is my favorite boba place in the city, or maybe anywhere. First, the product is great. Great teas and boba/jelly. But second, the customer service really does it for me. That they don't charge extra for almond or soy milk really flutters my lactose intolerant heart. They let you mix boba and jelly without charging extra. When I ask for no ice because it makes the tea too cold they don't give you less tea (side eye Asha). Plus the youngsters who work here are always friendly and gracious. When it comes down to it for me it's not about the prices (I'm still prepared to spend about $5 for my specialty tea drink), it's about the hospitable attitude towards customers. Keep up the good work!
author: Aya W.

description: Came here after work over the weekend paid close to $10 for two drinks. Which is pretty pricey for two drinks. Drink we're alright but the complaint I have to make is that the boba either was old or not cooked properly. There were super hard where I just wanted to spit them out. I've been to many boba places and for people to rave about the drinks here I would think there boba lives to the expectations
author: J W.

description: Forget about the staff following your instructions for your ordered food or drink (warm, toasted, non-sweetened, etc)... you'll get what they want to give you.
author: Giovanni G.

description: Strawberry matcha latte all the way! I thought it was a weird combo at first, but it's so good! The strawberries taste legit, not super artificial. It's a strawberry puree with matcha. The combo is really good! One bad thing is a long wait on some days.
author: Julie T.

description: Hands down to the best boba in SF. Their teas are freshly brewed, boba are chewy. It usually has a long line of waiting but it's worth it. I recommend to try their jasmine milk tea with almond milk + boba + almond jelly (you'll love it)
author: Anne T.

description: This place is the bomb! Michelle did a wonderful job. The boba was really chewy and the tea was perfect. Strawberry matcha latte was very good. Yum!
author: ivy v.

description: Liked the decor and merchandise rather than the boba. I had a classic black tea and it was too watery and the boba was hard.
author: M.A. L.

description: First time ever at Boba Guys and I can finally say I get why there is/was a hype to this (3 stores in SF are already and I think they told me they were going to open another one?). Yes, it is a bit more on the pricier end for boba, but some of the flavors they have here are so unique so why not splurge a little for something different. With a recommendation from Mark the bobarista, I got the Muscat Oolong Milk Tea (w/ less sweetness I believe) which as he described it, had a bit of a taste of moscato. When I had my first sip, I was like OH NO...because I actually have a thing against grape flavored anything so I was like I did not think this one through haha. However, the more I drank it, the more I enjoyed it since the grape flavor was much more subtle overtime and it didn't taste artificial at all. I definitely want to get the Golden Honey Black Milk Tea next time- premium teas are just simply on another level in terms of flavor and depth. Plus this was the other flavor I had asked about, but obviously went for the Muscat Oolong instead. Definitely get less sweetness on the drinks as I was told that that 100%/ normal sweet is often too sweet for most people!
author: Daicy L.

description: Tends to always have a line! One less star because they never seem to have enough staff or they just really need to open up a second register. There is only one register and the drinks normally take 5-10 minutes. I think having a second register and more people working would really lessen the line. Their drinks and boba are pretty consistent though so I will keep coming back!
author: Jessica W.

description: Great milk tea. Some of the best ones out there. Really fresh. However, boba is their weakness. Too tender. Hard to chew. They call themselves boba guys but the boba is not their forte.
author: J C.

description: Delicious. Best boba in town with great choices on the menu. They seem genuinely passionate about making the most authentic tea with the best ingredients.
author: Joe S.

description: Incredible Tea great ambiance - Loved the drinks but most of all the managers name is Benjamin red headed guy speaks Chinese - provided me the very best service . . . Ill definitely be comin back
author: Hooman K.

description: I've lived in Calgary, Seattle, China, and now San Francisco. Boba Guys is my favorite bubble tea venue because of the customer service and quality of drink. Organic milk is a huge plus and almond/soy options are also offered at no extra charge. The best part about the drink is the perfect milk to tea ratio as well as the superb texture of tapioca. I also enjoyed this location compared to other Boba Guys because of the short lines.
author: MattandMel H.
